Text

Book I [I.]509-i. On a January evening of the early seventies , [Christine Nilsson]210-christine nilsson was singing in Faust at [the Academy of Music in [New York]2-new york]1-the academy of music in new york . Though there was already talk of the erection , in remote metropolitan distances " above the Forties , "[211-conservatives] of [a new Opera House]510-a new opera house which should compete in costliness and splendour with those of [the great European capitals]511-the great european capitals , the world of fashion was still content to reassemble every winter in the shabby red and gold boxes of [the sociable old Academy]512-the sociable old academy . [Conservatives]211-conservatives cherished [it]510-a new opera house for being small and inconvenient , and thus keeping out [the " new people "[211-conservatives] whom [New York]2-new york was beginning to dread and yet be drawn to]513-the " new people " whom new york was beginning to dread and yet be drawn to ; and the sentimental clung to [it]510-a new opera house for [its]510-a new opera house historic associations , and the musical for its excellent acoustics , always so problematic a quality in [halls]514-halls built for the hearing of music . It was [Madame Nilsson]212-madame nilsson 's first appearance that winter , and what the daily press had already learned to describe as " [an exceptionally brilliant audience "]3087-an exceptionally brilliant audience "[212-madame nilsson] had gathered to hear [her]212-madame nilsson , transported through [the slippery , snowy streets]515-the slippery , snowy streets in private broughams , in [the spacious family landau]516-the spacious family landau , or in the humbler but more convenient " Brown coupe . "[212-madame nilsson] To come to [the Opera]517-the opera in [a Brown coupe]518-a brown coupe was almost as honourable a way of arriving as in [[one]519-one 's own carriage]520-one 's own carriage ; and departure by the same means had the immense advantage of enabling [one]519-one ( with a playful allusion to democratic principles ) to scramble into the first Brown conveyance in the line , instead of waiting till the cold - and - gin congested nose of [[one]519-one 's own coachman]523-one 's own coachman gleamed under [the portico of [the Academy]525-the academy]524-the portico of the academy . It was one of [the great livery - stableman]526-the great livery - stableman 's most masterly intuitions to have discovered that [Americans]213-americans want to get away from amusement even more quickly than [they]213-americans want to get to it . When [Newland Archer]214-archer opened the door at the back of the club box the curtain had just gone up on the garden scene . There was no reason why [the young man]527-the young man should not have come earlier , for [he]527-the young man had dined at seven , alone with [[his]527-the young man mother]528-his mother and [sister]529-sister , and had lingered afterward over a cigar in [the Gothic library]530-the gothic library with glazed black - walnut bookcases and finial - topped chairs which was [the only room in [the house]532-the house where [Mrs. Archer]214-archer allowed smoking]531-the only room in the house where mrs. archer allowed smoking . But , in the first place , [New York]2-new york was [a metropolis]533-a metropolis , and perfectly aware that in [metropolises]534-metropolises [it]535-it was " not the thing "[527-the young man] to arrive early at the opera ; and what was or was not " the thing "[527-the young man] played a part as important in [[Newland Archer]214-archer 's [New York]2-new york]536-newland archer 's new york as the inscrutable totem terrors that had ruled the destinies of [[his]527-the young man forefathers]537-his forefathers thousands of years ago . The second reason for [his]527-the young man delay was a personal one . [He]527-the young man had dawdled over [his]527-the young man cigar because [he]527-the young man was at heart [a dilettante]538-a dilettante , and thinking over a pleasure to come often gave [him]527-the young man a subtler satisfaction than its realisation . This was especially the case when the pleasure was a delicate one , as [his]527-the young man pleasures mostly were ; and on this occasion the moment [he]527-the young man looked forward to was so rare and exquisite in quality that -- well , if [he]527-the young man had timed [his]527-the young man arrival in accord with [[the prima donna]539-the prima donna 's stage]540-the prima donna 's stage - manager [he]527-the young man could not have entered [the Academy]525-the academy at a more significant moment than just as [she]539-the prima donna was singing : " [He]527-the young man loves [me]539-the prima donna -- [he]527-the young man loves [me]539-the prima donna not -- [HE]527-the young man LOVES [ME!--]3088-me!-- "[539-the prima donna] and sprinkling the falling daisy petals with notes as clear as dew . [She]539-the prima donna sang , of course , " M'ama ! "[539-the prima donna] and not " [he]527-the young man loves [me]539-the prima donna , "[539-the prima donna] since an unalterable and unquestioned law of the musical world required that the German text of French operas sung by [Swedish artists]542-swedish artists should be translated into Italian for the clearer understanding of [English - speaking audiences]543-english - speaking audiences . This seemed as natural to [Newland Archer]214-archer as all the other conventions on which [his]527-the young man life was moulded : such as the duty of using two silver - backed brushes with [his]527-the young man monogram in blue enamel to part [his]527-the young man hair , and of never appearing in society without a flower ( preferably a gardenia ) in [his]527-the young man buttonhole . " M'ama ... non m'ama ... "[539-the prima donna] [the prima donna]539-the prima donna sang , and " M'ama ! "[539-the prima donna] , with a final burst of love triumphant , as [she]539-the prima donna pressed the dishevelled daisy to [her]539-the prima donna lips and lifted [her]539-the prima donna large eyes to the sophisticated countenance of the little brown [Faust - Capoul]215-faust , who was vainly trying , in a tight purple velvet doublet and plumed cap , to look as pure and true as [[his]215-faust artless victim]545-his artless victim . [Newland Archer]214-archer , leaning against the wall at the back of [the club box]546-the club box , turned [his]527-the young man eyes from [the stage]547-the stage and scanned the opposite side of [the house]532-the house . Directly facing [him]527-the young man was the box of [old Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott , whose monstrous obesity had long since made it impossible for [her]216-mrs. manson mingott to attend the Opera , but who was always represented on fashionable nights by [some of [the younger members of [the family]551-the family]550-the younger members of the family]549-some of the younger members of the family . On this occasion , the front of the box was filled by [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott daughter - in - law]552-her daughter - in - law , [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]217-mrs. lovell mingott , and [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott daughter]553-her daughter , [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland ; and slightly withdrawn behind [these brocaded matrons]554-these brocaded matrons sat [a young girl in white with eyes ecstatically fixed on the stagelovers]555-a young girl in white with eyes ecstatically fixed on the stagelovers . As [Madame Nilsson]212-madame nilsson 's " M'ama ! "[212-madame nilsson] thrilled out above [the silent house]556-the silent house ( the boxes always stopped talking during the Daisy Song ) a warm pink mounted to [the girl]557-the girl 's cheek , mantled [her]557-the girl brow to the roots of [her]557-the girl fair braids , and suffused the young slope of [her]557-the girl breast to the line where it met a modest tulle tucker fastened with a single gardenia . [She]557-the girl dropped [her]557-the girl eyes to the immense bouquet of lilies - of - [the - valley]558-the - valley on [her]557-the girl knee , and [Newland Archer]214-archer saw [her]557-the girl white - gloved finger - tips touch the flowers softly . [He]559-his drew a breath of satisfied vanity and [his]559-his eyes returned to [the stage]547-the stage . No expense had been spared on the setting , which was acknowledged to be very beautiful even by [people who shared [his]559-his acquaintance with [the Opera houses of [Paris]3-paris and [Vienna]4-vienna]562-the opera houses of paris and vienna]561-people who shared his acquaintance with the opera houses of paris and vienna . The foreground , to the footlights , was covered with emerald green cloth . In the middle distance symmetrical mounds of woolly green moss bounded by croquet hoops formed the base of shrubs shaped like orange - trees but studded with large pink and red roses . Gigantic pansies , considerably larger than the roses , and closely resembling the floral pen - wipers made by [female parishioners]563-female parishioners for [fashionable clergymen]564-fashionable clergymen , sprang from the moss beneath the rose - trees ; and here and there a daisy grafted on a rose - branch flowered with a luxuriance prophetic of [Mr. Luther Burbank]219-mr. luther burbank 's far - off prodigies . In the centre of [this enchanted garden]565-this enchanted garden [Madame Nilsson]212-madame nilsson , in white cashmere slashed with pale blue satin , a reticule dangling from a blue girdle , and large yellow braids carefully disposed on each side of [her]212-madame nilsson muslin chemisette , listened with downcast eyes to [M. Capoul]220-m. capoul 's impassioned wooing , and affected a guileless incomprehension of [his]559-his designs whenever , by word or glance , [he]559-his persuasively indicated the ground floor window of [the neat brick villa]566-the neat brick villa projecting obliquely from the right wing . " [The darling]3089-the darling ! "[559-his] thought [Newland Archer]214-archer , [his]559-his glance flitting back to [the young girl with the lilies - of - [the - valley]558-the - valley]567-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley . " [She]567-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley does n't even guess what it 's all about . "[559-his] And [he]559-his contemplated [her]567-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley absorbed young face with a thrill of possessorship in which pride in [his]559-his own masculine initiation was mingled with a tender reverence for [her]567-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley abysmal purity . " [We]3090-we 'll read [Faust]215-faust together ... by [the Italian lakes]3091-the italian lakes ... "[559-his] [he]559-his thought , somewhat hazily confusing the scene of [his]559-his projected honey - moon with the masterpieces of literature which it would be [his]559-his manly privilege to reveal to [[his]559-his bride]569-his bride . It was only that afternoon that [May Welland]221-may had let [him]559-his guess that [she]567-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley " cared "[567-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley] ( [New York]2-new york 's consecrated phrase of [maiden avowal]570-maiden avowal ) , and already [his]559-his imagination , leaping ahead of the engagement ring , the betrothal kiss and the march from [Lohengrin]222-lohengrin , pictured [her]567-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley at [his]559-his side in some scene of old European witchery . [He]559-his did not in the least wish [the future Mrs. Newland Archer]214-archer to be [a simpleton]571-a simpleton . [He]559-his meant [her]567-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley ( thanks to [his]559-his enlightening companionship ) to develop a social tact and readiness of wit enabling [her]567-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley to hold [her]567-the young girl with the lilies - of - the - valley own with [the most popular married women of [the " younger set]3093-the " younger set]3092-the most popular married women of the " younger set , "[559-his] in which it was the recognised custom to attract masculine homage while playfully discouraging it . If [he]559-his had probed to the bottom of [his]559-his vanity ( as [he]559-his sometimes nearly did ) [he]559-his would have found there the wish that [[his]559-his wife]572-his wife should be as worldly - wise and as eager to please as [the married lady whose charms had held [his]559-his fancy through two mildly agitated years]573-the married lady whose charms had held his fancy through two mildly agitated years ; without , of course , any hint of the frailty which had so nearly marred [that unhappy being]574-that unhappy being 's life , and had disarranged [his]559-his own plans for a whole winter . How this miracle of fire and ice was to be created , and to sustain itself in [a harsh world]575-a harsh world , [he]559-his had never taken the time to think out ; but [he]559-his was content to hold [his]559-his view without analysing it , since [he]559-his knew it was that of [all the carefully - brushed , white - waistcoated , button - hole - flowered gentlemen who succeeded [each other in the club box]577-each other in the club box]576-all the carefully - brushed , white - waistcoated , button - hole - flowered gentlemen who succeeded each other in the club box , exchanged friendly greetings with [him]559-his , and turned [their]576-all the carefully - brushed , white - waistcoated , button - hole - flowered gentlemen who succeeded each other in the club box opera - glasses critically on [the circle of [ladies who were the product of the system]579-ladies who were the product of the system]578-the circle of ladies who were the product of the system . In matters intellectual and artistic [Newland]214-archer [Archer]214-archer felt [himself]214-archer distinctly the superior of these chosen specimens of old [New York]2-new york gentility ; [he]559-his had probably read more , thought more , and even seen a good deal more of [the world]580-the world , than [any other man of the number]581-any other man of the number . Singly [they]582-they betrayed [their]582-they inferiority ; but grouped together [they]582-they represented " [New York]2-new york , "[223-lawrence lefferts] and the habit of masculine solidarity made [him]559-his accept [their]582-they doctrine on all the issues called moral . [He]559-his instinctively felt that in this respect it would be troublesome -- and also rather bad form -- to strike out for [himself]559-his . " Well -- upon [my]223-lawrence lefferts soul ! "[223-lawrence lefferts] exclaimed [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts , turning [his]223-lawrence lefferts opera - glass abruptly away from the stage . [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts was , on the whole , [the foremost authority on " form "[223-lawrence lefferts] in [New York]2-new york]583-the foremost authority on " form " in new york . [He]223-lawrence lefferts had probably devoted more time than [any one else]584-any one else to the study of this intricate and fascinating question ; but study alone could not account for [his]223-lawrence lefferts complete and easy competence . [One]519-one had only to look at [him]223-lawrence lefferts , from the slant of [his]223-lawrence lefferts bald forehead and the curve of [his]223-lawrence lefferts beautiful fair moustache to the long patent - leather feet at the other end of [[his]223-lawrence lefferts lean and elegant person]586-his lean and elegant person , to feel that the knowledge of " form "[223-lawrence lefferts] must be congenital in [any one who knew how to wear such good clothes so carelessly and carry such height with so much lounging grace]587-any one who knew how to wear such good clothes so carelessly and carry such height with so much lounging grace . As [a young admirer]588-a young admirer had once said of [him]223-lawrence lefferts : " If [anybody]3094-anybody can tell [a fellow just when to wear a black tie with evening clothes]3095-a fellow just when to wear a black tie with evening clothes and when not to , it 's [Larry Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts . "[588-a young admirer] And on the question of pumps versus patent - leather " Oxfords "[223-lawrence lefferts] [his]223-lawrence lefferts authority had never been disputed . " [[My]223-lawrence lefferts God]3096-my god ! "[223-lawrence lefferts] [he]223-lawrence lefferts said ; and silently handed [his]223-lawrence lefferts glass to [old Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson . [Newland Archer]214-archer , following [Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts 's glance , saw with surprise that [his]223-lawrence lefferts exclamation had been occasioned by the entry of a new figure into [[old Mrs. Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's box]589-old mrs. mingott 's box . It was that of [a slim young woman , a little less tall than [May Welland]221-may , with brown hair growing in close curls about [her]590-a slim young woman , a little less tall than may welland , with brown hair growing in close curls about her temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds]590-a slim young woman , a little less tall than may welland , with brown hair growing in close curls about her temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds . [The wearer of this unusual dress]591-the wearer of this unusual dress , who seemed quite unconscious of the attention it was attracting , stood a moment in the centre of the box , discussing with [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland the propriety of taking [the latter]592-the latter 's place in the front right - hand corner ; then [she]590-a slim young woman , a little less tall than may welland , with brown hair growing in close curls about her temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds yielded with a slight smile , and seated [herself]590-a slim young woman , a little less tall than may welland , with brown hair growing in close curls about her temples and held in place by a narrow band of diamonds in line with [[Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland 's sister - in - law]593-mrs. welland 's sister - in - law , [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]217-mrs. lovell mingott , who was installed in the opposite corner . [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson had returned the opera - glass to [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts . [The whole of the club]594-the whole of the club turned instinctively , waiting to hear what [the old man]595-the old man had to say ; for [old Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson was as great an authority on " [family]3097-family "[224-mr. jackson] as [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts was on " form . "[224-mr. jackson] [He]224-mr. jackson knew all the ramifications of [[New York]2-new york 's cousinships]596-new york 's cousinships ; and could not only elucidate such complicated questions as that of the connection between [the Mingotts]226-the mingotts ( through [the Thorleys]227-the thorleys ) with [the Dallases of [South Carolina]6-south carolina]597-the dallases of south carolina , and that of the relationship of [the elder branch of [Philadelphia Thorleys]7-philadelphia thorleys]598-the elder branch of philadelphia thorleys to the [Albany]8-albany Chiverses ( on no account to be confused with [the Manson Chiverses of [University Place]10-university place]9-the manson chiverses of university place ) , but could also enumerate the leading characteristics of [each family]599-each family : as , for instance , the fabulous stinginess of [the younger lines of [Leffertses]284-the lawrence leffertses]600-the younger lines of leffertses ( [the Long Island ones]601-the long island ones ) ; or the fatal tendency of [the Rushworths]228-the rushworths to make foolish matches ; or the insanity recurring in [every second generation of the Albany Chiverses , with whom [[their]602-every second generation of the albany chiverses , with whom their new york cousins [New York]2-new york cousins]603-their new york cousins]602-every second generation of the albany chiverses , with whom their new york cousins had always refused to intermarry -- with the disastrous exception of [poor Medora Manson]229-medora manson , who , as [everybody]604-everybody knew ... but then [[her]229-medora manson mother]605-her mother was [a Rushworth]606-a rushworth . In addition to this forest of family trees , [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson carried between [his]224-mr. jackson narrow hollow temples , and under [his]224-mr. jackson soft thatch of silver hair , a register of most of the scandals and mysteries that had smouldered under the unruffled surface of [New York]2-new york society within the last fifty years . So far indeed did [his]224-mr. jackson information extend , and so acutely retentive was [his]224-mr. jackson memory , that [he]224-mr. jackson was supposed to be [the only man who could have told [you]608-you who [Julius Beaufort]230-beaufort , [the banker]609-the banker , really was , and what had become of [handsome Bob Spicer]231-handsome bob spicer , [old [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's father]610-old mrs. manson mingott 's father , who had disappeared so mysteriously ( with a large sum of trust money ) less than a year after [his]610-old mrs. manson mingott 's father marriage , on the very day that a beautiful Spanish dancer who had been delighting thronged audiences in [the old Opera - house on [the Battery]12-the battery]611-the old opera - house on the battery]607-the only man who could have told you who julius beaufort , the banker , really was , and what had become of handsome bob spicer , old mrs. manson mingott 's father , who had disappeared so mysteriously ( with a large sum of trust money ) less than a year after his marriage , on the very day that a beautiful spanish dancer who had been delighting thronged audiences in the old opera - house on the battery had taken ship for [Cuba]13-cuba . But these mysteries , and many others , were closely locked in [Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson 's breast ; for not only did [his]224-mr. jackson keen sense of honour forbid [his]224-mr. jackson repeating anything privately imparted , but [he]224-mr. jackson was fully aware that [his]224-mr. jackson reputation for discretion increased [his]224-mr. jackson opportunities of finding out what [he]224-mr. jackson wanted to know . [The club box]546-the club box , therefore , waited in visible suspense while [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson handed back [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts 's opera - glass . "[224-mr. jackson] II . [Newland Archer]214-archer , during this brief episode , had been thrown into a strange state of embarrassment . III . It invariably happened in the same way . [Mrs. Julius Beaufort]230-beaufort , on the night of [her]230-beaufort annual ball , never failed to appear at [the Opera]517-the opera ; indeed , [she]230-beaufort always gave [her]230-beaufort ball on an Opera night in order to emphasise [her]230-beaufort complete superiority to household cares , and [her]230-beaufort possession of [a staff of [servants]707-servants competent to organise every detail of the entertainment in [her]230-beaufort absence]706-a staff of servants competent to organise every detail of the entertainment in her absence . [[The Beauforts]246-the beauforts ' house]708-the beauforts ' house was one of [the few in [New York]2-new york]709-the few in new york that possessed [a ball - room]710-a ball - room ( [it]708-the beauforts ' house antedated even [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's and [the Headly Chiverses]247-the headly chiverses ' ) ; and at a time when it was beginning to be thought " provincial "[246-the beauforts] to put a " crash "[246-the beauforts] over the drawing - room floor and move the furniture [upstairs]711-upstairs , the possession of [a ball - room that was used for no other purpose , and left for three - hundred - and - sixty - four days of the year to shuttered darkness , with [its]708-the beauforts ' house gilt chairs stacked in a corner and [its]708-the beauforts ' house chandelier in a bag]712-a ball - room that was used for no other purpose , and left for three - hundred - and - sixty - four days of the year to shuttered darkness , with its gilt chairs stacked in a corner and its chandelier in a bag ; this undoubted superiority was felt to compensate for whatever was regrettable in the [Beaufort]230-beaufort past . [Mrs. Archer]214-archer , who was fond of coining [her]214-archer social philosophy into axioms , had once said : " [We]3122-we all have [[our]3122-we pet common people--]3123-our pet common people-- "[214-archer] and though the phrase was a daring one , its truth was secretly admitted in many an exclusive bosom . But [the Beauforts]246-the beauforts were not exactly common ; [some people]713-some people said [they]713-some people were even worse . [Mrs. Beaufort]230-beaufort belonged indeed to [one of [[America]25-america 's most honoured families]715-america 's most honoured families]714-one of america 's most honoured families ; [she]230-beaufort had been the lovely [Regina Dallas]248-regina ( of [the South Carolina branch]716-the south carolina branch ) , [a penniless beauty introduced to [New York]2-new york society]717-a penniless beauty introduced to new york society by [[her]230-beaufort cousin]690-her cousin , [the imprudent [Medora Manson]229-medora manson , who was always doing the wrong thing from the right motive]229-medora manson . When [one]519-one was related to [the Mansons]249-the mansons and [the Rushworths]228-the rushworths [one]519-one had a " droit de cite "[224-mr. jackson] ( as [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson , who had frequented [the Tuileries]26-the tuileries , called it ) in [New York]2-new york society ; but did [one]519-one not forfeit it in marrying [Julius Beaufort]230-beaufort ? The question was : who was [Beaufort]230-beaufort ? [He]721-his passed for [an Englishman]722-an englishman , was agreeable , handsome , ill - tempered , hospitable and witty . [He]721-his had come to [America]25-america with letters of recommendation from [[old Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's English son - in - law]723-old mrs. manson mingott 's english son - in - law , [the banker]609-the banker , and had speedily made [himself]721-his an important position in the world of affairs ; but [his]721-his habits were dissipated , [his]721-his tongue was bitter , [his]721-his antecedents were mysterious ; and when [Medora Manson]229-medora manson announced [[her]229-medora manson cousin]690-her cousin 's engagement to [him]721-his it was felt to be one more act of folly in poor [Medora]229-medora manson 's long record of imprudences . But folly is as often justified of [[her]229-medora manson children]726-her children as wisdom , and two years after [young Mrs. Beaufort]230-beaufort 's marriage it was admitted that [she]229-medora manson had [the most distinguished house in [New York]2-new york]727-the most distinguished house in new york . [No one]619-no one knew exactly how the miracle was accomplished . [She]229-medora manson was indolent , passive , the caustic even called [her]229-medora manson dull ; but dressed like [an idol]729-an idol , hung with pearls , growing younger and blonder and more beautiful each year , [she]229-medora manson throned in [[Mr. Beaufort]250-beaufort 's heavy brown - stone palace]730-mr. beaufort 's heavy brown - stone palace , and drew all [the world]580-the world [there]732-there without lifting [her]229-medora manson jewelled little finger . [The knowing people]733-the knowing people said it was [Beaufort]250-beaufort [himself]250-beaufort who trained [the servants]734-the servants , taught [the chef]735-the chef new dishes , told [the gardeners]736-the gardeners what hot - house flowers to grow for the dinner - table and [the drawing - rooms]737-the drawing - rooms , selected [the guests]738-the guests , brewed the after - dinner punch and dictated the little notes [[his]250-beaufort wife]572-his wife wrote to [[her]572-his wife friends]740-her friends . If [he]250-beaufort did , these domestic activities were privately performed , and [he]250-beaufort presented to [the world]580-the world the appearance of [a careless and hospitable millionaire strolling into [[his]250-beaufort own drawing - room]743-his own drawing - room]742-a careless and hospitable millionaire strolling into his own drawing - room with the detachment of [an invited guest]744-an invited guest , and saying : " [[My]250-beaufort wife]3124-my wife 's gloxinias are a marvel , are n't [they]3125-they ? [I]250-beaufort believe [she]3124-my wife gets them out from [Kew]27-kew . "[250-beaufort] [Mr. Beaufort]250-beaufort 's secret , [people]637-people were agreed , was the way [he]250-beaufort carried things off . It was all very well to whisper that [he]250-beaufort had been " helped "[250-beaufort] to leave [England]28-england by [the international banking - house in which [he]250-beaufort had been employed]746-the international banking - house in which he had been employed ; [he]250-beaufort carried off that rumour as easily as the rest -- though [New York]2-new york 's business conscience was no less sensitive than its moral standard -- [he]250-beaufort carried everything before [him]250-beaufort , and all [New York]2-new york into [[his]250-beaufort drawing - rooms]747-his drawing - rooms , and for over twenty years now [people]637-people had said [they]637-people were " going to [the Beauforts]246-the beauforts ' "[637-people] with the same tone of security as if [they]637-people had said [they]637-people were going to [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's , and with the added satisfaction of knowing [they]637-people would get hot canvas - back ducks and vintage wines , instead of tepid Veuve Clicquot without a year and warmed - up croquettes from [Philadelphia]29-philadelphia . [Mrs. Beaufort]230-beaufort , then , had as usual appeared in [her]230-beaufort box just before the Jewel Song ; and when , again as usual , [she]230-beaufort rose at the end of the third act , drew [her]230-beaufort opera cloak about [her]230-beaufort lovely shoulders , and disappeared , [New York]2-new york knew that meant that half an hour later the ball would begin . [The Beaufort house]749-the beaufort house was one that [New Yorkers]750-new yorkers were proud to show to [foreigners]751-foreigners , especially on the night of the annual ball . [The Beauforts]246-the beauforts had been among [the first people in [New York]2-new york]752-the first people in new york to own [their]246-the beauforts own red velvet carpet and have it rolled down the steps by [[their]246-the beauforts own footmen]753-their own footmen , under [their]246-the beauforts own awning , instead of hiring it with the supper and the ball - room chairs . [They]637-people had also inaugurated the custom of letting [the ladies]754-the ladies take [their]754-the ladies cloaks off in [the hall]755-the hall , instead of shuffling up to [[the hostess]756-the hostess 's bedroom]757-the hostess 's bedroom and recurling [their]754-the ladies hair with the aid of the gas - burner ; [Beaufort]230-beaufort was understood to have said that [he]758-he supposed all [[his]758-he wife 's friends]759-his wife 's friends had [maids who saw to it that [they]760-maids who saw to it that they were properly coiffees when they left home were properly coiffees when [they]760-maids who saw to it that they were properly coiffees when they left home left [home]649-home]760-maids who saw to it that they were properly coiffees when they left home . Then [the house]532-the house had been boldly planned with [a ball - room]710-a ball - room , so that , instead of squeezing through [a narrow passage]764-a narrow passage to get to [it]710-a ball - room ( as at [the Chiverses]247-the headly chiverses ' ) one marched solemnly down a vista of [enfiladed drawing - rooms]765-enfiladed drawing - rooms ( the sea - green , the crimson and the bouton d'or ) , seeing from afar the many - candled lustres reflected in the polished parquetry , and beyond that the depths of [a conservatory where camellias and tree - ferns arched their costly foliage over seats of black and gold bamboo]766-a conservatory where camellias and tree - ferns arched their costly foliage over seats of black and gold bamboo . [Newland Archer]214-archer , as became [a young man of [his]767-a young man of his position position]767-a young man of his position , strolled in somewhat late . [He]767-a young man of his position had left [his]767-a young man of his position overcoat with [the silk - stockinged footmen]768-the silk - stockinged footmen ( the stockings were one of [Beaufort]230-beaufort 's few fatuities ) , had dawdled a while in [the library]769-the library hung with Spanish leather and furnished with [Buhl]251-buhl and malachite , where [a few men]770-a few men were chatting and putting on [their]770-a few men dancing - gloves , and had finally joined the line of [guests whom [Mrs. Beaufort]230-beaufort was receiving on the threshold of [the crimson drawing - room]772-the crimson drawing - room]771-guests whom mrs. beaufort was receiving on the threshold of the crimson drawing - room . [Archer]214-archer was distinctly nervous . [He]767-a young man of his position had not gone back to [[his]767-a young man of his position club]773-his club after the Opera ( as [the young bloods]774-the young bloods usually did ) , but , the night being fine , had walked for some distance up [Fifth Avenue]15-fifth avenue before turning back in the direction of [[the Beauforts]246-the beauforts ' house]708-the beauforts ' house . [He]767-a young man of his position was definitely afraid that [the Mingotts]226-the mingotts might be going too far ; that , in fact , [they]776-they might have [Granny Mingott]243-granny 's orders to bring [the Countess Olenska]234-the countess olenska to the ball . From the tone of the club box [he]767-a young man of his position had perceived how grave a mistake that would be ; and , though [he]767-a young man of his position was more than ever determined to " see the thing through , "[767-a young man of his position] [he]767-a young man of his position felt less chivalrously eager to champion [[his]767-a young man of his position betrothed 's cousin]777-his betrothed 's cousin than before [their]778-their brief talk at [the Opera]517-the opera . Wandering on to [the bouton d'or drawing - room]780-the bouton d'or drawing - room ( where [Beaufort]230-beaufort had had the audacity to hang " [Love Victorious]252-love victorious , "[230-beaufort] the much - discussed nude of [Bouguereau]253-bouguereau ) [Archer]214-archer found [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland and [[her]218-mrs. welland daughter]553-her daughter standing near the ball - room door . [Couples]782-couples were already gliding over the floor beyond : the light of the wax candles fell on revolving tulle skirts , on girlish heads wreathed with modest blossoms , on the dashing aigrettes and ornaments of [the young married women]783-the young married women 's coiffures , and on the glitter of highly glazed shirt - fronts and fresh glace gloves . [Miss Welland]233-miss welland , evidently about to join [the dancers]784-the dancers , hung on the threshold , [her]233-miss welland lilies - of - [the - valley]558-the - valley in [her]233-miss welland hand ( [she]233-miss welland carried no other bouquet ) , [her]233-miss welland face a little pale , [her]233-miss welland eyes burning with a candid excitement . [A group of young men]786-a group of young men and [girls]787-girls were gathered about [her]233-miss welland , and there was much hand - clasping , laughing and pleasantry on which [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland , standing slightly apart , shed the beam of a qualified approval . It was evident that [Miss Welland]233-miss welland was in the act of announcing [her]233-miss welland engagement , while [[her]553-her daughter mother]605-her mother affected the air of parental reluctance considered suitable to the occasion . [Archer]214-archer paused a moment . It was at [his]789-he express wish that the announcement had been made , and yet it was not thus that [he]789-he would have wished to have [his]789-he happiness known . To proclaim it in the heat and noise of [a crowded ball - room]790-a crowded ball - room was to rob [it]790-a crowded ball - room of the fine bloom of privacy which should belong to things nearest the heart . [His]789-he joy was so deep that this blurring of the surface left its essence untouched ; but [he]789-he would have liked to keep the surface pure too . It was something of a satisfaction to find that [May Welland]221-may shared this feeling . [Her]221-may eyes fled to [his]789-he beseechingly , and [their]791-their look said : " Remember , [we]791-their 're doing this because it 's right . "[791-their] No appeal could have found a more immediate response in [Archer]214-archer 's breast ; but [he]789-he wished that the necessity of [their]791-their action had been represented by some ideal reason , and not simply by poor [Ellen Olenska]232-ellen . [The group about [Miss Welland]233-miss welland]792-the group about miss welland made way for [him]789-he with significant smiles , and after taking [his]789-he share of the felicitations [he]789-he drew [[his]789-he betrothed]614-his betrothed into the middle of [the ball - room floor]794-the ball - room floor and put [his]789-he arm about [her]614-his betrothed waist . " Now [we]3126-we sha n't have to talk , "[789-he] [he]789-he said , smiling into [her]614-his betrothed candid eyes , as they floated away on the soft waves of [the Blue Danube]30-the blue danube . [She]614-his betrothed made no answer . [Her]614-his betrothed lips trembled into a smile , but the eyes remained distant and serious , as if bent on some ineffable vision . " [Dear]3127-dear , "[214-archer] [Archer]214-archer whispered , pressing [her]614-his betrothed to [him]789-he : it was borne in on [him]789-he that the first hours of being engaged , even if spent in [a ball - room]710-a ball - room , had in [them]796-them something grave and sacramental . What a new life it was going to be , with this whiteness , radiance , goodness at one 's side ! The dance over , [the two]797-the two , as became [an affianced couple]798-an affianced couple , wandered into [the conservatory]799-the conservatory ; and sitting behind a tall screen of tree - ferns and camellias [Newland]214-archer pressed [her]614-his betrothed gloved hand to [his]789-he lips . " [You]214-archer see [I]614-his betrothed did as [you]789-he asked [me]614-his betrothed to , "[614-his betrothed] [she]614-his betrothed said . " Yes : [I]789-he could n't wait , "[789-he] [he]789-he answered smiling . After a moment [he]789-he added : " Only [I]789-he wish it had n't had to be at a ball . "[789-he] " Yes , [I]614-his betrothed know . "[614-his betrothed] [She]614-his betrothed met [his]789-he glance comprehendingly . " But after all -- even here [we]3128-we 're alone together , are n't [we]3128-we ? "[614-his betrothed] " Oh , dearest -- always ! "[214-archer] [Archer]214-archer cried . Evidently [she]614-his betrothed was always going to understand ; [she]614-his betrothed was always going to say the right thing . The discovery made the cup of [his]789-he bliss overflow , and [he]789-he went on gaily : " The worst of it is that [I]789-he want to kiss [you]614-his betrothed and [I]789-he ca n't . "[789-he] As [he]789-he spoke [he]789-he took a swift glance about [the conservatory]799-the conservatory , assured [himself]789-he of [their]801-their momentary privacy , and catching [her]614-his betrothed to [him]789-he laid a fugitive pressure on [her]614-his betrothed lips . [She]614-his betrothed sat silent , and [the world]580-the world lay like [a sunlit valley]805-a sunlit valley at [their]801-their feet . " Did [you]789-he tell [[my]614-his betrothed cousin]3114-my cousin [Ellen]232-ellen ? "[614-his betrothed] [she]614-his betrothed asked presently , as if [she]614-his betrothed spoke through a dream . [He]789-he roused [himself]789-he , and remembered that [he]789-he had not done so . " No -- [I]789-he had n't the chance after all , "[789-he] [he]789-he said , fibbing hastily . " Ah . "[789-he] [She]614-his betrothed looked disappointed , but gently resolved on gaining [her]614-his betrothed point . " [You]789-he must , then , for [I]614-his betrothed did n't either ; and [I]614-his betrothed should n't like [her]3114-my cousin to think-- "[614-his betrothed] " Of course not . But are n't [you]789-he , after all , [the person to do it]3130-the person to do it ? "[614-his betrothed] [She]614-his betrothed pondered on this . " If [I]614-his betrothed 'd done it at the right time , yes : but now that there 's been a delay [I]614-his betrothed think [you]789-he must explain that [I]614-his betrothed 'd asked [you]789-he to tell [her]3114-my cousin at [the Opera]517-the opera , before [our]3132-our speaking about it to [everybody here]3119-everybody here . Otherwise [she]3114-my cousin might think [I]614-his betrothed had forgotten [her]3114-my cousin . [You]789-he see , [she]3114-my cousin 's [one of [the family]551-the family]3134-one of the family , and [she]3114-my cousin 's been away so long that [she]3114-my cousin 's rather -- sensitive . "[614-his betrothed] [Archer]214-archer looked at [her]614-his betrothed glowingly . " [Dear and great angel]3136-dear and great angel ! Of course [I]807-i 'll tell [her]3114-my cousin . "[807-i] [He]807-i glanced a trifle apprehensively toward [the crowded ball - room]808-the crowded ball - room . " But [I]807-i have n't seen [her]3114-my cousin yet . Has [she]3114-my cousin come ? "[807-i] " No ; at the last minute [she]3114-my cousin decided not to . "[807-i] " At the last minute ? " But suddenly [she]3114-my cousin made up [her]3114-my cousin mind that [her]3114-my cousin dress was n't smart enough for a ball , though [we]811-we thought it so lovely ; and so [[my]809-the young girl aunt]3137-my aunt had to take [her]3114-my cousin [home]649-home . "[809-the young girl] " Oh , well-- "[214-archer] said [Archer]214-archer with happy indifference . " [She]3114-my cousin knows as well as [I]807-i do , "[807-i] [he]807-i reflected , " the real reason of [[her]3114-my cousin cousin]690-her cousin 's staying away ; but [I]807-i shall never let [her]3114-my cousin see by the least sign that [I]807-i am conscious of there being a shadow of a shade on poor [Ellen Olenska]232-ellen 's reputation . "[807-i] IV . In the course of the next day the first of the usual betrothal visits were exchanged . The [New York]2-new york ritual was precise and inflexible in such matters ; and in conformity with it [Newland Archer]214-archer first went with [[his]807-i mother]528-his mother and [sister]529-sister to call on [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland , after which [he]807-i and [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland and [May]221-may drove out to [old [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's]814-old mrs. manson mingott 's to receive [that venerable ancestress]815-that venerable ancestress 's blessing . A visit to [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott was always an amusing episode to [the young man]527-the young man . [The house]532-the house in itself was already an historic document , though not , of course , as venerable as [certain other old family houses in [University Place]10-university place and lower [Fifth Avenue]15-fifth avenue]818-certain other old family houses in university place and lower fifth avenue . Those were of the purest 1830 , with a grim harmony of cabbage - rose - garlanded carpets , rosewood consoles , round - arched fire - places with black marble mantels , and immense glazed book - cases of mahogany ; whereas old [Mrs. Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott , who had built [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott house]819-her house later , had bodily cast out the massive furniture of [her]216-mrs. manson mingott prime , and mingled with [the Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott heirlooms the frivolous upholstery of [the Second Empire]820-the second empire . It was [her]216-mrs. manson mingott habit to sit in a window of [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott sitting - room]821-her sitting - room on the ground floor , as if watching calmly for life and fashion to flow northward to [her]216-mrs. manson mingott solitary doors . [She]216-mrs. manson mingott seemed in no hurry to have them come , for [her]216-mrs. manson mingott patience was equalled by [her]216-mrs. manson mingott confidence . [She]216-mrs. manson mingott was sure that presently [the hoardings]822-the hoardings , [the quarries]823-the quarries , [the one - story saloons]824-the one - story saloons , [the wooden green - houses in [ragged gardens]826-ragged gardens]825-the wooden green - houses in ragged gardens , and the rocks from which [goats]827-goats surveyed the scene , would vanish before the advance of [residences]828-residences as stately as [her]216-mrs. manson mingott own -- perhaps ( for [she]216-mrs. manson mingott was [an impartial woman]829-an impartial woman ) even statelier ; and that the cobble - stones over which the old clattering omnibuses bumped would be replaced by smooth asphalt , such as [people]637-people reported having seen in [Paris]3-paris . Meanwhile , as [every one [she]216-mrs. manson mingott cared to see]831-every one she cared to see came to [HER]216-mrs. manson mingott ( and [she]216-mrs. manson mingott could fill [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott rooms]832-her rooms as easily as [the Beauforts]833-the beauforts , and without adding a single item to the menu of [her]216-mrs. manson mingott suppers ) , [she]216-mrs. manson mingott did not suffer from [her]216-mrs. manson mingott geographic isolation . The immense accretion of flesh which had descended on [her]216-mrs. manson mingott in middle life like a flood of lava on [a doomed city]834-a doomed city had changed [her]216-mrs. manson mingott from [a plump active little woman with a neatly - turned foot and ankle into something as vast and august as a natural phenomenon]835-a plump active little woman with a neatly - turned foot and ankle into something as vast and august as a natural phenomenon . [She]216-mrs. manson mingott had accepted this submergence as philosophically as all [her]216-mrs. manson mingott other trials , and now , in extreme old age , was rewarded by presenting to [her]216-mrs. manson mingott mirror an almost unwrinkled expanse of firm pink and white flesh , in the centre of which the traces of a small face survived as if awaiting excavation . A flight of smooth double chins led down to the dizzy depths of a still - snowy bosom veiled in snowy muslins that were held in place by a miniature portrait of the late [Mr. Mingott]237-mr. mingott ; and around and below , wave after wave of black silk surged away over the edges of a capacious armchair , with two tiny white hands poised like gulls on the surface of the billows . The burden of [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's flesh had long since made it impossible for [her]216-mrs. manson mingott to go up and down [stairs]836-stairs , and with characteristic independence [she]216-mrs. manson mingott had made [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott reception rooms]837-her reception rooms [upstairs]711-upstairs and established [herself]216-mrs. manson mingott ( in flagrant violation of all the New [York]32-york proprieties ) on the ground floor of [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott house]819-her house ; so that , as [you]840-you sat in [her]216-mrs. manson mingott sitting - room window with [her]216-mrs. manson mingott , [you]840-you caught ( through a door that was always open , and a looped - back yellow damask portiere ) the unexpected vista of [a bedroom]841-a bedroom with a huge low bed upholstered like a sofa , and a toilet - table with frivolous lace flounces and a gilt - framed mirror . [[Her]216-mrs. manson mingott visitors]842-her visitors were startled and fascinated by the foreignness of this arrangement , which recalled scenes in French fiction , and architectural incentives to immorality such as [the simple American]843-the simple american had never dreamed of . That was how [women]3106-women with [lovers]845-lovers lived in [the wicked old societies]846-the wicked old societies , in [apartments]847-apartments with all [the rooms on one floor]848-the rooms on one floor , and all the indecent propinquities that [their]3106-women novels described . It amused [Newland Archer]214-archer ( who had secretly situated the love - scenes of " [Monsieur de Camors]254-monsieur de camors "[850-he] in [[Mrs. Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's bedroom]849-mrs. mingott 's bedroom ) to picture [her]216-mrs. manson mingott blameless life led in the stage - setting of adultery ; but [he]850-he said to [himself]850-he , with considerable admiration , that if [a lover]851-a lover had been what [she]216-mrs. manson mingott wanted , [the intrepid woman]852-the intrepid woman would have had [him]850-he too . To the general relief [the Countess Olenska]234-the countess olenska was not present in [[[her]234-the countess olenska grandmother]853-her grandmother 's drawing - room]854-her grandmother 's drawing - room during the visit of [the betrothed couple]855-the betrothed couple . [Mrs. Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott said [she]216-mrs. manson mingott had gone out ; which , on a day of such glaring sunlight , and at the " shopping hour , "[216-mrs. manson mingott] seemed in itself an indelicate thing for [a compromised woman]856-a compromised woman to do . But at any rate it spared [them]855-the betrothed couple the embarrassment of [her]216-mrs. manson mingott presence , and the faint shadow that [her]216-mrs. manson mingott unhappy past might seem to shed on [their]855-the betrothed couple radiant future . The visit went off successfully , as was to have been expected . [Old Mrs. Mingott]235-old mrs. mingott was delighted with the engagement , which , being long foreseen by [watchful relatives]857-watchful relatives , had been carefully passed upon in [family council]858-family council ; and the engagement ring , a large thick sapphire set in invisible claws , met with [her]216-mrs. manson mingott unqualified admiration . " It 's the new setting : of course it shows the stone beautifully , but it looks a little bare to old - fashioned eyes , "[218-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland had explained , with a conciliatory side - glance at [[her]218-mrs. welland future son - in - law]697-her future son - in - law . " Old - fashioned eyes ? [I]860-the ancestress hope [you]697-her future son - in - law do n't mean [mine]860-the ancestress , [[my]860-the ancestress dear]3140-my dear ? "[860-the ancestress] and [she]860-the ancestress waved one of [her]860-the ancestress tiny hands , with small pointed nails and rolls of aged fat encircling the wrist like ivory bracelets . V. The next evening [old Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson came to dine with [the Archers]261-the newland archers . [Mrs. Archer]214-archer was [a shy woman]883-a shy woman and shrank from society ; but [she]214-archer liked to be well - informed as to its doings . [[Her]214-archer old friend]884-her old friend [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson applied to the investigation of [[his]224-mr. jackson friends]885-his friends ' affairs the patience of [a collector]886-a collector and the science of [a naturalist]887-a naturalist ; and [[his]224-mr. jackson sister]888-his sister , [Miss Sophy Jackson]262-miss jackson , who lived with [him]224-mr. jackson , and was entertained by [all the people who could not secure [[her]214-archer much - sought - after brother]890-her much - sought - after brother]889-all the people who could not secure her much - sought - after brother , brought home bits of minor gossip that filled out usefully the gaps in [his]224-mr. jackson picture . Therefore , whenever anything happened that [Mrs. Archer]214-archer wanted to know about , [she]214-archer asked [Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson to dine ; and as [she]214-archer honoured [few people]891-few people with [her]214-archer invitations , and as [she]214-archer and [[her]214-archer daughter]553-her daughter [Janey]263-janey were [an excellent audience]893-an excellent audience , [Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson usually came [himself]224-mr. jackson instead of sending [[his]224-mr. jackson sister]888-his sister . If [he]224-mr. jackson could have dictated all the conditions , [he]224-mr. jackson would have chosen the evenings when [Newland]214-archer was out ; not because [the young man]527-the young man was uncongenial to [him]224-mr. jackson ( [the two]797-the two got on capitally at [[their]797-the two club]897-their club ) but because [the old anecdotist]898-the old anecdotist sometimes felt , on [Newland]214-archer 's part , a tendency to weigh [his]224-mr. jackson evidence that [the ladies of [the family]551-the family]899-the ladies of the family never showed . [Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson , if perfection had been attainable on [earth]901-earth , would also have asked that [Mrs. Archer]214-archer 's food should be a little better . But then [New York]2-new york , as far back as the mind of [man]902-man could travel , had been divided into [the two great fundamental groups of [the Mingotts]226-the mingotts and [Mansons]249-the mansons and all [[their]797-the two clan]904-their clan , who cared about eating and clothes and money , and [the Archer]214-archer - [[Newland]214-archer - van - der -]214-archer [Luyden tribe , who were devoted to travel , horticulture and the best fiction , and looked down on the grosser forms of pleasure]905-luyden tribe , who were devoted to travel , horticulture and the best fiction , and looked down on the grosser forms of pleasure]903-the two great fundamental groups of the mingotts and mansons and all their clan , who cared about eating and clothes and money , and the archer - newland - van - der - luyden tribe , who were devoted to travel , horticulture and the best fiction , and looked down on the grosser forms of pleasure . [You]906-you could n't have everything , after all . If [you]906-you dined with [the Lovell Mingotts]226-the mingotts [you]906-you got canvas - back and terrapin and vintage wines ; at [Adeline Archer]264-adeline 's [you]906-you could talk about [Alpine scenery]907-alpine scenery and " [The Marble Faun]36-the marble faun "[264-adeline] ; and luckily [the Archer Madeira]265-the archer madeira had gone round [the Cape]37-the cape . Therefore when a friendly summons came from [Mrs. Archer]214-archer , [Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson , who was [a true eclectic]908-a true eclectic , would usually say to [[his]224-mr. jackson sister]888-his sister : " [I]224-mr. jackson 've been a little gouty since [my]224-mr. jackson last dinner at [the Lovell Mingotts'--it]266-the lovell mingotts'--it will do [me]224-mr. jackson good to diet at [Adeline]264-adeline 's . "[224-mr. jackson] [Mrs. Archer]214-archer , who had long been [a widow]910-a widow , lived with [[her]214-archer son]666-her son and daughter in [West Twenty - eighth Street]38-west twenty - eighth street . [An upper floor]912-an upper floor was dedicated to [Newland]214-archer , and [the two women]913-the two women squeezed [themselves]913-the two women into [narrower quarters below]914-narrower quarters below . In an unclouded harmony of tastes and interests [they]913-the two women cultivated ferns in Wardian cases , made macrame lace and wool embroidery on linen , collected American revolutionary glazed ware , subscribed to " Good Words , "[267-ouida] and read [Ouida]267-ouida 's novels for the sake of the Italian atmosphere . ( [They]913-the two women preferred those about peasant life , because of the descriptions of scenery and the pleasanter sentiments , though in general [they]913-the two women liked novels about [people in society , whose motives and habits were more comprehensible]915-people in society , whose motives and habits were more comprehensible , spoke severely of [Dickens]268-dickens , who " had never drawn [a gentleman]3166-a gentleman , "[268-dickens] and considered [Thackeray]269-thackeray less at [home]649-home in [the great world]917-the great world than [Bulwer]270-bulwer -- who , however , was beginning to be thought old - fashioned . ) [Mrs.]918-mrs. and [Miss Archer]271-miss archer were both [great lovers of scenery]919-great lovers of scenery . It was what [they]913-the two women principally sought and admired on [their]913-the two women occasional travels abroad ; considering architecture and painting as subjects for [men]867-men , and chiefly for [learned persons who read Ruskin]921-learned persons who read ruskin . [Mrs. Archer]214-archer had been born [a Newland]214-archer , and [mother]922-mother and [daughter , who were as like as sisters]923-daughter , who were as like as sisters , were both , as [people]637-people said , " true [Newlands]41-newlands "[922-mother] ; tall , pale , and slightly round - shouldered , with long noses , sweet smiles and a kind of drooping distinction like that in certain faded Reynolds portraits . [Their]913-the two women physical resemblance would have been complete if [an elderly embonpoint]925-an elderly embonpoint had not stretched [Mrs. Archer]214-archer 's black brocade , while [Miss Archer]271-miss archer 's brown and purple poplins hung , as the years went on , more and more slackly on [her]271-miss archer virgin frame . Mentally , the likeness between [them]913-the two women , as [Newland]214-archer was aware , was less complete than [their]913-the two women identical mannerisms often made it appear . The long habit of living together in mutually dependent intimacy had given [them]913-the two women the same vocabulary , and the same habit of beginning [their]913-the two women phrases " [Mother]922-mother thinks "[926-the other] or " [Janey]263-janey thinks , "[926-the other] according as one or [the other]926-the other wished to advance an opinion of [her]271-miss archer own ; but in reality , while [Mrs. Archer]214-archer 's serene unimaginativeness rested easily in the accepted and familiar , [Janey]263-janey was subject to starts and aberrations of fancy welling up from springs of suppressed romance . [Mother]922-mother and [daughter]928-daughter adored [each other]695-each other and revered [[their]913-the two women son]930-their son and [brother]931-brother ; and [Archer]214-archer loved [them]913-the two women with a tenderness made compunctious and uncritical by the sense of [their]913-the two women exaggerated admiration , and by [his]932-his secret satisfaction in it . After all , [he]932-his thought it a good thing for [a man]933-a man to have [his]933-a man authority respected in [[his]933-a man own house]934-his own house , even if [his]932-his sense of humour sometimes made [him]932-his question the force of [his]932-his mandate . [Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson sank into the armchair with satisfaction , lit [his]224-mr. jackson cigar with perfect confidence ( it was [Newland]214-archer who bought them ) , and stretching [his]224-mr. jackson thin old ankles to the coals , said : " [You]224-mr. jackson say [the secretary]3199-the secretary merely helped [her]214-archer to get away , [[my]224-mr. jackson dear fellow]3209-my dear fellow ? "[224-mr. jackson] VI . That evening , after [Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson had taken [himself]224-mr. jackson away , and [the ladies]754-the ladies had retired to [[their]754-the ladies chintz - curtained bedroom]989-their chintz - curtained bedroom , [Newland Archer]214-archer mounted thoughtfully to [[his]224-mr. jackson own study]990-his own study . A vigilant hand had , as usual , kept the fire alive and the lamp trimmed ; and [the room]991-the room , with [its]991-the room rows and rows of books , [its]991-the room bronze and steel statuettes of " [The Fencers]3215-the fencers "[214-archer] on the mantelpiece and [its]991-the room many photographs of famous pictures , looked singularly [home]649-home - like and welcoming . As [he]224-mr. jackson dropped into [his]224-mr. jackson armchair near the fire [his]224-mr. jackson eyes rested on a large photograph of [May Welland]221-may , which [the young girl]809-the young girl had given [him]224-mr. jackson in the first days of [their]994-their romance , and which had now displaced all the other portraits on the table . With a new sense of awe [he]224-mr. jackson looked at the frank forehead , serious eyes and gay innocent mouth of [the young creature whose soul 's custodian [he]224-mr. jackson was to be]995-the young creature whose soul 's custodian he was to be . [That terrifying product of the social system [he]224-mr. jackson belonged to and believed in]996-that terrifying product of the social system he belonged to and believed in , [the young girl who knew nothing and expected everything]997-the young girl who knew nothing and expected everything , looked back at [him]224-mr. jackson like a stranger through [May Welland]221-may 's familiar features ; and once more it was borne in on [him]224-mr. jackson that marriage was not the safe anchorage [he]224-mr. jackson had been taught to think , but a voyage on [uncharted seas]998-uncharted seas . The case of [the Countess Olenska]234-the countess olenska had stirred up old settled convictions and set them drifting dangerously through [his]224-mr. jackson mind . [His]224-mr. jackson own exclamation : " [Women]3106-women should be free -- as free as [we]3217-we are , "[224-mr. jackson] struck to the root of a problem that it was agreed in [his]224-mr. jackson world to regard as non - existent . " [Nice "[224-mr. jackson] women]3218-nice " women , however wronged , would never claim the kind of freedom [he]224-mr. jackson meant , and [generous - minded men like [himself]224-mr. jackson]999-generous - minded men like himself were therefore -- in the heat of argument -- the more chivalrously ready to concede it to [them]999-generous - minded men like himself . Such verbal generosities were in fact only a humbugging disguise of the inexorable conventions that tied things together and bound [people]637-people down to the old pattern . But here [he]224-mr. jackson was pledged to defend , on the part of [[his]224-mr. jackson betrothed 's cousin]777-his betrothed 's cousin , conduct that , on [[his]224-mr. jackson own wife]1002-his own wife 's part , would justify [him]224-mr. jackson in calling down on [her]1002-his own wife all the thunders of Church and State . Of course the dilemma was purely hypothetical ; since [he]224-mr. jackson was n't [a blackguard Polish nobleman]1003-a blackguard polish nobleman , it was absurd to speculate what [[his]224-mr. jackson wife]572-his wife 's rights would be if [he]224-mr. jackson WERE . But [Newland Archer]214-archer was too imaginative not to feel that , in [his]224-mr. jackson case and [May]221-may 's , the tie might gall for reasons far less gross and palpable . What could [he]224-mr. jackson and [she]221-may really know of [each other]695-each other , since it was [his]224-mr. jackson duty , as [a " decent "[1006-a " decent " fellow] fellow]1006-a " decent " fellow , to conceal [his]224-mr. jackson past from [her]221-may , and [hers]221-may , as [a marriageable girl]1007-a marriageable girl , to have no past to conceal ? What if , for some one of the subtler reasons that would tell with both of [them]1008-them , [they]1008-them should tire of [each other]695-each other , misunderstand or irritate [each other]695-each other ? [He]224-mr. jackson reviewed [[his]224-mr. jackson friends]885-his friends ' marriages -- [the supposedly happy ones]1012-the supposedly happy ones -- and saw none that answered , even remotely , to the passionate and tender comradeship which [he]224-mr. jackson pictured as [his]224-mr. jackson permanent relation with [May Welland]221-may . [He]224-mr. jackson perceived that such a picture presupposed , on [her]221-may part , the experience , the versatility , the freedom of judgment , which [she]221-may had been carefully trained not to possess ; and with a shiver of foreboding [he]224-mr. jackson saw [his]224-mr. jackson marriage becoming what most of the other marriages about [him]224-mr. jackson were : a dull association of material and social interests held together by ignorance on the one side and hypocrisy on the other . [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts occurred to [him]224-mr. jackson as [the husband who had most completely realised this enviable ideal]1013-the husband who had most completely realised this enviable ideal . As became [the high - priest of form]1014-the high - priest of form , [he]224-mr. jackson had formed [a wife]1015-a wife so completely to [his]224-mr. jackson own convenience that , in the most conspicuous moments of [his]224-mr. jackson frequent love - affairs with [[other men]1016-other men 's wives]1017-other men 's wives , [she]221-may went about in smiling unconsciousness , saying that " [Lawrence]223-lawrence lefferts was so frightfully strict "[221-may] ; and had been known to blush indignantly , and avert [her]221-may gaze , when [some one]687-some one alluded in [her]221-may presence to the fact that [Julius Beaufort]230-beaufort ( as became [a " foreigner "[1019-a " foreigner " of doubtful origin] of doubtful origin]1019-a " foreigner " of doubtful origin ) had what was known in [New York]2-new york as " [another establishment]3219-another establishment . "[214-archer] [Archer]214-archer tried to console [himself]214-archer with the thought that [he]224-mr. jackson was not quite such an ass as [Larry Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts , nor May such [a simpleton as [poor Gertrude]279-gertrude lefferts]1020-a simpleton as poor gertrude ; but the difference was after all one of intelligence and not of standards . In reality [they]1021-they all lived in a kind of hieroglyphic world , where the real thing was never said or done or even thought , but only represented by a set of arbitrary signs ; as when [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland , who knew exactly why [Archer]214-archer had pressed [her]218-mrs. welland to announce [[her]218-mrs. welland daughter]553-her daughter 's engagement at the [Beaufort]230-beaufort ball ( and had indeed expected [him]224-mr. jackson to do no less ) , yet felt obliged to simulate reluctance , and the air of having had [her]218-mrs. welland hand forced , quite as , in the books on Primitive Man that [people of advanced culture were beginning to read]1023-people of advanced culture were beginning to read , [the savage bride]1024-the savage bride is dragged with shrieks from [[[her]1024-the savage bride parents]1025-her parents ' tent]1026-her parents ' tent . The result , of course , was that [the young girl who was the centre of this elaborate system of mystification]1027-the young girl who was the centre of this elaborate system of mystification remained the more inscrutable for [her]1027-the young girl who was the centre of this elaborate system of mystification very frankness and assurance . [She]1027-the young girl who was the centre of this elaborate system of mystification was frank , [poor darling]1028-poor darling , because [she]1027-the young girl who was the centre of this elaborate system of mystification had nothing to conceal , assured because [she]1027-the young girl who was the centre of this elaborate system of mystification knew of nothing to be on [her]1027-the young girl who was the centre of this elaborate system of mystification guard against ; and with no better preparation than this , [she]1027-the young girl who was the centre of this elaborate system of mystification was to be plunged overnight into what [people]637-people evasively called " the facts of life . "[527-the young man] [The young man]527-the young man was sincerely but placidly in love . [He]527-the young man delighted in the radiant good looks of [[his]527-the young man betrothed]614-his betrothed , in [her]614-his betrothed health , [her]614-his betrothed horsemanship , [her]614-his betrothed grace and quickness at games , and the shy interest in books and ideas that [she]614-his betrothed was beginning to develop under [his]527-the young man guidance . ( [She]614-his betrothed had advanced far enough to join [him]527-the young man in ridiculing the Idyls of [the King]1032-the king , but not to feel the beauty of [Ulysses]280-ulysses and [the Lotus Eaters]281-the lotus eaters . ) [She]614-his betrothed was straightforward , loyal and brave ; [she]614-his betrothed had a sense of humour ( chiefly proved by [her]614-his betrothed laughing at [HIS]527-the young man jokes ) ; and [he]527-the young man suspected , in the depths of [her]614-his betrothed innocently - gazing soul , a glow of feeling that it would be a joy to waken . But when [he]527-the young man had gone the brief round of [her]614-his betrothed [he]527-the young man returned discouraged by the thought that all this frankness and innocence were only an artificial product . Untrained human nature was not frank and innocent ; it was full of the twists and defences of an instinctive guile . And [he]527-the young man felt [himself]527-the young man oppressed by this creation of factitious purity , so cunningly manufactured by a conspiracy of [mothers]1033-mothers and [aunts]1034-aunts and [grandmothers]1035-grandmothers and [long - dead ancestresses]1036-long - dead ancestresses , because it was supposed to be what [he]527-the young man wanted , what [he]527-the young man had a right to , in order that [he]527-the young man might exercise [his]527-the young man lordly pleasure in smashing it like an image made of snow . There was a certain triteness in these reflections : they were those habitual to [young men]949-young men on the approach of [their]949-young men wedding day . But [they]1038-they were generally accompanied by a sense of compunction and self - abasement of which [Newland Archer]214-archer felt no trace . [He]527-the young man could not deplore ( as [[Thackeray]269-thackeray 's heroes]1039-thackeray 's heroes so often exasperated [him]527-the young man by doing ) that [he]527-the young man had not a blank page to offer [[his]527-the young man bride]569-his bride in exchange for the unblemished one [she]569-his bride was to give to [him]527-the young man . [He]527-the young man could not get away from the fact that if [he]527-the young man had been brought up as [she]569-his bride had [they]1041-their would have been no more fit to find [their]1041-their way about than [the Babes in the Wood]1042-the babes in the wood ; nor could [he]527-the young man , for all [his]527-the young man anxious cogitations , see any honest reason ( any , that is , unconnected with [his]527-the young man own momentary pleasure , and the passion of masculine vanity ) why [[his]527-the young man bride]569-his bride should not have been allowed the same freedom of experience as [himself]527-the young man . Such questions , at such an hour , were bound to drift through [his]527-the young man mind ; but [he]527-the young man was conscious that [their]1041-their uncomfortable persistence and precision were due to the inopportune arrival of [the Countess Olenska]234-the countess olenska . Here [he]527-the young man was , at the very moment of [his]527-the young man betrothal -- a moment for pure thoughts and cloudless hopes -- pitchforked into a coil of scandal which raised all the special problems [he]527-the young man would have preferred to let lie . " [Hang Ellen Olenska]232-ellen ! "[527-the young man] [he]527-the young man grumbled , as [he]527-the young man covered [his]527-the young man fire and began to undress . [He]527-the young man could not really see why [her]234-the countess olenska fate should have the least bearing on [his]527-the young man ; yet [he]527-the young man dimly felt that [he]527-the young man had only just begun to measure the risks of the championship which [his]527-the young man engagement had forced upon [him]527-the young man . A few days later the bolt fell . [The Lovell Mingotts]226-the mingotts had sent out cards for what was known as " a formal dinner "[1044-three extra footmen] ( that is , [three extra footmen]1044-three extra footmen , two dishes for each course , and a Roman punch in the middle ) , and had headed [their]1041-their invitations with the words " To meet [the Countess Olenska]234-the countess olenska , "[618-the initiated] in accordance with the hospitable American fashion , which treats [strangers]1045-strangers as if [they]1045-strangers were [royalties]1046-royalties , or at least as [[their]1045-strangers ambassadors]1047-their ambassadors . [The guests]738-the guests had been selected with a boldness and discrimination in which [the initiated]618-the initiated recognised the firm hand of [Catherine the Great]282-catherine the great . Associated with [such immemorial standbys as [the Selfridge Merrys]283-the selfridge merrys , who were asked everywhere because [they]283-the selfridge merrys always had been , [the Beauforts , on whom there was a claim of relationship]1051-the beauforts , on whom there was a claim of relationship , and [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson and [his]224-mr. jackson sister Sophy ( who went wherever [[her]1052-her brother]975-her brother told [her]1052-her to )]1050-such immemorial standbys as the selfridge merrys , who were asked everywhere because they always had been , the beauforts , on whom there was a claim of relationship , and mr. sillerton jackson and his sister sophy ( who went wherever her brother told her to ) , were [some of the most fashionable and yet most irreproachable of [the dominant " young married "[284-the lawrence leffertses] set]1055-the dominant " young married " set]1054-some of the most fashionable and yet most irreproachable of the dominant " young married " set ; [the Lawrence Leffertses]284-the lawrence leffertses , [Mrs. Lefferts Rushworth]285-mrs. lefferts rushworth ( [the lovely widow]1056-the lovely widow ) , [the Harry Thorleys]227-the thorleys , [the Reggie Chiverses]286-the reggie chiverses and [young Morris Dagonet]287-young morris dagonet and [[his]287-young morris dagonet wife]572-his wife ( who was a van der [Luyden]498-dallas ) . The company indeed was perfectly assorted , since [all the members]1058-all the members belonged to [the little inner group of people who , during the long [New York]2-new york season]1059-the little inner group of people who , during the long new york season , disported [themselves]1059-the little inner group of people who , during the long new york season together daily and nightly with apparently undiminished zest . Forty - eight hours later the unbelievable had happened ; [every one]653-every one had refused [the Mingotts]226-the mingotts ' invitation except [the Beauforts]246-the beauforts and [old Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson and [[his]224-mr. jackson sister]888-his sister . The intended slight was emphasised by the fact that even [the Reggie Chiverses]1062-the reggie chiverses , who were of [the Mingott clan]937-the mingott clan , were among [those inflicting it]1064-those inflicting it ; and by the uniform wording of the notes , in all of which [the writers]1065-the writers " regretted that [they]1065-the writers were unable to accept , "[1065-the writers] without the mitigating plea of a " previous engagement "[1065-the writers] that ordinary courtesy prescribed . [New York]1066-new york society was , in those days , far too small , and too scant in [its]1067-its resources , for [every one in [it]1067-its]1068-every one in it ( including [livery - stable - keepers]1069-livery - stable - keepers , [butlers]1070-butlers and [cooks]1071-cooks ) not to know exactly on which evenings [people]637-people were free ; and it was thus possible for the recipients of [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]217-mrs. lovell mingott 's invitations to make cruelly clear [their]1073-their determination not to meet [the Countess Olenska]234-the countess olenska . The blow was unexpected ; but [the Mingotts]226-the mingotts , as [their]1065-the writers way was , met it gallantly . [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]217-mrs. lovell mingott confided the case to [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland , who confided it to [Newland Archer]214-archer ; who , aflame at the outrage , appealed passionately and authoritatively to [[his]1074-his mother]528-his mother ; who , after a painful period of inward resistance and outward temporising , succumbed to [his]1074-his instances ( as [she]528-his mother always did ) , and immediately embracing [his]1074-his cause with an energy redoubled by [her]528-his mother previous hesitations , put on [her]528-his mother grey velvet bonnet and said : " [I]528-his mother 'll go and see [Louisa van der Luyden]288-cousin louisa . "[528-his mother] [The [New York]2-new york of [Newland Archer]214-archer]1076-the new york of newland archer 's day was [a small and slippery pyramid , in which , as yet , hardly a fissure had been made or a foothold]1077-a small and slippery pyramid , in which , as yet , hardly a fissure had been made or a foothold gained . [People]637-people , [Mrs. Archer]214-archer always said , were not as particular as [they]637-people used to be ; and with old [Catherine Spicer]290-catherine spicer ruling [one end of [Fifth Avenue]15-fifth avenue]1083-one end of fifth avenue , and [Julius]230-beaufort Beaufort the other , [you]1084-you could n't expect the old traditions to last much longer . " Do n't tell [me]214-archer , "[214-archer] [Mrs. Archer]214-archer would say to [[her]214-archer children]726-her children , " all this modern newspaper rubbish about [a [New York]2-new york aristocracy]3221-a new york aristocracy . "[528-his mother] VII . [Mrs. Henry van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden listened in silence to [[her]297-mrs. van der luyden cousin]690-her cousin [Mrs. Archer]214-archer 's narrative . "[305-gainsborough] [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden 's portrait by [Huntington]307-huntington ( in black velvet and Venetian point ) faced that of [[her]297-mrs. van der luyden lovely ancestress]1137-her lovely ancestress .
