" [Archer]430-archer felt irrationally angry . [[His]430-archer host]1295-his host 's contemptuous tribute to [May]430-archer 's "[2057-not one of the lot] niceness " was just what [a husband]4440-a husband should have wished to hear said of [[his]4440-a husband wife]572-his wife . The fact that [a coarseminded man]4442-a coarseminded man found [her]572-his wife lacking in attraction was simply another proof of [her]572-his wife quality ; yet the words sent a faint shiver through [his]430-archer heart . What if "[2057-not one of the lot] niceness " carried to that supreme degree were only a negation , the curtain dropped before an emptiness ? As [he]430-archer looked at [May]430-archer , returning flushed and calm from [her]572-his wife final bull's - eye , [he]430-archer had the feeling that [he]430-archer had never yet lifted that curtain . "[2072-this pretty lady] What am [I]0-i ? [A son - in - law--]2073-a son - in - law-- " [Archer]430-archer thought . [The figure at the end of the pier]4514-the figure at the end of the pier had not moved . For a long moment [the young man]527-the young man stood half way down [the bank]4509-the bank , gazing at [the bay]4462-the bay furrowed with the coming and going of [sailboats]4518-sailboats , [yacht - launches]4519-yacht - launches , [fishing - craft]4520-fishing - craft and [the trailing black coal - barges hauled by noisy tugs]4521-the trailing black coal - barges hauled by noisy tugs . [The lady]681-the lady in [the summer - house]4523-the summer - house seemed to be held by the same sight . Beyond [the grey bastions of [Fort Adams]142-fort adams]4524-the grey bastions of fort adams a long - drawn sunset was splintering up into a thousand fires , and the radiance caught the sail of [a catboat]4525-a catboat as it beat out through [the channel between [the Lime Rock]138-the lime rock and [the shore]4481-the shore]4526-the channel between the lime rock and the shore . [Archer]430-archer , as [he]430-archer watched , remembered the scene in [the Shaughraun]384-the shaughraun , and [Montague]386-harry montague lifting [Ada Dyas]387-ada dyas 's ribbon to [his]386-harry montague lips without [her]387-ada dyas knowing that [he]386-harry montague was in [the room]991-the room . "[2074-she] [She]2074-she does n't know -- [she]2074-she has n't guessed . Should n't [I]0-i know if [she]2074-she came up behind [me]0-i , [I]0-i wonder ? " [he]430-archer mused ; and suddenly [he]430-archer said to [himself]430-archer : "[2074-she] If [she]2074-she does n't turn before that sail crosses the Lime Rock light [I]0-i 'll go back . " [The boat]4529-the boat was gliding out on the receding tide . It slid before [the Lime Rock]138-the lime rock , blotted out [[Ida Lewis]446-ida lewis 's little house]4530-ida lewis 's little house , and passed across [the turret in which the light was hung]4531-the turret in which the light was hung . [Archer]430-archer waited till a wide space of water sparkled between [the last reef of [the island]4533-the island and the stern of [the boat]4529-the boat]4532-the last reef of the island and the stern of the boat ; but still the figure in [the summer - house]4523-the summer - house did not move . [He]430-archer turned and walked up [the hill]4536-the hill . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm sorry [you]2075-you did n't find [Ellen]232-ellen -- [I]0-i should have liked to see [her]232-ellen again , " [May]430-archer said as [they]4537-they drove [home]649-home through the dusk . "[0-i] But perhaps [she]232-ellen would n't have cared -- [she]232-ellen seems so changed . " "[232-ellen] Changed ? " echoed [[her]0-i husband]663-her husband in a colourless voice , [his]663-her husband eyes fixed on the ponies ' twitching ears . "[232-ellen] So indifferent to [[her]232-ellen friends]740-her friends , [I]0-i mean ; giving up [New York]2-new york and [[her]232-ellen house]819-her house , and spending [her]232-ellen time with [such queer people]2078-such queer people . Fancy how hideously uncomfortable [she]232-ellen must be at [the Blenkers]365-the blenkers ' ! [She]232-ellen says [she]232-ellen does it to keep [cousin Medora]444-medora out of mischief : to prevent [her]232-ellen marrying [dreadful people]2079-dreadful people . But [I]0-i sometimes think [we]2080-we 've always bored [her]232-ellen . " [Archer]430-archer made no answer , and [she]0-i continued , with a tinge of hardness that [he]430-archer had never before noticed in [her]0-i frank fresh voice : "[2080-we] After all , [I]0-i wonder if [she]232-ellen would n't be happier with [[her]232-ellen husband]663-her husband . " [He]430-archer burst into a laugh . "[232-ellen] Sancta simplicitas ! " [he]430-archer exclaimed ; and as [she]0-i turned a puzzled frown on [him]430-archer [he]430-archer added : "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i ever heard [you]0-i say a cruel thing before . " "[0-i] Cruel ? " "[0-i] Well -- watching the contortions of the damned is supposed to be a favourite sport of [the angels]2082-the angels ; but [I]0-i believe even [they]2082-the angels do n't think [people]637-people happier in [hell]2084-hell . " "[2082-the angels] It 's a pity [she]232-ellen ever married abroad then , " said [May]430-archer , in the placid tone with which [[her]232-ellen mother]605-her mother met [[Mr. Welland]339-mr. welland 's vagaries]4541-mr. welland 's vagaries ; and [Archer]430-archer felt [himself]430-archer gently relegated to the category of [unreasonable husbands]4542-unreasonable husbands . [They]4543-they drove down [Bellevue Avenue]134-bellevue avenue and turned in between the chamfered wooden gate - posts surmounted by cast - iron lamps which marked the approach to [the Welland villa]4544-the welland villa . Lights were already shining through [its]4544-the welland villa windows , and [Archer]430-archer , as [the carriage]878-the carriage stopped , caught a glimpse of [[his]430-archer father - in - law]4546-his father - in - law , exactly as [he]430-archer had pictured [him]4546-his father - in - law , pacing [the drawing - room]983-the drawing - room , watch in hand and wearing the pained expression that [he]430-archer had long since found to be much more efficacious than anger . [The young man]527-the young man , as [he]527-the young man followed [[his]527-the young man wife]572-his wife into [the hall]755-the hall , was conscious of a curious reversal of mood . There was something about the luxury of [the Welland house]4551-the welland house and the density of the Welland atmosphere , so charged with minute observances and exactions , that always stole into [his]527-the young man system like a narcotic . The heavy carpets , [the watchful servants]4552-the watchful servants , the perpetually reminding tick of disciplined clocks , the perpetually renewed stack of cards and invitations on [the hall]755-the hall table , the whole chain of tyrannical trifles binding one hour to the next , and [each member of [the household]4555-the household]4554-each member of the household to [all the others]4556-all the others , made any less systematised and affluent existence seem unreal and precarious . But now it was [the Welland house]4551-the welland house , and the life [he]527-the young man was expected to lead in [it]4551-the welland house , that had become unreal and irrelevant , and the brief scene on [the shore]4481-the shore , when [he]527-the young man had stood irresolute , halfway down [the bank]4509-the bank , was as close to [him]527-the young man as the blood in [his]527-the young man veins . All night [he]527-the young man lay awake in [the big chintz bedroom at [May]430-archer 's side]4560-the big chintz bedroom at may 's side , watching the moonlight slant along the carpet , and thinking of [Ellen Olenska]232-ellen driving [home]649-home across [the gleaming beaches]4562-the gleaming beaches behind [[Beaufort]230-beaufort 's trotters]4563-beaufort 's trotters . XXII . "[232-ellen] A party for [the Blenkers]365-the blenkers -- [the Blenkers]365-the blenkers ? " [Mr. Welland]339-mr. welland laid down [his]339-mr. welland knife and fork and looked anxiously and incredulously across the luncheon - table at [[his]339-mr. welland wife]572-his wife , who , adjusting [her]572-his wife gold eye - glasses , read aloud , in the tone of high comedy : "[365-the blenkers] [Professor]2085-professor and [Mrs. Emerson Sillerton]447-mrs. emerson sillerton request the pleasure of [Mr.]2086-mr. and [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland 's company at the meeting of [the Wednesday Afternoon Club]143-the wednesday afternoon club on August 25th at 3 o'clock punctually . To meet [Mrs.]2087-mrs. and [the Misses Blenker]448-the misses blenker . " [Red Gables]144-red gables , [Catherine Street]145-catherine street . [R. S. V. P.]449-r. s. v. p. "[339-mr. welland] " Good gracious-- "[339-mr. welland] [Mr. Welland]339-mr. welland gasped , as if a second reading had been necessary to bring the monstrous absurdity of the thing home to [him]339-mr. welland . " [Poor Amy Sillerton]450-amy sillerton -- [you]339-mr. welland never can tell what [[her]450-amy sillerton husband]663-her husband will do next , "[218-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland sighed . " [I]218-mrs. welland suppose [he]663-her husband 's just discovered [the Blenkers]365-the blenkers . "[218-mrs. welland] [Professor Emerson Sillerton]451-professor emerson sillerton was a thorn in the side of [Newport society]2088-newport society ; and a thorn that could not be plucked out , for it grew on [a venerable and venerated family tree]2089-a venerable and venerated family tree . [He]451-professor emerson sillerton was , as [people]637-people said , [a man who had had " every advantage]4566-a man who had had " every advantage . "[451-professor emerson sillerton] [[His]451-professor emerson sillerton father]4324-his father was [[Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson 's uncle]2092-sillerton jackson 's uncle , [[his]451-professor emerson sillerton mother a Pennilow of [Boston]146-boston]2093-his mother a pennilow of boston ; on each side there was wealth and position , and mutual suitability . Nothing -- as [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland had often remarked -- nothing on earth obliged [Emerson Sillerton]451-professor emerson sillerton to be [an archaeologist]2094-an archaeologist , or indeed [a Professor of any sort]2095-a professor of any sort , or to live in [Newport]104-newport in winter , or do any of the other revolutionary things that [he]451-professor emerson sillerton did . But at least , if [he]451-professor emerson sillerton was going to break with tradition and flout society in the face , [he]451-professor emerson sillerton need not have married [poor [Amy Dagonet]452-amy dagonet , who had a right to expect " something different , "[452-amy dagonet] and money enough to keep [[her]452-amy dagonet own carriage]2097-her own carriage]2096-poor amy dagonet , who had a right to expect " something different , " and money enough to keep her own carriage . [No one in the Mingott set]2098-no one in the mingott set could understand why [Amy Sillerton]450-amy sillerton had submitted so tamely to the eccentricities of [a husband who filled [the house]532-the house with [long - haired men]2101-long - haired men and [short - haired women]2102-short - haired women]2099-a husband who filled the house with long - haired men and short - haired women , and , when [he]451-professor emerson sillerton travelled , took [her]450-amy sillerton to explore tombs in [Yucatan]147-yucatan instead of going to [Paris]3-paris or [Italy]63-italy . But there [they]2103-they were , set in [their]2103-they ways , and apparently unaware that [they]2103-they were different from [other people]1903-other people ; and when [they]2103-they gave one of [their]2103-they dreary annual garden - parties [every family on]2105-every family on [the Cliffs]148-the cliffs , because of the [Sillerton - Pennilow - Dagonet]149-sillerton - pennilow - dagonet connection , had to draw lots and send [an unwilling representative]2106-an unwilling representative . " It 's a wonder , "[218-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland remarked , " that [they]2103-they did n't choose the Cup Race day ! Do [you]4567-you remember , two years ago , [their]2103-they giving a party for [a black man]4568-a black man on the day of [Julia Mingott]453-julia mingott 's the dansant ? Luckily this time there 's nothing else going on that [I]218-mrs. welland know of -- for of course [some of [us]2103-they]4569-some of us will have to go . "[218-mrs. welland] [Mr. Welland]339-mr. welland sighed nervously . " ' Some of [us]2103-they , ' [[my]339-mr. welland dear]3140-my dear -- more than one ? Three o'clock is such a very awkward hour . [I]339-mr. welland have to be here at half - past three to take [my]339-mr. welland drops : it 's really no use trying to follow [Bencomb]454-dr. bencomb 's new treatment if [I]339-mr. welland do n't do it systematically ; and if [I]339-mr. welland join [you]3140-my dear later , of course [I]339-mr. welland shall miss [my]339-mr. welland drive . "[339-mr. welland] At the thought [he]339-mr. welland laid down [his]339-mr. welland knife and fork again , and a flush of anxiety rose to [his]339-mr. welland finely - wrinkled cheek . " There 's no reason why [you]3140-my dear should go at all , [[my]572-his wife dear]3140-my dear , "[572-his wife] [[his]339-mr. welland wife]572-his wife answered with a cheerfulness that had become automatic . " [I]572-his wife have some cards to leave at [the other end of [Bellevue Avenue]134-bellevue avenue]4572-the other end of bellevue avenue , and [I]572-his wife 'll drop in at about half - past three and stay long enough to make poor [Amy]450-amy sillerton feel that [she]450-amy sillerton has n't been slighted . "[572-his wife] [She]572-his wife glanced hesitatingly at [[her]572-his wife daughter]553-her daughter . " And if [Newland]214-archer 's afternoon is provided for perhaps [May]430-archer can drive [you]553-her daughter out with the ponies , and try [their]4573-their new russet harness . "[572-his wife] It was a principle in [the Welland family]2109-the welland family that [people]637-people 's days and hours should be what [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland called " provided for . "[218-mrs. welland] The melancholy possibility of having to " kill time "[218-mrs. welland] ( especially for [those who did not care for whist or solitaire )]2111-those who did not care for whist or solitaire ) was a vision that haunted [her]218-mrs. welland as the spectre of [the unemployed]2112-the unemployed haunts [the philanthropist]2113-the philanthropist . Another of [her]218-mrs. welland principles was that [parents]1931-parents should never ( at least visibly ) interfere with the plans of [[their]1931-parents married children]2115-their married children ; and the difficulty of adjusting this respect for [May]430-archer 's independence with the exigency of [Mr. Welland]339-mr. welland 's claims could be overcome only by the exercise of an ingenuity which left not a second of [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland 's own time unprovided for . " Of course [I]430-archer 'll drive with [Papa]406-papa -- I'm sure [Newland]214-archer will find something to do , "[430-archer] [May]430-archer said , in a tone that gently reminded [[her]218-mrs. welland husband]663-her husband of [his]663-her husband lack of response . It was a cause of constant distress to [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland that [[her]218-mrs. welland son - in - law]2117-her son - in - law showed so little foresight in planning [his]2117-her son - in - law days . Often already , during the fortnight that [he]2117-her son - in - law had passed under [her]218-mrs. welland roof , when [she]218-mrs. welland enquired how [he]2117-her son - in - law meant to spend [his]2117-her son - in - law afternoon , [he]2117-her son - in - law had answered paradoxically : " Oh , [I]2117-her son - in - law think for a change [I]2117-her son - in - law 'll just save it instead of spending it-- "[2117-her son - in - law] and once , when [she]218-mrs. welland and [May]430-archer had had to go on a long - postponed round of afternoon calls , [he]2117-her son - in - law had confessed to having lain all the afternoon under a rock on [the beach below [the house]532-the house]2118-the beach below the house . " [Newland]214-archer never seems to look ahead , "[218-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland once ventured to complain to [[her]218-mrs. welland daughter]553-her daughter ; and [May]430-archer answered serenely : " No ; but [you]553-her daughter see it does n't matter , because when there 's nothing particular to do [he]2117-her son - in - law reads a book . "[430-archer] " Ah , yes -- like [[his]2117-her son - in - law father]4324-his father ! "[218-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland agreed , as if allowing for an inherited oddity ; and after that the question of [Newland]214-archer 's unemployment was tacitly dropped . Nevertheless , as the day for the Sillerton reception approached , [May]430-archer began to show a natural solicitude for [his]2117-her son - in - law welfare , and to suggest a tennis match at [the Chiverses ']2121-the chiverses ' , or a sail on [[Julius Beaufort]230-beaufort 's cutter]2122-julius beaufort 's cutter , as a means of atoning for [her]218-mrs. welland temporary desertion . " [I]218-mrs. welland shall be back by six , [you]218-mrs. welland know , [dear]3127-dear : [Papa]406-papa never drives later than that-- "[218-mrs. welland] and [she]218-mrs. welland was not reassured till [Archer]430-archer said that [he]430-archer thought of hiring a run - about and driving up [the island]4533-the island to [a stud - farm]2124-a stud - farm to look at a second horse for [her]218-mrs. welland brougham . [They]2125-they had been looking for this horse for some time , and the suggestion was so acceptable that [May]430-archer glanced at [[her]218-mrs. welland mother]605-her mother as if to say : " [You]605-her mother see [he]406-papa knows how to plan out [his]406-papa time as well as any of [us]2125-they . "[430-archer] The idea of [the stud - farm]2127-the stud - farm and the brougham horse had germinated in [Archer]430-archer 's mind on the very day when the Emerson Sillerton invitation had first been mentioned ; but [he]430-archer had kept it to [himself]430-archer as if there were something clandestine in the plan , and discovery might prevent its execution . [He]430-archer had , however , taken the precaution to engage in advance a runabout with a pair of old livery - stable trotters that could still do [their]2128-their eighteen miles on [level roads]2129-level roads ; and at two o'clock , hastily deserting the luncheon - table , [he]430-archer sprang into [the light carriage]2130-the light carriage and drove off . The day was perfect . A breeze from the north drove little puffs of white cloud across an ultramarine sky , with a bright sea running under it . [Bellevue Avenue]134-bellevue avenue was empty at that hour , and after dropping the stable - lad at [the corner of [Mill Street Archer]150-mill street archer]2131-the corner of mill street archer turned down [the Old Beach Road]151-the old beach road and drove across [Eastman 's Beach]152-eastman 's beach . [He]430-archer had the feeling of unexplained excitement with which , on half - holidays at [school]2132-school , [he]430-archer used to start off into the unknown . Taking [his]430-archer pair at an easy gait , [he]430-archer counted on reaching [the stud - farm]2127-the stud - farm , which was not far beyond [Paradise Rocks]153-paradise rocks , before three o'clock ; so that , after looking over the horse ( and trying [him]430-archer if [he]430-archer seemed promising ) [he]430-archer would still have four golden hours to dispose of . As soon as [he]430-archer heard of [[the Sillerton]450-amy sillerton 's party]2134-the sillerton 's party [he]430-archer had said to [himself]430-archer that [the Marchioness Manson]2135-the marchioness manson would certainly come to [Newport]104-newport with [the Blenkers]365-the blenkers , and that [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska might again take the opportunity of spending the day with [[her]240-madame olenska grandmother]853-her grandmother . At any rate , [the Blenker habitation]2137-the blenker habitation would probably be deserted , and [he]430-archer would be able , without indiscretion , to satisfy a vague curiosity concerning it . [He]430-archer was not sure that [he]430-archer wanted to see [the Countess Olenska]234-the countess olenska again ; but ever since [he]430-archer had looked at [her]234-the countess olenska from [the path above [the bay]4462-the bay]2138-the path above the bay [he]430-archer had wanted , irrationally and indescribably , to see [the place [she]234-the countess olenska was living in]2140-the place she was living in , and to follow the movements of [her]234-the countess olenska imagined figure as [he]430-archer had watched the real one in [the summer - house]4523-the summer - house . The longing was with [him]430-archer day and night , an incessant undefinable craving , like the sudden whim of [a sick man]2142-a sick man for food or drink once tasted and long since forgotten . [He]430-archer could not see beyond the craving , or picture what it might lead to , for [he]430-archer was not conscious of any wish to speak to [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska or to hear [her]234-the countess olenska voice . [He]430-archer simply felt that if [he]430-archer could carry away the vision of the spot of [earth]901-earth [she]234-the countess olenska walked on , and the way the sky and [sea]2144-sea enclosed [it]2145-it , [the rest of [the world]580-the world]2146-the rest of the world might seem less empty . When [he]430-archer reached [the stud - farm]2127-the stud - farm a glance showed [him]430-archer that the horse was not what [he]430-archer wanted ; nevertheless [he]430-archer took a turn behind [it]2127-the stud - farm in order to prove to [himself]430-archer that [he]430-archer was not in a hurry . But at three o'clock [he]430-archer shook out the reins over the trotters and turned into [the by - roads leading to [Portsmouth]130-portsmouth]2149-the by - roads leading to portsmouth . The wind had dropped and a faint haze on the horizon showed that a fog was waiting to steal up [the Saconnet]154-the saconnet on the turn of the tide ; but all about [him]430-archer fields and woods were steeped in golden light . [He]430-archer drove past [grey - shingled farm - houses in [orchards]2151-orchards]2150-grey - shingled farm - houses in orchards , past [hay - fields]2152-hay - fields and [groves of oak]2153-groves of oak , past villages with white steeples rising sharply into the fading sky ; and at last , after stopping to ask the way of [some men at work in [a field]2155-a field]2154-some men at work in a field , [he]430-archer turned down [a lane]2156-a lane between [high banks of goldenrod and brambles]2157-high banks of goldenrod and brambles . At the end of [the lane]2158-the lane was the blue glimmer of [the river]3880-the river ; to the left , standing in front of a clump of oaks and maples , [he]430-archer saw [a long tumble - down house]2160-a long tumble - down house with white paint peeling from [its]2160-a long tumble - down house clapboards . On [the road]3796-the road - side facing the gateway stood one of [the open sheds in which [the New Englander]455-the new englander shelters [his]430-archer farming implements]2162-the open sheds in which the new englander shelters his farming implements and [visitors]3743-visitors " hitch "[3743-visitors] [their]3743-visitors " teams . "[430-archer] [Archer]430-archer , jumping down , led [[his]430-archer pair]2164-his pair into [the shed]2165-the shed , and after tying [them]2164-his pair to a post turned toward [the house]532-the house . The patch of lawn before [it]2167-it had relapsed into [a hay - field]2168-a hay - field ; but to the left [an overgrown box - garden full of dahlias and rusty rose - bushes]2169-an overgrown box - garden full of dahlias and rusty rose - bushes encircled [a ghostly summer - house of trellis - work]2170-a ghostly summer - house of trellis - work that had once been white , surmounted by a wooden Cupid who had lost [his]430-archer bow and arrow but continued to take ineffectual aim . [Archer]430-archer leaned for a while against the gate . [No one]619-no one was in sight , and not a sound came from the open windows of [the house]532-the house : [a grizzled Newfoundland dozing before the door]2173-a grizzled newfoundland dozing before the door seemed as ineffectual [a guardian as the arrowless Cupid]2174-a guardian as the arrowless cupid . It was strange to think that [this place of silence and decay]2175-this place of silence and decay was [the home of [the turbulent Blenkers]2177-the turbulent blenkers]2176-the home of the turbulent blenkers ; yet [Archer]430-archer was sure that [he]430-archer was not mistaken . For a long time [he]430-archer stood there , content to take in the scene , and gradually falling under its drowsy spell ; but at length [he]430-archer roused [himself]430-archer to the sense of the passing time . Should [he]430-archer look [his]430-archer fill and then drive away ? [He]430-archer stood irresolute , wishing suddenly to see the inside of [the house]532-the house , so that [he]430-archer might picture [the room that [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska sat in]2179-the room that madame olenska sat in . There was nothing to prevent [his]430-archer walking up to the door and ringing the bell ; if , as [he]430-archer supposed , [she]240-madame olenska was away with the rest of [the party]2180-the party , [he]430-archer could easily give [his]430-archer name , and ask permission to go into [the sitting - room]2181-the sitting - room to write a message . But instead , [he]430-archer crossed [the lawn]4362-the lawn and turned toward [the box - garden]2183-the box - garden . As [he]430-archer entered [it]2183-the box - garden [he]430-archer caught sight of something bright - coloured in [the summer - house]4523-the summer - house , and presently made it out to be a pink parasol . The parasol drew [him]430-archer like a magnet : [he]430-archer was sure it was [hers]240-madame olenska . [He]430-archer went into [the summer - house]4523-the summer - house , and sitting down on the rickety seat picked up the silken thing and looked at its carved handle , which was made of some rare wood that gave out an aromatic scent . [Archer]430-archer lifted the handle to [his]430-archer lips . [He]430-archer heard a rustle of skirts against the box , and sat motionless , leaning on the parasol handle with clasped hands , and letting the rustle come nearer without lifting [his]430-archer eyes . [He]430-archer had always known that this must happen ... " Oh , [Mr. Archer]255-archer ! "[430-archer] exclaimed a loud young voice ; and looking up [he]430-archer saw before [him]430-archer [the youngest and largest of [the Blenker girls]2187-the blenker girls]2186-the youngest and largest of the blenker girls , blonde and blowsy , in bedraggled muslin . A red blotch on one of [her]240-madame olenska cheeks seemed to show that it had recently been pressed against a pillow , and [her]240-madame olenska half - awakened eyes stared at [him]430-archer hospitably but confusedly . " Gracious -- where did [you]255-archer drop from ? [I]240-madame olenska must have been sound asleep in the hammock . [Everybody else]1558-everybody else has gone to [Newport]104-newport . Did [you]255-archer ring ? "[240-madame olenska] [she]240-madame olenska incoherently enquired . [Archer]255-archer 's confusion was greater than [hers]240-madame olenska . " [I]240-madame olenska -- no -- that is , [I]240-madame olenska was just going to . [I]240-madame olenska had to come up [the island]4533-the island to see about a horse , and [I]240-madame olenska drove over on a chance of finding [Mrs. Blenker]416-mrs. blenker and [[your]416-mrs. blenker visitors]4578-your visitors . But [the house]532-the house seemed empty -- so [I]240-madame olenska sat down to wait . "[240-madame olenska] [Miss Blenker]456-miss blenker , shaking off the fumes of sleep , looked at [him]430-archer with increasing interest . " [The house]532-the house IS empty . [Mother]352-mother 's not [here]3155-here , or [the Marchioness]3979-the marchioness -- or anybody but [me]456-miss blenker . "[456-miss blenker] [Her]240-madame olenska glance became faintly reproachful . " Did n't [you]430-archer know that [Professor]451-professor emerson sillerton and [Mrs. Sillerton]447-mrs. emerson sillerton are giving a garden - party for [mother]922-mother and all of [us]4584-us this afternoon ? It was too unlucky that [I]240-madame olenska could n't go ; but [I]240-madame olenska 've had a sore throat , and [mother]922-mother was afraid of the drive [home]649-home this evening . Did [you]430-archer ever know anything so disappointing ? Of course , "[240-madame olenska] [she]240-madame olenska added gaily , " [I]240-madame olenska should n't have minded half as much if [I]240-madame olenska 'd known [you]430-archer were coming . "[240-madame olenska] Symptoms of a lumbering coquetry became visible in [her]240-madame olenska , and [Archer]255-archer found the strength to break in : " But [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska -- has [she]240-madame olenska gone to [Newport]104-newport too ? "[255-archer] [Miss Blenker]456-miss blenker looked at [him]255-archer with surprise . " [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska -- didn't [you]430-archer know [she]240-madame olenska 'd been called away ? "[456-miss blenker] " Called away?-- "[240-madame olenska] " Oh , [my]456-miss blenker best parasol ! [I]456-miss blenker lent it to that goose of [a Katie]403-kate merry , because it matched [her]240-madame olenska ribbons , and the careless thing must have dropped it here . [We]4587-we [Blenkers]365-the blenkers are all like that ... [real Bohemians]4588-real bohemians ! "[456-miss blenker] Recovering the sunshade with a powerful hand [she]456-miss blenker unfurled it and suspended its rosy dome above [her]456-miss blenker head . " Yes , [Ellen]232-ellen was called away yesterday : [she]240-madame olenska lets [us]4587-we call [her]232-ellen [Ellen]232-ellen , [you]430-archer know . A telegram came from [Boston]146-boston : [she]240-madame olenska said [she]240-madame olenska might be gone for two days . [I]456-miss blenker do LOVE the way [she]240-madame olenska does [her]240-madame olenska hair , do n't [you]430-archer ? "[456-miss blenker] [Miss Blenker]456-miss blenker rambled on . [Archer]255-archer continued to stare through [her]456-miss blenker as though [she]456-miss blenker had been transparent . All [he]255-archer saw was the trumpery parasol that arched its pinkness above [her]456-miss blenker giggling head . After a moment [he]255-archer ventured : " [You]456-miss blenker do n't happen to know why [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska went to [Boston]146-boston ? [I]255-archer hope it was not on account of bad news ? "[255-archer] [Miss Blenker]456-miss blenker took this with a cheerful incredulity . " Oh , [I]456-miss blenker do n't believe so . [She]240-madame olenska did n't tell [us]4589-us what was in the telegram . [I]456-miss blenker think [she]240-madame olenska did n't want [the Marchioness]3979-the marchioness to know . [She]240-madame olenska 's so romantic - looking , is n't [she]240-madame olenska ? Does n't [she]240-madame olenska remind [you]255-archer of [Mrs. Scott - Siddons]457-mrs. scott - siddons when [she]240-madame olenska reads ' [Lady Geraldine]458-lady geraldine 's Courtship ' ? Did [you]255-archer never hear [her]240-madame olenska ? "[456-miss blenker] [Archer]255-archer was dealing hurriedly with crowding thoughts . [His]255-archer whole future seemed suddenly to be unrolled before [him]255-archer ; and passing down its endless emptiness [he]255-archer saw the dwindling figure of [a man to whom nothing was ever to happen]2188-a man to whom nothing was ever to happen . [He]255-archer glanced about [him]255-archer at [the unpruned garden]2189-the unpruned garden , [the tumble - down house]2190-the tumble - down house , and [the oak - grove under which the dusk]2191-the oak - grove under which the dusk was gathering . It had seemed so exactly the place in which [he]255-archer ought to have found [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska ; and [she]240-madame olenska was far away , and even the pink sunshade was not [hers]240-madame olenska ... [He]255-archer frowned and hesitated . " [You]456-miss blenker do n't know , [I]255-archer suppose -- [I]255-archer shall be in [Boston]146-boston tomorrow . If [I]255-archer could manage to see [her--]240-madame olenska "[255-archer] [He]255-archer felt that [Miss Blenker]456-miss blenker was losing interest in [him]255-archer , though [her]456-miss blenker smile persisted . " Oh , of course ; how lovely of [you]255-archer ! [She]456-miss blenker 's staying at [the Parker House]4591-the parker house ; it must be horrible there in this weather . "[456-miss blenker] After that [Archer]255-archer was but intermittently aware of the remarks [they]2192-they exchanged . [He]255-archer could only remember stoutly resisting [her]456-miss blenker entreaty that [he]255-archer should await [the returning family]2193-the returning family and have high tea with [them]2193-the returning family before [he]255-archer drove [home]649-home . At length , with [[his]255-archer hostess]1261-his hostess still at [his]255-archer side , [he]255-archer passed out of range of [the wooden Cupid]2196-the wooden cupid , unfastened [his]255-archer horses and drove off . At the turn of [the lane]2158-the lane [he]255-archer saw [Miss Blenker]456-miss blenker standing at the gate and waving the pink parasol . XXIII . The next morning , when [Archer]255-archer got out of [the Fall River train]2198-the fall river train , [he]255-archer emerged upon [a steaming midsummer [Boston]146-boston]2199-a steaming midsummer boston . [[The streets]3319-the streets near [the station]3828-the station]2201-the streets near the station were full of the smell of beer and coffee and decaying fruit and a shirt - sleeved populace moved through [them]2201-the streets near the station with the intimate abandon of [boarders]2203-boarders going down [the passage]3813-the passage to [the bathroom]2205-the bathroom . [Archer]255-archer found [a cab]2206-a cab and drove to [the Somerset Club]2207-the somerset club for breakfast . Even [the fashionable quarters]2208-the fashionable quarters had the air of untidy domesticity to which no excess of heat ever degrades [the European cities]2209-the european cities . [Care - takers]2210-care - takers in calico lounged on the door - steps of [the wealthy]2211-the wealthy , and [the Common]2212-the common looked like [a pleasure - ground on the morrow of a Masonic picnic]2213-a pleasure - ground on the morrow of a masonic picnic . If [Archer]255-archer had tried to imagine [Ellen Olenska]232-ellen in improbable scenes [he]255-archer could not have called up any into which it was more difficult to fit [her]232-ellen than this heat - prostrated and deserted [Boston]146-boston . [He]255-archer breakfasted with appetite and method , beginning with a slice of melon , and studying a morning paper while [he]255-archer waited for [his]255-archer toast and scrambled eggs . A new sense of energy and activity had possessed [him]255-archer ever since [he]255-archer had announced to [May]430-archer the night before that [he]255-archer had business in [Boston]146-boston , and should take the Fall River boat that night and go on to [New York]2-new york the following evening . It had always been understood that [he]255-archer would return to [town]1128-town early in the week , and when [he]255-archer got back from [his]255-archer expedition to [Portsmouth]130-portsmouth a letter from [the office]3721-the office , which fate had conspicuously placed on a corner of the hall table , sufficed to justify [his]255-archer sudden change of plan . [He]255-archer was even ashamed of the ease with which the whole thing had been done : it reminded [him]255-archer , for an uncomfortable moment , of [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts 's masterly contrivances for securing [his]255-archer freedom . But this did not long trouble [him]255-archer , for [he]255-archer was not in an analytic mood . After breakfast [he]255-archer smoked a cigarette and glanced over [the Commercial Advertiser]2216-the commercial advertiser . While [he]255-archer was thus engaged [two or three men [he]255-archer knew]2217-two or three men he knew came in , and the usual greetings were exchanged : it was [the same world]2218-the same world after all , though [he]255-archer had such a queer sense of having slipped through the meshes of time and space . [He]255-archer looked at [his]255-archer watch , and finding that it was half - past nine got up and went into [the writing - room]2219-the writing - room . There [he]255-archer wrote a few lines , and ordered [a messenger]2220-a messenger to take a cab to [the Parker House]155-the parker house and wait for the answer . [He]255-archer then sat down behind another newspaper and tried to calculate how long it would take [a cab]2206-a cab to get to [the Parker House]155-the parker house . " [The lady]681-the lady was out , [sir]3197-sir , "[2222-a waiter] [he]255-archer suddenly heard [a waiter]2222-a waiter 's voice at [his]255-archer elbow ; and [he]255-archer stammered : " Out?-- "[255-archer] as if it were a word in a strange language . [He]255-archer got up and went into [the hall]755-the hall . It must be a mistake : [she]2224-her could not be out at that hour . [He]255-archer flushed with anger at [his]255-archer own stupidity : why had [he]255-archer not sent the note as soon as [he]255-archer arrived ? [He]255-archer found [his]255-archer hat and stick and went forth into [the street]2225-the street . [The city]2226-the city had suddenly become as strange and vast and empty as if [he]255-archer were [a traveller from [distant lands]2228-distant lands]2227-a traveller from distant lands . For a moment [he]255-archer stood on the door - step hesitating ; then [he]255-archer decided to go to [the Parker House]4591-the parker house . What if [the messenger]2230-the messenger had been misinformed , and [she]2224-her were still [there]732-there ? [He]255-archer started to walk across [the Common]2212-the common ; and on the first bench , under a tree , [he]255-archer saw [her]2224-her sitting . [She]2224-her had a grey silk sunshade over [her]2224-her head -- how could [he]255-archer ever have imagined [her]2224-her with a pink one ? As [he]255-archer approached [he]255-archer was struck by [her]2224-her listless attitude : [she]2224-her sat there as if [she]2224-her had nothing else to do . [He]255-archer saw [her]2224-her drooping profile , and the knot of hair fastened low in the neck under [her]2224-her dark hat , and the long wrinkled glove on the hand that held the sunshade . [He]255-archer came a step or two nearer , and [she]2224-her turned and looked at [him]255-archer . " [Oh"--she]459-oh"--she[2224-her] said ; and for the first time [he]255-archer noticed a startled look on [her]2224-her face ; but in another moment it gave way to a slow smile of wonder and contentment . " [Oh"--she]459-oh"--she[255-archer] murmured again , on a different note , as [he]255-archer stood looking down at [her]2224-her ; and without rising [she]2224-her made a place for [him]255-archer on the bench . " [I]430-archer 'm here on business -- just got here , "[430-archer] [Archer]430-archer explained ; and , without knowing why , [he]255-archer suddenly began to feign astonishment at seeing [her]2224-her . " But what on earth are [you]2224-her doing in [this wilderness]4594-this wilderness ? "[255-archer] [He]255-archer had really no idea what [he]255-archer was saying : [he]255-archer felt as if [he]255-archer were shouting at [her]2224-her across endless distances , and [she]2224-her might vanish again before [he]255-archer could overtake [her]2224-her . " [I]2224-her ? Oh , [I]2224-her 'm here on business too , "[2224-her] [she]2224-her answered , turning [her]2224-her head toward [him]255-archer so that [they]2233-they were face to face . The words hardly reached [him]255-archer : [he]255-archer was aware only of [her]2224-her voice , and of the startling fact that not an echo of it had remained in [his]255-archer memory . [He]255-archer had not even remembered that it was low - pitched , with a faint roughness on the consonants . " [You]2224-her do [your]2224-her hair differently , "[255-archer] [he]255-archer said , [his]255-archer heart beating as if [he]255-archer had uttered something irrevocable . " Differently ? No -- it 's only that [I]255-archer do it as best [I]255-archer can when [I]255-archer 'm without [Nastasia]340-nastasia . "[255-archer] " [Nastasia]340-nastasia ; but is n't [she]2224-her with [you]255-archer ? "[2224-her] " No ; [I]255-archer 'm alone . For two days it was not worth while to bring [her]2224-her . "[255-archer] " [You]255-archer 're alone -- at [the Parker House]4591-the parker house ? "[2224-her] [She]2224-her looked at [him]255-archer with a flash of [her]2224-her old malice . " Does it strike [you]255-archer as dangerous ? "[2224-her] " No ; not dangerous-- "[255-archer] " But unconventional ? [I]2224-her see ; [I]2224-her suppose it is . "[2224-her] [She]2224-her considered a moment . " [I]2224-her had n't thought of it , because [I]2224-her 've just done something so much more unconventional . "[2224-her] The faint tinge of irony lingered in [her]2224-her eyes . " [I]2224-her 've just refused to take back a sum of money -- that belonged to [me]2224-her . "[2224-her] [Archer]430-archer sprang up and moved a step or two away . [She]2224-her had furled [her]2224-her parasol and sat absently drawing patterns on the gravel . Presently [he]430-archer came back and stood before [her]2224-her . " [Some one]687-some one -- has come here to meet [you]2224-her ? "[430-archer] " Yes . "[2224-her] " With this offer ? "[2224-her] [She]2224-her nodded . " And [you]430-archer refused -- because of the conditions ? "[2224-her] " [I]2224-her refused , "[2224-her] [she]2224-her said after a moment . [He]430-archer sat down by [her]2224-her again . " What were the conditions ? "[430-archer] " Oh , they were not onerous : just to sit at the head of [his]430-archer table now and then . "[2224-her] There was another interval of silence . [Archer]430-archer 's heart had slammed itself shut in the queer way it had , and [he]430-archer sat vainly groping for a word . " [He]430-archer wants [you]2224-her back -- at any price ? "[430-archer] " Well -- a considerable price . At least the sum is considerable for [me]430-archer . "[430-archer] [He]430-archer paused again , beating about the question [he]430-archer felt [he]430-archer must put . " It was to meet [him]430-archer here that [you]2224-her came ? "[430-archer] [She]2224-her stared , and then burst into a laugh . " Meet [him]430-archer -- [[my]2224-her husband]3236-my husband ? HERE ? At this season [he]430-archer 's always at [Cowes]66-cowes or [Baden]157-baden . "[2224-her] " [He]430-archer sent some one ? "[430-archer] " Yes . "[430-archer] " With a letter ? "[2224-her] [She]2224-her shook [her]2224-her head . " No ; just a message . [He]430-archer never writes . [I]2224-her do n't think [I]2224-her 've had more than one letter from [him]430-archer . "[2224-her] The allusion brought the colour to [her]2224-her cheek , and it reflected itself in [Archer]430-archer 's vivid blush . " Why does [he]430-archer never write ? "[430-archer] " Why should [he]430-archer ? What does [one]519-one have [secretaries]4599-secretaries for ? "[527-the young man] [The young man]527-the young man 's blush deepened . [She]2224-her had pronounced the word as if it had no more significance than any other in [her]2224-her vocabulary . For a moment it was on the tip of [his]527-the young man tongue to ask : " Did [he]430-archer send [[his]430-archer secretary]3107-his secretary , then ? "[2224-her] But the remembrance of [Count Olenski]278-count olenski 's only letter to [[his]278-count olenski wife]572-his wife was too present to [him]527-the young man . [He]527-the young man paused again , and then took another plunge . " And the person?"--[527-the young man] " [The emissary]4601-the emissary ? [The emissary]4601-the emissary , "[240-madame olenska] [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska rejoined , still smiling , " might , for all [I]240-madame olenska care , have left already ; but [he]430-archer has insisted on waiting till this evening ... in case ... on the chance ... "[240-madame olenska] " And [you]240-madame olenska came out here to think the chance over ? "[527-the young man] " [I]2236-we came out to get a breath of air . "[2236-we] [They]2236-we sat silent , not looking at [each other]695-each other , but straight ahead at [the people passing along [the path]2239-the path]2238-the people passing along the path . Finally [she]240-madame olenska turned [her]240-madame olenska eyes again to [his]527-the young man face and said : " [You]527-the young man 're not changed . "[240-madame olenska] [He]527-the young man felt like answering : " [I]240-madame olenska was , till [I]240-madame olenska saw [you]240-madame olenska again ; "[240-madame olenska] but instead [he]527-the young man stood up abruptly and glanced about [him]527-the young man at [the untidy sweltering park]2240-the untidy sweltering park . " This is horrible . Why should n't [we]2236-we go out a little on [the bay]4462-the bay ? There 's a breeze , and it will be cooler . [We]2236-we might take [the steamboat]4606-the steamboat down to [Point Arley]158-point arley . "[240-madame olenska] [She]240-madame olenska glanced up at [him]527-the young man hesitatingly and [he]527-the young man went on : " On a Monday morning there wo n't be [anybody]3094-anybody on [the boat]4529-the boat . "[527-the young man] [he]527-the young man insisted , looking down at [her]240-madame olenska ; and suddenly [he]527-the young man broke out : " Have n't [we]2236-we done all [we]2236-we could ? "[527-the young man] " [Oh"--she]459-oh"--she[240-madame olenska] murmured again . " [You]527-the young man must n't say things like that to [me]240-madame olenska , "[240-madame olenska] [she]240-madame olenska said . " [I]527-the young man 'll say anything [you]527-the young man like ; or nothing . " Oh , do n't calculate , "[527-the young man] [he]527-the young man broke out ; " give [me]527-the young man the day ! "[527-the young man] [Her]240-madame olenska colour rose again . " At eleven . "[240-madame olenska] " Then [you]527-the young man must come at once . "[240-madame olenska] " [You]527-the young man need n't be afraid -- if [I]240-madame olenska do n't come . "[240-madame olenska] " Nor [you]527-the young man either -- if [you]527-the young man do . [I]240-madame olenska swear [I]240-madame olenska only want to hear about [you]527-the young man , to know what [you]527-the young man 've been doing . "[240-madame olenska] [She]240-madame olenska still wavered , [her]240-madame olenska anxious eyes on [his]527-the young man face . " Why did n't [you]527-the young man come down to [the beach]4613-the beach to fetch [me]240-madame olenska , the day [I]240-madame olenska was at [Granny]243-granny 's ? "[240-madame olenska] [she]240-madame olenska asked . " Because [you]527-the young man did n't look round -- because [you]527-the young man did n't know [I]240-madame olenska was there . "[240-madame olenska] [He]527-the young man laughed as the childishness of the confession struck [him]527-the young man . " But [I]527-the young man did n't look round on purpose . "[527-the young man] " On purpose ? "[527-the young man] " [I]527-the young man knew [you]527-the young man were [there]732-there ; when [you]527-the young man drove in [I]527-the young man recognised [the ponies]4615-the ponies . "[240-madame olenska] [He]527-the young man laughed out again , this time in boyish satisfaction . " Well , [you]527-the young man see it 's no use . [I]527-the young man may as well tell [you]240-madame olenska , "[527-the young man] [he]527-the young man added , " that the business [I]527-the young man came here for was just to find [you]240-madame olenska . "[240-madame olenska] [She]240-madame olenska frowned perplexedly , and then smiled . " Oh , but [I]240-madame olenska must go back to [the hotel]4603-the hotel first : [I]240-madame olenska must leave a note-- "[240-madame olenska] " As many notes as [you]527-the young man please . [You]527-the young man can write here . "[527-the young man] [He]527-the young man drew out a note - case and one of the new stylographic pens . " [I]527-the young man 've even got an envelope -- [you]527-the young man see how everything 's predestined ! There -- steady the thing on [your]527-the young man knee , and [I]527-the young man 'll get the pen going in a second . [They]2241-the passersby have to be humoured ; wait-- "[527-the young man] [He]527-the young man banged the hand that held the pen against the back of the bench . " It 's like jerking down the mercury in a thermometer : just a trick . Now try-- "[527-the young man] [She]240-madame olenska laughed , and bending over the sheet of paper which [he]527-the young man had laid on [his]527-the young man note - case , began to write . [Archer]430-archer walked away a few steps , staring with radiant unseeing eyes at [the passersby]2241-the passersby , who , in [their]2241-the passersby turn , paused to stare at the unwonted sight of [a fashionably - dressed lady writing a note on [her]2242-a fashionably - dressed lady writing a note on her knee on a bench in the common knee on a bench in [the Common]2212-the common]2242-a fashionably - dressed lady writing a note on her knee on a bench in the common . " [I]2244-they told [you]2244-they everything was predestined ! Here 's [a cab]2206-a cab for [us]2244-they . [You]2244-they see ! "[2244-they] [They]2244-they laughed , astonished at the miracle of picking up a public conveyance at that hour , and in that unlikely spot , in [a city]3305-a city where [cab - stands]2247-cab - stands were still [a " foreign "[430-archer] novelty]2248-a " foreign " novelty . [Archer]430-archer , looking at [his]430-archer watch , saw that there was time to drive to [the Parker House]155-the parker house before going to [the steamboat landing]2249-the steamboat landing . " Shall [I]430-archer take it in ? "[430-archer] [he]430-archer asked ; but [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska , shaking [her]240-madame olenska head , sprang out and disappeared through the glazed doors . It was barely half - past ten ; but what if [the emissary]4601-the emissary , impatient for [her]240-madame olenska reply , and not knowing how else to employ [his]4601-the emissary time , were already seated among [the travellers with cooling drinks at [their]2253-the travellers with cooling drinks at their elbows of whom archer had caught a glimpse as she went in elbows of whom [Archer]430-archer had caught a glimpse as [she]240-madame olenska went in]2253-the travellers with cooling drinks at their elbows of whom archer had caught a glimpse as she went in ? [He]430-archer waited , pacing up and down before [the herdic]2254-the herdic . [A Sicilian youth with eyes like [Nastasia]340-nastasia 's]2255-a sicilian youth with eyes like nastasia 's offered to shine [his]2255-a sicilian youth with eyes like nastasia 's boots , and [an Irish matron]2256-an irish matron to sell [him]2255-a sicilian youth with eyes like nastasia 's peaches ; and every few moments the doors opened to let out [hot men with straw hats tilted far back]2257-hot men with straw hats tilted far back , who glanced at [him]430-archer as [they]2257-hot men with straw hats tilted far back went by . [He]430-archer marvelled that the door should open so often , and that [all the people it let out]2258-all the people it let out should look so like [each other]695-each other , and so like [all the other hot men who , at that hour , through the length and breadth of]2260-all the other hot men who , at that hour , through the length and breadth of [the land]3781-the land , were passing continuously in and out of the swinging doors of [hotels]4212-hotels . And then , suddenly , came a face that [he]430-archer could not relate to the other faces . [He]430-archer caught but a flash of it , for [his]430-archer pacings had carried [him]430-archer to the farthest point of [his]430-archer beat , and it was in turning back to [the hotel]4603-the hotel that [he]430-archer saw , in a group of typical countenances -- [the lank and weary]2264-the lank and weary , [the round and surprised]2265-the round and surprised , the lantern - jawed and mild -- this other face that was so many more things at once , and things so different . It was that of [a young man , pale too , and half - extinguished by the heat]2266-a young man , pale too , and half - extinguished by the heat , or worry , or both , but somehow , quicker , vivider , more conscious ; or perhaps seeming so because [he]2255-a sicilian youth with eyes like nastasia 's was so different . [Archer]430-archer hung a moment on a thin thread of memory , but it snapped and floated off with the disappearing face -- apparently that of [some foreign business man , looking doubly foreign in such a setting]2267-some foreign business man , looking doubly foreign in such a setting . [He]2255-a sicilian youth with eyes like nastasia 's vanished in the stream of [passersby]2268-passersby , and [Archer]430-archer resumed [his]430-archer patrol . [He]430-archer did not care to be seen watch in hand within view of [the hotel]4603-the hotel , and [his]430-archer unaided reckoning of the lapse of time led [him]430-archer to conclude that , if [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska was so long in reappearing , it could only be because [she]240-madame olenska had met [the emissary]4601-the emissary and been waylaid by [him]430-archer . At the thought [Archer]430-archer 's apprehension rose to anguish . " If [she]240-madame olenska does n't come soon [I]430-archer 'll go in and find [her]240-madame olenska , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said . The doors swung open again and [she]240-madame olenska was at [his]430-archer side . [They]2271-they got into [the herdic]2254-the herdic , and as it drove off [he]430-archer took out [his]430-archer watch and saw that [she]240-madame olenska had been absent just three minutes . In the clatter of loose windows that made talk impossible [they]2271-they bumped over the disjointed cobblestones to [the wharf]2273-the wharf . Seated side by side on a bench of [the half - empty boat]2274-the half - empty boat [they]2271-they found that [they]2271-they had hardly anything to say to [each other]695-each other , or rather that what [they]2271-they had to say communicated itself best in the blessed silence of [their]2271-they release and [their]2271-they isolation . As the paddle - wheels began to turn , and wharves and shipping to recede through the veil of heat , it seemed to [Archer]430-archer that everything in the old familiar world of habit was receding also . [He]430-archer longed to ask [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska if [she]240-madame olenska did not have the same feeling : the feeling that [they]2271-they were starting on some long voyage from which [they]2271-they might never return . But [he]430-archer was afraid to say it , or anything else that might disturb the delicate balance of [her]240-madame olenska trust in [him]430-archer . In reality [he]430-archer had no wish to betray that trust . There had been days and nights when the memory of [their]2271-they kiss had burned and burned on [his]430-archer lips ; the day before even , on the drive to [Portsmouth]130-portsmouth , the thought of [her]240-madame olenska had run through [him]430-archer like fire ; but now that [she]240-madame olenska was beside [him]430-archer , and [they]2271-they were drifting forth into [this unknown world]2276-this unknown world , [they]2271-they seemed to have reached the kind of deeper nearness that a touch may sunder . As [the boat]4529-the boat left [the harbour]2278-the harbour and turned seaward a breeze stirred about [them]2271-they and [the bay]4462-the bay broke up into long oily undulations , then into ripples tipped with spray . The fog of sultriness still hung over [the city]2226-the city , but ahead lay a fresh world of ruffled waters , and [distant promontories with light - houses]2281-distant promontories with light - houses in the sun . [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska , leaning back against the boat - rail , drank in the coolness between parted lips . [She]240-madame olenska had wound a long veil about [her]240-madame olenska hat , but it left [her]240-madame olenska face uncovered , and [Archer]430-archer was struck by the tranquil gaiety of [her]240-madame olenska expression . [She]240-madame olenska seemed to take [their]2271-they adventure as a matter of course , and to be neither in fear of unexpected encounters , nor ( what was worse ) unduly elated by [their]2271-they possibility . In [the bare dining - room of [the inn]3887-the inn , which [he]430-archer had hoped [they]2271-they would have to [themselves]2271-they]2282-the bare dining - room of the inn , which he had hoped they would have to themselves , [they]2271-they found a strident party of [innocent - looking young men]2284-innocent - looking young men and [women -- school - teachers]2285-women -- school - teachers on a holiday , [the landlord]2286-the landlord told [them]2271-they -- and [Archer]430-archer 's heart sank at the idea of having to talk through [their]2271-they noise . " This is hopeless -- [I'll]430-archer ask for [a private room]1552-a private room , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said ; and [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska , without offering any objection , waited while [he]430-archer went in search of [it]2287-it . [The room]991-the room opened on [a long wooden verandah]2289-a long wooden verandah , with [the sea]4358-the sea coming in at the windows . [It]991-the room was bare and cool , with a table covered with a coarse checkered cloth and adorned by a bottle of pickles and a blueberry pie under a cage . No more guileless - looking cabinet particulier ever offered [its]991-the room shelter to [a clandestine couple]2291-a clandestine couple : [Archer]430-archer fancied [he]430-archer saw the sense of [its]991-the room reassurance in the faintly amused smile with which [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska sat down opposite to [him]430-archer . [A woman who had run away from [[her]240-madame olenska husband]663-her husband -- and reputedly with [another man]2294-another man -- was likely to have mastered the art of taking things for granted]2292-a woman who had run away from her husband -- and reputedly with another man -- was likely to have mastered the art of taking things for granted ; but something in the quality of [her]240-madame olenska composure took the edge from [his]430-archer irony . By being so quiet , so unsurprised and so simple [she]240-madame olenska had managed to brush away the conventions and make [him]430-archer feel that to seek to be alone was the natural thing for [two old friends who had so much to say to [each other]695-each other]2295-two old friends who had so much to say to each other .... XXIV . [They]2295-two old friends who had so much to say to each other lunched slowly and meditatively , with mute intervals between rushes of talk ; for , the spell once broken , [they]2295-two old friends who had so much to say to each other had much to say , and yet moments when saying became the mere accompaniment to long duologues of silence . [Archer]430-archer kept the talk from [his]430-archer own affairs , not with conscious intention but because [he]430-archer did not want to miss a word of [her]240-madame olenska history ; and leaning on the table , [her]240-madame olenska chin resting on [her]240-madame olenska clasped hands , [she]240-madame olenska talked to [him]430-archer of the year and a half since [they]2295-two old friends who had so much to say to each other had met . [She]240-madame olenska had grown tired of what [people]637-people called " society "[240-madame olenska] ; [New York]2-new york was kind , it was almost oppressively hospitable ; [she]240-madame olenska should never forget the way in which [it]2-new york had welcomed [her]240-madame olenska back ; but after the first flush of novelty [she]240-madame olenska had found [herself]240-madame olenska , as [she]240-madame olenska phrased it , too " different "[240-madame olenska] to care for the things it cared about -- and so [she]240-madame olenska had decided to try [Washington]111-washington , where [one]519-one was supposed to meet more varieties of [people]637-people and of opinion . And on the whole [she]240-madame olenska should probably settle down in [Washington]111-washington , and make a home there for [poor [Medora]444-medora , who had worn out the patience of all [her]444-medora other relations]2300-poor medora , who had worn out the patience of all her other relations just at the time when [she]444-medora most needed looking after and protecting from matrimonial perils . " But [Dr. Carver]413-dr. carver -- aren't [you]240-madame olenska afraid of [Dr. Carver]413-dr. carver ? " Oh , [the Carver]413-dr. carver danger is over . [Dr. Carver]413-dr. carver is [a very clever man]4624-a very clever man . "[240-madame olenska] " [A convert]4626-a convert to what ? "[240-madame olenska] " To all sorts of new and crazy social schemes . " [We]4635-us 're damnably dull . [We]4635-us 've no character , no colour , no variety.--I wonder , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer broke out , " why [you]2305-her do n't go back ? "[430-archer] [Her]2305-her eyes darkened , and [he]430-archer expected an indignant rejoinder . But [she]2305-her sat silent , as if thinking over what [he]430-archer had said , and [he]430-archer grew frightened lest [she]2305-her should answer that [she]2305-her wondered too . At length [she]2305-her said : " [I]2305-her believe it 's because of [you]430-archer . "[2305-her] It was impossible to make the confession more dispassionately , or in a tone less encouraging to the vanity of [the person addressed]2306-the person addressed . [Archer]430-archer reddened to the temples , but dared not move or speak : it was as if [her]2305-her words had been some rare butterfly that the least motion might drive off on startled wings , but that might gather a flock about it if it were left undisturbed . " At least , "[2305-her] [she]2305-her continued , " it was [you]430-archer who made [me]2305-her understand that under the dullness there are things so fine and sensitive and delicate that even those [I]2305-her most cared for in [my]2305-her other life look cheap in comparison . [I]2305-her do n't know how to explain [myself"--she]2305-her[2305-her] drew together [her]2305-her troubled brows--"but it seems as if [I]2305-her 'd never before understood with how much that is hard and shabby and base the most exquisite pleasures may be paid . "[2305-her] " Exquisite pleasures -- it 's something to have had them ! "[2305-her] [he]430-archer felt like retorting ; but the appeal in [her]2305-her eyes kept [him]430-archer silent . " [I]2305-her want , "[2305-her] [she]2305-her went on , " to be perfectly honest with [you]430-archer -- and with [myself]2305-her . " Of [you]430-archer ? "[2305-her] " Yes : for [I]2305-her 'm of [your]430-archer making much more than [you]430-archer ever were of [mine]2305-her . "[2305-her] [Her]2305-her paleness turned to a fugitive flush . " [I]2305-her thought -- [you]430-archer promised -- [you]430-archer were not to say such things today . "[2305-her] " Ah -- how like [a woman]4639-a woman ! None of [you]430-archer will ever see a bad business through ! "[2305-her] [She]2305-her lowered [her]2305-her voice . " IS it a bad business -- for [May]430-archer ? "[2305-her] [He]2307-he stood in the window , drumming against the raised sash , and feeling in every fibre the wistful tenderness with which [she]2305-her had spoken [[her]2305-her cousin]690-her cousin 's name . " For that 's the thing [we]4640-we 've always got to think of -- haven't [we]4640-we -- by [your]2307-he own showing ? "[2305-her] [she]2305-her insisted . " [My]2307-he own showing ? "[2307-he] [he]2307-he echoed , [his]2307-he blank eyes still on [the sea]4358-the sea . " Or if not , "[2305-her] [she]2305-her continued , pursuing [her]2305-her own thought with a painful application , " if it 's not worth while to have given up , to have missed things , so that [others]3523-others may be saved from disillusionment and misery -- then everything [I]2305-her came [home]649-home for , everything that made [my]2305-her other life seem by contrast so bare and so poor because [no one there]4643-no one there took account of [them]4644-them -- all these things are a sham or a dream-- "[2305-her] [He]2307-he turned around without moving from [his]2307-he place . " And in that case there 's no reason on earth why [you]2305-her should n't go back ? "[2307-he] [he]2307-he concluded for [her]2305-her . [Her]2305-her eyes were clinging to [him]2307-he desperately . " Oh , IS there no reason ? "[2305-her] " Not if [you]2305-her staked [your]2305-her all on the success of [my]2307-he marriage . [My]2307-he marriage , "[2307-he] [he]2307-he said savagely , " is n't going to be a sight to keep [you]2305-her here . "[2307-he] [She]2305-her made no answer , and [he]2307-he went on : " What 's the use ? [You]2305-her gave [me]2307-he [my]2307-he first glimpse of a real life , and at the same moment [you]2305-her asked [me]2307-he to go on with a sham one . It 's beyond human enduring -- that 's all . "[2307-he] " Oh , do n't say that ; when [I]2305-her 'm enduring it ! "[2305-her] [she]2305-her burst out , [her]2305-her eyes filling . [Her]2305-her arms had dropped along the table , and [she]2305-her sat with [her]2305-her face abandoned to [his]2307-he gaze as if in the recklessness of a desperate peril . The face exposed [her]2305-her as much as if it had been [[her]2305-her whole person]2310-her whole person , with the soul behind it : [Archer]430-archer stood dumb , overwhelmed by what it suddenly told [him]430-archer . " [You]430-archer too -- oh , all this time , [you]430-archer too ? "[2305-her] For answer , [she]2305-her let the tears on [her]2305-her lids overflow and run slowly downward . Half the width of [the room]991-the room was still between [them]2312-them , and [neither]1147-neither made any show of moving . [Archer]430-archer was conscious of a curious indifference to [her]2305-her bodily presence : [he]430-archer would hardly have been aware of it if one of the hands [she]2305-her had flung out on the table had not drawn [his]430-archer gaze as on the occasion when , in [the little Twenty - third Street house]2314-the little twenty - third street house , [he]430-archer had kept [his]430-archer eye on [it]2315-it in order not to look at [her]2305-her face . Now [his]430-archer imagination spun about the hand as about the edge of a vortex ; but still [he]430-archer made no effort to draw nearer . [He]430-archer had known the love that is fed on caresses and feeds them ; but this passion that was closer than [his]430-archer bones was not to be superficially satisfied . [His]430-archer one terror was to do anything which might efface the sound and impression of [her]2305-her words ; [his]430-archer one thought , that [he]430-archer should never again feel quite alone . But after a moment the sense of waste and ruin overcame [him]430-archer . There [they]2316-they were , close together and safe and shut in ; yet so chained to [their]2316-they separate destinies that [they]2316-they might as well have been half [the world]580-the world apart . " What 's the use -- when [you]2305-her will go back ? "[430-archer] [he]430-archer broke out , a great hopeless HOW ON [EARTH]160-earth CAN [I]0-i KEEP [YOU]2305-her ? crying out to [her]2305-her beneath [his]430-archer words . [She]2305-her sat motionless , with lowered lids . " Oh -- [I]2305-her sha n't go yet ! "[2305-her] " Not yet ? Some time , then ? Some time that [you]430-archer already foresee ? "[2305-her] At that [she]2305-her raised [her]2305-her clearest eyes . " [I]430-archer promise [you]430-archer : not as long as [you]430-archer hold out . Not as long as [we]4645-we can look straight at [each other]695-each other like this . "[430-archer] [He]430-archer dropped into [his]430-archer chair . What [her]2305-her answer really said was : " If [you]430-archer lift a finger [you]430-archer 'll drive [me]2305-her back : back to all the abominations [you]430-archer know of , and all the temptations [you]430-archer half guess . "[2305-her] [He]430-archer understood it as clearly as if [she]2305-her had uttered the words , and the thought kept [him]430-archer anchored to [his]430-archer side of the table in a kind of moved and sacred submission . " What a life for [you!--]2305-her "[430-archer] [he]430-archer groaned . " Oh -- as long as it 's a part of [yours]2305-her . "[430-archer] " And [mine]2305-her a part of [yours]2305-her ? "[2305-her] [She]2305-her nodded . " And that 's to be all -- for either of [us]4647-us ? "[2305-her] " Well ; it IS all , is n't it ? "[430-archer] At that [he]430-archer sprang up , forgetting everything but the sweetness of [her]2305-her face . [She]2305-her rose too , not as if to meet [him]430-archer or to flee from [him]430-archer , but quietly , as though the worst of the task were done and [she]2305-her had only to wait ; so quietly that , as [he]430-archer came close , [her]2305-her outstretched hands acted not as a check but as a guide to [him]430-archer . They fell into [his]430-archer , while [her]2305-her arms , extended but not rigid , kept [him]430-archer far enough off to let [her]2305-her surrendered face say the rest . [They]2318-their may have stood in that way for a long time , or only for a few moments ; but it was long enough for [her]2305-her silence to communicate all [she]2305-her had to say , and for [him]430-archer to feel that only one thing mattered . [He]430-archer must do nothing to make this meeting [their]2318-their last ; [he]430-archer must leave [their]2318-their future in [her]2305-her care , asking only that [she]2305-her should keep fast hold of it . " Don't -- don't be unhappy , "[2305-her] [she]2305-her said , with a break in [her]2305-her voice , as [she]2305-her drew [her]2305-her hands away ; and [he]430-archer answered : " [You]2305-her wo n't go back -- [you]2305-her wo n't go back ? "[2305-her] as if it were the one possibility [he]430-archer could not bear . " [I]2305-her wo n't go back , "[2305-her] [she]2305-her said ; and turning away [she]2305-her opened the door and led the way into [the public dining - room]2319-the public dining - room . [The strident school - teachers]2320-the strident school - teachers were gathering up [their]2320-the strident school - teachers possessions preparatory to a straggling flight to [the wharf]2273-the wharf ; across [the beach]4613-the beach lay [the white steam - boat]2323-the white steam - boat at [the pier]2324-the pier ; and over the sunlit waters [Boston]146-boston loomed in a line of haze . XXV . Once more on [the boat]4529-the boat , and in the presence of [others]3523-others , [Archer]430-archer felt a tranquillity of spirit that surprised as much as it sustained [him]430-archer . The day , according to any current valuation , had been a rather ridiculous failure ; [he]430-archer had not so much as touched [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's hand with [his]430-archer lips , or extracted one word from [her]240-madame olenska that gave promise of farther opportunities . Nevertheless , for [a man sick with unsatisfied love]2327-a man sick with unsatisfied love , and parting for an indefinite period from the object of [his]430-archer passion , [he]430-archer felt [himself]430-archer almost humiliatingly calm and comforted . It was the perfect balance [she]240-madame olenska had held between [their]2328-their loyalty to [others]3523-others and [their]2328-their honesty to [themselves]2328-their that had so stirred and yet tranquillized [him]430-archer ; a balance not artfully calculated , as [her]240-madame olenska tears and [her]240-madame olenska falterings showed , but resulting naturally from [her]240-madame olenska unabashed sincerity . It filled [him]430-archer with a tender awe , now the danger was over , and made [him]430-archer thank [the fates]2330-the fates that no personal vanity , no sense of playing a part before [sophisticated witnesses]2331-sophisticated witnesses , had tempted [him]430-archer to tempt [her]240-madame olenska . Even after [they]2328-their had clasped hands for good - bye at [the Fall River station]2332-the fall river station , and [he]430-archer had turned away alone , the conviction remained with [him]430-archer of having saved out of [their]2328-their meeting much more than [he]430-archer had sacrificed . [He]430-archer wandered back to [the club]1433-the club , and went and sat alone in [the deserted library]2334-the deserted library , turning and turning over in [his]430-archer thoughts every separate second of [their]2328-their hours together . It was clear to [him]430-archer , and it grew more clear under closer scrutiny , that if [she]240-madame olenska should finally decide on returning to [Europe]14-europe -- returning to [[her]240-madame olenska husband]663-her husband -- it would not be because [her]240-madame olenska old life tempted [her]240-madame olenska , even on the new terms offered . No : [she]240-madame olenska would go only if [she]240-madame olenska felt [herself]240-madame olenska becoming a temptation to [Archer]430-archer , a temptation to fall away from the standard [they]2328-their had both set up . [Her]240-madame olenska choice would be to stay near [him]430-archer as long as [he]430-archer did not ask [her]240-madame olenska to come nearer ; and it depended on [himself]430-archer to keep [her]240-madame olenska just there , safe but secluded . In [the train]4171-the train these thoughts were still with [him]430-archer . They enclosed [him]430-archer in a kind of golden haze , through which the faces about [him]430-archer looked remote and indistinct : [he]430-archer had a feeling that if [he]430-archer spoke to [[his]430-archer fellow - travellers]2337-his fellow - travellers [they]2337-his fellow - travellers would not understand what [he]430-archer was saying . In this state of abstraction [he]430-archer found [himself]430-archer , the following morning , waking to the reality of a stifling September day in [New York]2-new york . The heat - withered faces in [the long train]2338-the long train streamed past [him]430-archer , and [he]430-archer continued to stare at [them]2337-his fellow - travellers through the same golden blur ; but suddenly , as [he]430-archer left [the station]3828-the station , one of the faces detached itself , came closer and forced itself upon [his]430-archer consciousness . It was , as [he]430-archer instantly recalled , the face of [the young man [he]430-archer had seen , the day before , passing out of [the Parker House]4591-the parker house]2340-the young man he had seen , the day before , passing out of the parker house , and had noted as not conforming to type , as not having [an American hotel face]2342-an american hotel face . The same thing struck [him]430-archer now ; and again [he]430-archer became aware of [a dim stir of former associations]2343-a dim stir of former associations . [The young man]527-the young man stood looking about [him]430-archer with the dazed air of [the foreigner flung upon the harsh mercies of American travel]2345-the foreigner flung upon the harsh mercies of american travel ; then [he]527-the young man advanced toward [Archer]430-archer , lifted [his]527-the young man hat , and said in English : " Surely , [Monsieur]4648-monsieur , [we]4649-we met in [London]79-london ? "[527-the young man] " Ah , to be sure : in [London]79-london ! "[527-the young man] [Archer]430-archer grasped [his]527-the young man hand with curiosity and sympathy . " So [you]430-archer DID get [here]3155-here , after all ? "[527-the young man] [he]527-the young man exclaimed , casting a wondering eye on [the astute and haggard little countenance of [[young Carfry]427-mrs. carfry 's French tutor]2347-young carfry 's french tutor]2346-the astute and haggard little countenance of young carfry 's french tutor . " Oh , [I]527-the young man got [here]3155-here -- yes , "[527-the young man] [M. Riviere]436-m. riviere smiled with drawn lips . " But not for long ; [I]436-m. riviere return the day after tomorrow . "[436-m. riviere] [He]436-m. riviere stood grasping [his]436-m. riviere light valise in one neatly gloved hand , and gazing anxiously , perplexedly , almost appealingly , into [Archer]430-archer 's face . " [I]436-m. riviere wonder , [Monsieur]4652-monsieur , since [I]436-m. riviere 've had the good luck to run across [you]4652-monsieur , if [I]436-m. riviere might-- "[436-m. riviere] " [I]436-m. riviere was just going to suggest it : come to luncheon , wo n't [you]4652-monsieur ? "[527-the young man] [The young man]527-the young man , after a just perceptible hesitation , replied , with profuse thanks , and in a tone that did not carry complete conviction , that [he]527-the young man was already engaged ; but when [they]2349-they had reached the comparative reassurance of [the street]2225-the street [he]527-the young man asked if [he]527-the young man might call that afternoon . [Archer]430-archer , at ease in the midsummer leisure of [the office]3721-the office , fixed an hour and scribbled [his]430-archer address , which [the Frenchman]2352-the frenchman pocketed with reiterated thanks and a wide flourish of [his]2352-the frenchman hat . [A horse - car]2353-a horse - car received [him]430-archer , and [Archer]430-archer walked away . Punctually at the hour [M. Riviere]436-m. riviere appeared , shaved , smoothed - out , but still unmistakably drawn and serious . [Archer]430-archer was alone in [[his]430-archer office]2354-his office , and [the young man]527-the young man , before accepting the seat [he]527-the young man proffered , began abruptly : " [I]527-the young man believe [I]527-the young man saw [you]430-archer , [sir]3197-sir , yesterday in [Boston]146-boston . "[430-archer] [Archer]430-archer sat silent , with the sense of clinging to the edge of a sliding precipice .
