[He]430-archer saw in a flash that if [the family]551-the family had ceased to consult [him]430-archer it was because some deep tribal instinct warned [them]551-the family that [he]430-archer was no longer on [their]551-the family side ; and [he]430-archer recalled , with a start of comprehension , a remark of [May]430-archer 's during [their]2366-they drive [home]649-home from [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's on the day of the Archery Meeting : " Perhaps , after all , [Ellen]232-ellen would be happier with [[her]232-ellen husband]663-her husband . "[430-archer] Even in the tumult of new discoveries [Archer]430-archer remembered [his]430-archer indignant exclamation , and the fact that since then [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife had never named [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska to [him]430-archer . [Her]572-his wife careless allusion had no doubt been the straw held up to see which way the wind blew ; the result had been reported to [the family]551-the family , and thereafter [Archer]430-archer had been tacitly omitted from [their]551-the family counsels . [He]430-archer admired the tribal discipline which made [May]430-archer bow to this decision . [She]572-his wife would not have done so , [he]430-archer knew , had [her]572-his wife conscience protested ; but [she]572-his wife probably shared the family view that [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska would be better off as [an unhappy wife]2371-an unhappy wife than as [a separated one]2372-a separated one , and that there was no use in discussing the case with [Newland]214-archer , who had an awkward way of suddenly not seeming to take the most fundamental things for granted . " [Tenez]462-tenez -- the discovery , [I]436-m. riviere suppose , of what [I]436-m. riviere 'd never thought of before : that [she]1272-the countess 's [an American]4700-an american . And that if [you]527-the young man 're [an American of [HER]1272-the countess kind -- of [your]527-the young man kind]4701-an american of her kind -- of your kind -- things that are accepted in certain other societies , or at least put up with as part of a general convenient give - and - take -- become unthinkable , simply unthinkable . If [[Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's relations]4702-madame olenska 's relations understood what these things were , [their]4702-madame olenska 's relations opposition to [her]1272-the countess returning would no doubt be as unconditional as [her]1272-the countess own ; but [they]4702-madame olenska 's relations seem to regard [[her]1272-the countess husband]663-her husband 's wish to have [her]1272-the countess back as proof of an irresistible longing for domestic life . "[436-m. riviere] [M. Riviere]436-m. riviere paused , and then added : " Whereas it 's far from being as simple as that . "[436-m. riviere] [Archer]214-archer looked back to [the President of [the United States]2379-the united states]2378-the president of the united states , and then down at [his]436-m. riviere desk and at the papers scattered on it . For a second or two [he]436-m. riviere could not trust [himself]436-m. riviere to speak . During this interval [he]436-m. riviere heard [M. Riviere]436-m. riviere 's chair pushed back , and was aware that [the young man]527-the young man had risen . When [he]436-m. riviere glanced up again [he]436-m. riviere saw that [[his]436-m. riviere visitor]2356-his visitor was as moved as [himself]436-m. riviere . " Thank [you]2356-his visitor , "[214-archer] [Archer]214-archer said simply . " There 's nothing to thank [me]214-archer for , [Monsieur]4704-monsieur : it is [I]214-archer , rather-- "[214-archer] [M. Riviere]436-m. riviere broke off , as if speech for [him]527-the young man too were difficult . " [I]436-m. riviere should like , though , "[436-m. riviere] [he]436-m. riviere continued in a firmer voice , " to add one thing . [You]2356-his visitor asked [me]436-m. riviere if [I]436-m. riviere was in [[Count Olenski]278-count olenski 's employ]4705-count olenski 's employ . [I]436-m. riviere am at this moment : [I]436-m. riviere returned to [him]278-count olenski , a few months ago , for reasons of private necessity such as may happen to [any one who has [persons]4707-persons , ill and [older persons]4708-older persons , dependent on [him]278-count olenski]4706-any one who has persons , ill and older persons , dependent on him . That 's all , [Monsieur]4709-monsieur . "[436-m. riviere] [M. Riviere]436-m. riviere bowed and drew back a step . " Thank [you]2356-his visitor , "[214-archer] [Archer]214-archer said again , as [their]2384-their hands met . XXVI . Every year on the fifteenth of October [Fifth Avenue]15-fifth avenue opened [its]15-fifth avenue shutters , unrolled [its]15-fifth avenue carpets and hung up [its]15-fifth avenue triple layer of window - curtains . By the first of November this household ritual was over , and society had begun to look about and take stock of [itself]2385-itself . By the fifteenth the season was in full blast , Opera and [theatres]2386-theatres were putting forth [their]2387-their new attractions , dinner - engagements were accumulating , and dates for dances being fixed . And punctually at about this time [Mrs. Archer]214-archer always said that [New York]2-new york was very much changed . Observing it from the lofty stand - point of [a non - participant]2388-a non - participant , [she]214-archer was able , with the help of [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson and [Miss Sophy]262-miss jackson , to trace each new crack in its surface , and all the strange weeds pushing up between the ordered rows of social vegetables . It had been one of the amusements of [Archer]214-archer 's youth to wait for this annual pronouncement of [[his]2389-his mother]528-his mother 's , and to hear [her]214-archer enumerate the minute signs of disintegration that [his]2389-his careless gaze had overlooked . For [New York]2-new york , to [Mrs. Archer]214-archer 's mind , never changed without changing for the worse ; and in this view [Miss Sophy Jackson]262-miss jackson heartily concurred . [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson , as became [a man of [the world]580-the world]2391-a man of the world , suspended [his]224-mr. jackson judgment and listened with an amused impartiality to the lamentations of [the ladies]754-the ladies . But even [he]224-mr. jackson never denied that [New York]2-new york had changed ; and [Newland Archer]214-archer , in the winter of the second year of [his]2389-his marriage , was [himself]2389-his obliged to admit that if it had not actually changed it was certainly changing . These points had been raised , as usual , at [Mrs. Archer]214-archer 's Thanksgiving dinner . At the date when [she]214-archer was officially enjoined to give thanks for the blessings of the year it was [her]214-archer habit to take [a mournful though not embittered stock of [[her]214-archer world]2395-her world]2394-a mournful though not embittered stock of her world , and wonder what there was to be thankful for . At any rate , not the state of society ; society , if it could be said to exist , was rather a spectacle on which to call down Biblical imprecations -- and in fact , [every one]653-every one knew what [the Reverend Dr. Ashmore]463-dr. ashmore meant when [he]463-dr. ashmore chose a text from [Jeremiah]464-jeremiah ( chap . ii . , verse 25 ) for [his]463-dr. ashmore Thanksgiving sermon . [Dr. Ashmore]463-dr. ashmore , [the new Rector of St. Matthew]2397-the new rector of st. matthew 's , had been chosen because [he]463-dr. ashmore was very " advanced "[463-dr. ashmore] : [his]463-dr. ashmore sermons were considered bold in thought and novel in language . When [he]463-dr. ashmore fulminated against [fashionable society]2398-fashionable society [he]463-dr. ashmore always spoke of its " trend "[463-dr. ashmore] ; and to [Mrs. Archer]214-archer it was terrifying and yet fascinating to feel [herself]214-archer part of a community that was trending . " There 's no doubt that [Dr. Ashmore]463-dr. ashmore is right : there IS a marked trend , "[214-archer] [she]214-archer said , as if it were something visible and measurable , like a crack in [a house]3206-a house . " It was odd , though , to preach about it on Thanksgiving , "[214-archer] [Miss Jackson]262-miss jackson opined ; and [[her]262-miss jackson hostess]2400-her hostess drily rejoined : " Oh , [he]463-dr. ashmore means [us]4710-us to give thanks for what 's left . "[2400-her hostess] [Archer]214-archer had been wo nt to smile at these annual vaticinations of [[his]463-dr. ashmore mother]528-his mother 's ; but this year even [he]463-dr. ashmore was obliged to acknowledge , as [he]463-dr. ashmore listened to an enumeration of the changes , that the " trend "[262-miss jackson] was visible . " The extravagance in dress-- "[262-miss jackson] [Miss Jackson]262-miss jackson began . " [Sillerton]224-mr. jackson took [me]262-miss jackson to the first night of [the Opera]517-the opera , and [I]262-miss jackson can only tell [you]4712-you that [Jane Merry]465-jane merry 's dress was the only one [I]262-miss jackson recognised from last year ; and even that had had the front panel changed . Yet [I]262-miss jackson know [she]214-archer got it out from Worth only two years ago , because [[my]262-miss jackson seamstress]4713-my seamstress always goes in to make over [her]214-archer [Paris]3-paris dresses before [she]214-archer wears them . "[262-miss jackson] " Ah , [Jane Merry]465-jane merry is one of [US]4714-us , "[214-archer] said [Mrs. Archer]214-archer sighing , as if it were not such an enviable thing to be in an age when [ladies]2402-ladies were beginning to flaunt abroad [their]2402-ladies Paris dresses as soon as [they]2402-ladies were out of [the Custom House]2403-the custom house , instead of letting them mellow under lock and key , in the manner of [[Mrs. Archer]214-archer 's contemporaries]2404-mrs. archer 's contemporaries . " Yes ; [she]214-archer 's one of the few . In [my]214-archer youth , "[214-archer] [Miss Jackson]262-miss jackson rejoined , " it was considered vulgar to dress in the newest fashions ; and [Amy Sillerton]450-amy sillerton has always told [me]262-miss jackson that in [Boston]146-boston the rule was to put away one 's Paris dresses for two years . [Old Mrs. Baxter Pennilow]466-old mrs. baxter pennilow , who did everything handsomely , used to import twelve a year , two velvet , two satin , two silk , and the other six of poplin and the finest cashmere . It was a standing order , and as [she]214-archer was ill for two years before [she]214-archer died [they]4715-they found forty - eight Worth dresses that had never been taken out of tissue paper ; and when [the girls]3101-the girls left off [their]3101-the girls mourning [they]3101-the girls were able to wear the first lot at the Symphony concerts without looking in advance of the fashion . "[262-miss jackson] " Ah , well , [Boston]146-boston is more conservative than [New York]2-new york ; but [I]214-archer always think it 's a safe rule for [a lady]698-a lady to lay aside [her]698-a lady French dresses for one season , "[214-archer] [Mrs. Archer]214-archer conceded . " It was [Beaufort]230-beaufort who started the new fashion by making [[his]4718-his wife]572-his wife clap [her]572-his wife new clothes on [her]572-his wife back as soon as [they]4720-they arrived : [I]214-archer must say at times it takes all [Regina]248-regina 's distinction not to look like ... like ... "[214-archer] [Miss Jackson]262-miss jackson glanced around the table , caught [Janey]263-janey 's bulging gaze , and took refuge in an unintelligible murmur . " Like [[her]248-regina rivals]4434-her rivals , "[224-mr. jackson] said [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson , with the air of producing an epigram . " Oh,-- "[754-the ladies] [the ladies]754-the ladies murmured ; and [Mrs. Archer]214-archer added , partly to distract [[her]214-archer daughter]553-her daughter 's attention from forbidden topics : " [Poor Regina]467-poor regina ! [Her]248-regina Thanksgiving has n't been a very cheerful one , [I]214-archer 'm afraid . Have [you]224-mr. jackson heard the rumours about [Beaufort]230-beaufort 's speculations , [Sillerton]224-mr. jackson ? "[214-archer] [Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson nodded carelessly . [Every one]653-every one had heard the rumours in question , and [he]224-mr. jackson scorned to confirm a tale that was already common property . A gloomy silence fell upon [the party]2180-the party . [No one]619-no one really liked [Beaufort]230-beaufort , and it was not wholly unpleasant to think the worst of [his]2410-his private life ; but the idea of [his]2410-his having brought financial dishonour on [[[his]2410-his wife]572-his wife 's family]2412-his wife 's family was too shocking to be enjoyed even by [[his]2410-his enemies]2413-his enemies . [Archer]214-archer 's [New York]2-new york tolerated hypocrisy in private relations ; but in business matters it exacted a limpid and impeccable honesty . It was a long time since [any well - known banker]2414-any well - known banker had failed discreditably ; but [every one]653-every one remembered the social extinction visited on the heads of [the firm]1482-the firm when the last event of the kind had happened . It would be the same with [the Beauforts]246-the beauforts , in spite of [his]2410-his power and [her]572-his wife popularity ; not all the leagued strength of the [Dallas]498-dallas connection would save [poor Regina]467-poor regina if there were any truth in the reports of [[her]572-his wife husband]663-her husband 's unlawful speculations . The talk took refuge in less ominous topics ; but everything [they]2418-they touched on seemed to confirm [Mrs. Archer]214-archer 's sense of an accelerated trend . " Of course , [Newland]214-archer , [I]214-archer know [you]214-archer let dear May go to [Mrs. Struthers]259-mrs. struthers 's Sunday evenings-- "[214-archer] [she]214-archer began ; and [May]430-archer interposed gaily : " Oh , [you]214-archer know , [everybody]604-everybody goes to [Mrs. Struthers]259-mrs. struthers 's now ; and [she]259-mrs. struthers was invited to [Granny]243-granny 's last reception . "[214-archer] It was thus , [Archer]430-archer reflected , that [New York]2-new york managed its transitions : conspiring to ignore [them]2419-they till [they]2419-they were well over , and then , in all good faith , imagining that [they]2419-they had taken place in a preceding age . There was always [a traitor]2420-a traitor in [the citadel]2421-the citadel ; and after [he]2422-he ( or generally [she]2423-she ) had surrendered the keys , what was the use of pretending that it was impregnable ? "[224-mr. jackson] [Archer]214-archer said nothing . Four months had passed since the midsummer day that [he]527-the young man and [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska had spent together ; and since then [he]527-the young man had not seen [her]240-madame olenska . [He]527-the young man knew that [she]240-madame olenska had returned to [Washington]111-washington , to [the little house which [she]240-madame olenska and [Medora Manson]229-medora manson had taken [there]732-there]2445-the little house which she and medora manson had taken there : [he]527-the young man had written to [her]240-madame olenska once -- a few words , asking when [they]2447-they were to meet again -- and [she]240-madame olenska had even more briefly replied : " Not yet . "[240-madame olenska] Since then there had been no farther communication between [them]2447-they , and [he]527-the young man had built up within [himself]527-the young man a kind of sanctuary in which [she]240-madame olenska throned among [his]527-the young man secret thoughts and longings . Little by little it became the scene of [his]527-the young man real life , of [his]527-the young man only rational activities ; thither [he]527-the young man brought the books [he]527-the young man read , the ideas and feelings which nourished [him]527-the young man , [his]527-the young man judgments and [his]527-the young man visions . "[926-the other] " Oh , [she]240-madame olenska wo n't go back now : less than ever ! "[430-archer] [Archer]430-archer had no sooner said it than [he]430-archer had once more the feeling that it was exactly what [Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson had been waiting for . [The old gentleman]2453-the old gentleman considered [him]430-archer attentively . " That 's [your]430-archer opinion , eh ? Well , no doubt [you]430-archer know . "[2453-the old gentleman] [Archer]430-archer was burning with unavailing wrath : [he]430-archer was exactly in [the state]3594-the state when [a man]933-a man is sure to do something stupid , knowing all the while that [he]933-a man is doing it . [He]430-archer saw that [Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson had been instantly struck by the fact that [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's differences with [[her]240-madame olenska grandmother]853-her grandmother and [[her]240-madame olenska other relations]1215-her other relations were not known to [him]224-mr. jackson , and that [the old gentleman]2453-the old gentleman had drawn [his]2453-the old gentleman own conclusions as to the reasons for [Archer]430-archer 's exclusion from the family councils . This fact warned [Archer]430-archer to go warily ; but the insinuations about [Beaufort]230-beaufort made [him]430-archer reckless . [He]430-archer was mindful , however , if not of [his]430-archer own danger , at least of the fact that [Mr. Jackson]224-mr. jackson was under [[his]224-mr. jackson mother]528-his mother 's roof , and consequently [[his]224-mr. jackson guest]3407-his guest . [Old New York]471-old new york scrupulously observed the etiquette of hospitality , and no discussion with [a guest]2461-a guest was ever allowed to degenerate into a disagreement . " Shall [we]4754-we go up and join [[my]430-archer mother]3170-my mother ? " Look here , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said suddenly , " [I]430-archer may have to go to [Washington]111-washington for a few days -- soon ; next week perhaps . " On business , naturally . There 's a patent case coming up before the Supreme Court-- "[430-archer] [He]430-archer gave the name of [the inventor]2470-the inventor , and went on furnishing details with all [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts 's practised glibness , while [she]2463-she listened attentively , saying at intervals : " Yes , [I]2463-she see . "[2463-she] " The change will do [you]430-archer good , "[2463-she] [she]2463-she said simply , when [he]430-archer had finished ; " and [you]430-archer must be sure to go and see [Ellen]232-ellen , "[2463-she] [she]2463-she added , looking [him]430-archer straight in the eyes with [her]2463-she cloudless smile , and speaking in the tone [she]2463-she might have employed in urging [him]430-archer not to neglect some irksome family duty . It was the only word that passed between [them]2471-our on the subject ; but in the code in which [they]2471-our had both been trained it meant : " Of course [you]430-archer understand that [I]2472-i know all that [people]637-people have been saying about [Ellen]232-ellen , and heartily sympathise with [[my]2472-i family]1576-my family in [their]1576-my family effort to get [her]232-ellen to return to [[her]232-ellen husband]663-her husband . [Wall Street]133-wall street , the next day , had more reassuring reports of [Beaufort]230-beaufort 's situation . They were not definite , but [they]2474-they were hopeful . It was generally understood that [he]2473-he could call on powerful influences in case of emergency , and that [he]2473-he had done so with success ; and that evening , when [Mrs. Beaufort]230-beaufort appeared at [the Opera]23-the opera wearing [her]230-beaufort old smile and a new emerald necklace , [society]2475-society drew a breath of relief . [New York]2-new york was inexorable in [its]2-new york condemnation of business irregularities . So far there had been no exception to [its]2-new york tacit rule that [those who broke the law of probity]2476-those who broke the law of probity must pay ; and [every one]653-every one was aware that even [Beaufort]230-beaufort and [[Beaufort]230-beaufort 's wife]2478-beaufort 's wife would be offered up unflinchingly to this principle . But to be obliged to offer [them]2479-them up would be not only painful but inconvenient . The disappearance of [the Beauforts]246-the beauforts would leave a considerable void in [their]2479-them compact little circle ; and [those who were too ignorant or too careless to shudder at the moral catastrophe]2480-those who were too ignorant or too careless to shudder at the moral catastrophe bewailed in advance the loss of [the best ball - room in [New York]2-new york]2481-the best ball - room in new york . [Archer]430-archer had definitely made up [his]430-archer mind to go to [Washington]111-washington . [He]430-archer was waiting only for the opening of the law - suit of which [he]430-archer had spoken to [May]430-archer , so that its date might coincide with that of [his]430-archer visit ; but on the following Tuesday [he]430-archer learned from [Mr. Letterblair]357-mr. letterblair that the case might be postponed for several weeks . Nevertheless , [he]430-archer went [home]649-home that afternoon determined in any event to leave the next evening . The chances were that [May]430-archer , who knew nothing of [his]430-archer professional life , and had never shown any interest in it , would not learn of the postponement , should it take place , nor remember the names of [the litigants]2483-the litigants if [they]2483-the litigants were mentioned before [her]2484-her ; and at any rate [he]430-archer could no longer put off seeing [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska . There were too many things that [he]430-archer must say to [her]2484-her . On the Wednesday morning , when [he]430-archer reached [[his]430-archer office]2354-his office , [Mr. Letterblair]357-mr. letterblair met [him]430-archer with a troubled face . [Beaufort]230-beaufort , after all , had not managed to " tide over "[430-archer] ; but by setting afloat the rumour that [he]430-archer had done so [he]430-archer had reassured [[his]430-archer depositors]2486-his depositors , and heavy payments had poured into [the bank]4509-the bank till the previous evening , when disturbing reports again began to predominate . In consequence , a run on [the bank]4509-the bank had begun , and [its]4509-the bank doors were likely to close before the day was over . The ugliest things were being said of [Beaufort]230-beaufort 's dastardly manoeuvre , and [his]430-archer failure promised to be one of the most discreditable in the history of [Wall Street]133-wall street . The extent of the calamity left [Mr. Letterblair]357-mr. letterblair white and incapacitated . " [I]357-mr. letterblair 've seen bad things in [my]357-mr. letterblair time ; but nothing as bad as this . [[Everybody]604-everybody [we]4769-we know]4768-everybody we know will be hit , one way or another . And what will be done about [Mrs. Beaufort]230-beaufort ? What CAN be done about [her]230-beaufort ? [I]357-mr. letterblair pity [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott as much as [anybody]3094-anybody : coming at [her]230-beaufort age , there 's no knowing what effect this affair may have on [her]230-beaufort . [She]230-beaufort always believed in [Beaufort]230-beaufort -- [she]230-beaufort made [a friend of [him]430-archer]4771-a friend of him ! "[357-mr. letterblair] There was a knock , and [Mr. Letterblair]357-mr. letterblair turned [his]357-mr. letterblair head sharply . " What is it ? [I]357-mr. letterblair ca n't be disturbed . "[357-mr. letterblair] [A clerk]2489-a clerk brought in a letter for [Archer]430-archer and withdrew . [The hall]755-the hall wore the unnatural appearance peculiar to well - kept houses suddenly invaded by illness : wraps and furs lay in heaps on the chairs , [a doctor]2501-a doctor 's bag and overcoat were on the table , and beside them letters and cards had already piled up unheeded . [May]430-archer looked pale but smiling : [Dr. Bencomb]454-dr. bencomb , who had just come for the second time , took a more hopeful view , and [Mrs. Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's dauntless determination to live and get well was already having an effect on [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott family]1211-her family . ' "[2520-the old woman] So much , with tears and gasps of horror , [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland imparted , blanched and demolished by the unwonted obligation of having at last to fix [her]218-mrs. welland eyes on the unpleasant and the discreditable . "[218-mrs. welland] [Archer]430-archer had seated [himself]430-archer near the window and was gazing out blankly at [the deserted thoroughfare]2525-the deserted thoroughfare . " There was the case of [poor [Grandmamma Spicer]477-grandmamma spicer]4785-poor grandmamma spicer ; [[your]461-mr. lovell mingott great - grandmother]4786-your great - grandmother , [May]430-archer . Of course , "[218-mrs. welland] [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland hastened to add , " [[your]461-mr. lovell mingott great - grandfather]4787-your great - grandfather 's money difficulties were private -- losses at cards , or signing a note for [somebody]3210-somebody -- [I]218-mrs. welland never quite knew , because [Mamma]244-mamma would never speak of it . But [she]244-mamma was brought up in [the country]3706-the country because [[her]244-mamma mother]605-her mother had to leave [New York]2-new york after the disgrace , whatever it was : [they]4791-they lived up [the Hudson]58-the hudson alone , winter and summer , till [Mamma]244-mamma was sixteen . "[218-mrs. welland] " Yes , it would be more becoming in [Regina]475-beaufort to hide [her]475-beaufort own countenance than to talk about [other people]1903-other people 's , "[217-mrs. lovell mingott] [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]217-mrs. lovell mingott agreed . " [I]430-archer understand that the emerald necklace [she]477-grandmamma spicer wore at the Opera last Friday had been sent on approval from Ball and Black 's in the afternoon . [I]430-archer wonder if [they]4795-they 'll ever get it back ? "[430-archer] [Archer]430-archer listened unmoved to the relentless chorus . The idea of absolute financial probity as the first law of [a gentleman]3166-a gentleman 's code was too deeply ingrained in [him]430-archer for sentimental considerations to weaken it . [An adventurer like [Lemuel Struthers]259-mrs. struthers]2536-an adventurer like lemuel struthers might build up the millions of [his]2536-an adventurer like lemuel struthers Shoe Polish on any number of shady dealings ; but unblemished honesty was the noblesse oblige of old financial [New York]2-new york . Nor did [Mrs. Beaufort]230-beaufort 's fate greatly move [Archer]430-archer . [He]430-archer felt , no doubt , more sorry for [her]230-beaufort than [[her]230-beaufort indignant relatives]2537-her indignant relatives ; but it seemed to [him]430-archer that the tie between [husband]1175-husband and [wife]1176-wife , even if breakable in prosperity , should be indissoluble in misfortune . As [Mr. Letterblair]357-mr. letterblair had said , [a wife]1015-a wife 's place was at [[her]1015-a wife husband]663-her husband 's side when [he]663-her husband was in trouble ; but [[society]1441-society 's place]2543-society 's place was not at [his]663-her husband side , and [Mrs. Beaufort]230-beaufort 's cool assumption that it was seemed almost to make [her]230-beaufort [[his]663-her husband accomplice]2544-his accomplice . The mere idea of [a woman]4639-a woman 's appealing to [[her]4639-a woman family]1211-her family to screen [[her]4639-a woman husband]663-her husband 's business dishonour was inadmissible , since it was the one thing that [the Family]551-the family , as [an institution]2549-an institution , could not do . [The mulatto maid]2512-the mulatto maid called [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]217-mrs. lovell mingott into [the hall]755-the hall , and [the latter]592-the latter came back in a moment with a frowning brow . " [She]2512-the mulatto maid wants [me]592-the latter to telegraph for [Ellen Olenska]232-ellen . [I]592-the latter had written to [Ellen]232-ellen , of course , and to [Medora]229-medora manson ; but now it seems that 's not enough . "[592-the latter] The announcement was received in silence . " Very bad , eh ? "[223-lawrence lefferts] [Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts continued . " Wiring to [the family]551-the family , [I]223-lawrence lefferts suppose . "[430-archer] [he]430-archer questioned . Nothing could be worse " form "[223-lawrence lefferts] the look reminded [Archer]430-archer , than any display of temper in a public place . [There Archer]430-archer , having regained [his]430-archer self - control , went on : " [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. lovell mingott is much better : [the doctor]2517-the doctor feels no anxiety whatever "[430-archer] ; and [Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts , with profuse expressions of relief , asked [him]430-archer if [he]430-archer had heard that there were beastly bad rumours again about [Beaufort]230-beaufort .... That afternoon the announcement of the Beaufort failure was in all the papers . It overshadowed the report of [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's stroke , and only [the few who had heard of the mysterious connection between the two events]2568-the few who had heard of the mysterious connection between the two events thought of ascribing [old Catherine]409-old catherine 's illness to anything but the accumulation of flesh and years . [The whole of [New York]2-new york]3190-the whole of new york was darkened by the tale of [Beaufort]230-beaufort 's dishonour . There had never , as [Mr. Letterblair]357-mr. letterblair said , been a worse case in [his]357-mr. letterblair memory , nor , for that matter , in the memory of [the far - off Letterblair who had given [his]357-mr. letterblair name to [the firm]1482-the firm]2570-the far - off letterblair who had given his name to the firm . [The bank]4509-the bank had continued to take in money for a whole day after [its]4509-the bank failure was inevitable ; and as [many of [[its]4509-the bank clients]2574-its clients]2573-many of its clients belonged to one or another of [the ruling clans]1081-the ruling clans , [Beaufort]230-beaufort 's duplicity seemed doubly cynical . If [Mrs. Beaufort]230-beaufort had not taken the tone that such misfortunes ( the word was [her]230-beaufort own ) were " the test of friendship , "[230-beaufort] compassion for [her]230-beaufort might have tempered the general indignation against [[her]230-beaufort husband]663-her husband . As it was -- and especially after the object of [her]230-beaufort nocturnal visit to [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott had become known -- [her]230-beaufort cynicism was held to exceed [his]663-her husband ; and [she]230-beaufort had not the excuse -- nor [[her]230-beaufort detractors]2577-her detractors the satisfaction -- of pleading that [she]230-beaufort was " [a foreigner]4813-a foreigner . "[230-beaufort] It was some comfort ( to those whose securities were not in jeopardy ) to be able to remind [themselves]2578-themselves that [Beaufort]230-beaufort WAS ; but , after all , if [a Dallas of [South Carolina]6-south carolina]2579-a dallas of south carolina took [his]2579-a dallas of south carolina view of the case , and glibly talked of [his]2579-a dallas of south carolina soon being " on [his]2579-a dallas of south carolina feet again , "[230-beaufort] the argument lost its edge , and there was nothing to do but to accept this awful evidence of the indissolubility of marriage . Society must manage to get on without [the Beauforts]246-the beauforts , and there was an end of it -- except indeed for [such hapless victims of the disaster]2580-such hapless victims of the disaster as [Medora Manson]229-medora manson , [the poor old Miss Lannings]294-the lannings , and [certain other misguided ladies of [good family]2582-good family who , if only [they]2580-such hapless victims of the disaster had listened to [Mr. Henry van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden]2581-certain other misguided ladies of good family who , if only they had listened to mr. henry van der luyden ... " The best thing [the Beauforts]246-the beauforts can do , "[214-archer] said [Mrs. Archer]214-archer , summing it up as if [she]214-archer were pronouncing a diagnosis and prescribing a course of treatment , " is to go and live at [[Regina]475-beaufort 's little place in [North Carolina]164-north carolina]4814-regina 's little place in north carolina . [Beaufort]475-beaufort has always kept [a racing stable]4815-a racing stable , and [he]304-mr. van der luyden had better breed trotting horses . [I]214-archer should say [he]304-mr. van der luyden had all the qualities of [a successful horsedealer]4816-a successful horsedealer . "[214-archer] [Every one]653-every one agreed with [her]214-archer , but [no one]619-no one condescended to enquire what [the Beauforts]246-the beauforts really meant to do . The next day [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott was much better : [she]216-mrs. manson mingott recovered [her]216-mrs. manson mingott voice sufficiently to give orders that [no one]619-no one should mention [the Beauforts]246-the beauforts to [her]216-mrs. manson mingott again , and asked -- when [Dr. Bencomb]454-dr. bencomb appeared -- what in [the world]580-the world [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott family]1211-her family meant by making such a fuss about [her]216-mrs. manson mingott health . " If [people of]4817-people of [my]216-mrs. manson mingott age WILL eat chicken - salad in the evening what are [they]4817-people of to expect ? "[216-mrs. manson mingott] [she]216-mrs. manson mingott enquired ; and , [the doctor]2517-the doctor having opportunely modified [her]216-mrs. manson mingott dietary , the stroke was transformed into an attack of indigestion . But in spite of [her]216-mrs. manson mingott firm tone [old Catherine]409-old catherine did not wholly recover [her]216-mrs. manson mingott former attitude toward life . The growing remoteness of old age , though it had not diminished [her]216-mrs. manson mingott curiosity about [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott neighbours]2589-her neighbours , had blunted [her]216-mrs. manson mingott never very lively compassion for [their]2589-her neighbours troubles ; and [she]216-mrs. manson mingott seemed to have no difficulty in putting the Beaufort disaster out of [her]216-mrs. manson mingott mind . But for the first time [she]216-mrs. manson mingott became absorbed in [her]216-mrs. manson mingott own symptoms , and began to take a sentimental interest in [certain members of [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott family]1211-her family to whom [she]216-mrs. manson mingott had hitherto been contemptuously indifferent . [Mr. Welland]339-mr. welland , in particular , had the privilege of attracting [her]216-mrs. manson mingott notice]2590-certain members of her family to whom she had hitherto been contemptuously indifferent . mr. welland , in particular , had the privilege of attracting her notice . Of [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott sons - in - law]2592-her sons - in - law [he]339-mr. welland was the one [she]216-mrs. manson mingott had most consistently ignored ; and all [[his]339-mr. welland wife]572-his wife 's efforts to represent [him]339-mr. welland as [a man of forceful character and marked intellectual ability]2594-a man of forceful character and marked intellectual ability ( if [he]339-mr. welland had only " chosen "[2595-a valetudinarian] ) had been met with a derisive chuckle . But [his]339-mr. welland eminence as [a valetudinarian]2595-a valetudinarian now made [him]339-mr. welland an object of engrossing interest , and [Mrs. Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott issued an imperial summons to [him]339-mr. welland to come and compare diets as soon as [his]339-mr. welland temperature permitted ; for [old Catherine]409-old catherine was now the first to recognise that one could not be too careful about temperatures . Twenty - four hours after [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's summons a telegram announced that [she]216-mrs. manson mingott would arrive from [Washington]111-washington on the evening of the following day . At [the Wellands ']324-the wellands , where [the Newland Archers]261-the newland archers chanced to be lunching , the question as to who should meet [her]216-mrs. manson mingott at [Jersey City]166-jersey city was immediately raised ; and the material difficulties amid which [the Welland household]2596-the welland household struggled as if [it]2596-the welland household had been [a frontier outpost]2597-a frontier outpost , lent animation to the debate . It was agreed that [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland could not possibly go to [Jersey City]166-jersey city because [she]218-mrs. welland was to accompany [[her]218-mrs. welland husband]663-her husband to [old Catherine]236-old catherine 's that afternoon , and [the brougham]2599-the brougham could not be spared , since , if [Mr. Welland]339-mr. welland were " upset "[339-mr. welland] by seeing [[his]339-mr. welland mother - in - law]2560-his mother - in - law for the first time after [her]218-mrs. welland attack , [he]339-mr. welland might have to be taken [home]649-home at a moment 's notice . [The Welland sons]2602-the welland sons would of course be " [down town]4653-down town , "[2602-the welland sons] [Mr. Lovell Mingott]461-mr. lovell mingott would be just hurrying back from [his]461-mr. lovell mingott shooting , and [the Mingott]461-mr. lovell mingott carriage engaged in meeting [him]461-mr. lovell mingott ; and [one]519-one could not ask [May]430-archer , at the close of a winter afternoon , to go alone across [the ferry]2604-the ferry to [Jersey City]166-jersey city , even in [[her]2605-her own carriage]2097-her own carriage . It was just like [Ellen]232-ellen , [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland 's tired voice implied , to place [the family]551-the family in such a dilemma . " It 's always one thing after another , "[3691-the poor lady] [the poor lady]3691-the poor lady grieved , in one of [her]3691-the poor lady rare revolts against fate ; " the only thing that makes [me]3691-the poor lady think [Mamma]244-mamma must be less well than [Dr. Bencomb]454-dr. bencomb will admit is this morbid desire to have [Ellen]232-ellen come at once , however inconvenient it is to meet [her]232-ellen . "[3691-the poor lady] The words had been thoughtless , as the utterances of impatience often are ; and [Mr. Welland]339-mr. welland was upon [them]2611-them with a pounce . " [Augusta]274-augusta , "[339-mr. welland] [he]339-mr. welland said , turning pale and laying down [his]339-mr. welland fork , " have [you]274-augusta any other reason for thinking that [Bencomb]454-dr. bencomb is less to be relied on than [he]339-mr. welland was ? "[339-mr. welland] It was [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland 's turn to grow pale as the endless consequences of [her]218-mrs. welland blunder unrolled themselves before [her]218-mrs. welland ; but [she]218-mrs. welland managed to laugh , and take a second helping of scalloped oysters , before [she]218-mrs. welland said , struggling back into [her]218-mrs. welland old armour of cheerfulness : " [[My]218-mrs. welland dear]3140-my dear , how could [you]3140-my dear imagine such a thing ? "[339-mr. welland] And having arrived at this Spartan decision [Mr. Welland]339-mr. welland firmly took up [his]339-mr. welland fork . " But all the while , "[339-mr. welland] [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland began again , as [she]218-mrs. welland rose from the luncheon - table , and led the way into the wilderness of purple satin and malachite known as [the back drawing - room]2612-the back drawing - room , " [I]218-mrs. welland do n't see how [Ellen]232-ellen 's to be got [here]3155-here tomorrow evening ; and [I]218-mrs. welland do like to have things settled for at least twenty - four hours ahead . "[218-mrs. welland] " Oh , [I]430-archer 'm not going , "[430-archer] [Archer]430-archer answered . " Not going ? Why , what 's happened ? "[218-mrs. welland] [Her]218-mrs. welland voice was as clear as a bell , and full of wifely solicitude . " The case is off -- postponed . "[218-mrs. welland] " Postponed ? How odd ! [I]218-mrs. welland saw a note this morning from [Mr. Letterblair]357-mr. letterblair to [Mamma]244-mamma saying that [he]357-mr. letterblair was going to [Washington]111-washington tomorrow for the big patent case that [he]357-mr. letterblair was to argue before the Supreme Court . " No : but [my]430-archer going is , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer answered , cursing the unnecessary explanations that [he]430-archer had given when [he]430-archer had announced [his]430-archer intention of going to [Washington]111-washington , and wondering where [he]430-archer had read that [clever liars]2617-clever liars give details , but that [the cleverest]2618-the cleverest do not . " [I]430-archer 'm not going till later on : luckily for the convenience of [[your]218-mrs. welland family]3323-your family , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer continued , taking base refuge in sarcasm . It 's all of two hours -- and it may be more . "[430-archer] XXIX . [[His]430-archer wife]572-his wife 's dark blue brougham ( with the wedding varnish still on it ) met [Archer]430-archer at [the ferry]2604-the ferry , and conveyed [him]430-archer luxuriously to [the [Pennsylvania]169-pennsylvania terminus in [Jersey City]166-jersey city]2624-the pennsylvania terminus in jersey city . It was a sombre snowy afternoon , and the gas - lamps were lit in [the big reverberating station]2625-the big reverberating station . As [he]430-archer paced [the platform]4192-the platform , waiting for the [Washington]111-washington express , [he]430-archer remembered that there were people who thought there would one day be [a tunnel under [the Hudson]58-the hudson through which [the trains of]2628-the trains of [the [Pennsylvania]169-pennsylvania railway]169-pennsylvania]2627-a tunnel under the hudson through which the trains of the pennsylvania railway would run straight into [New York]2-new york . [They]2629-they were of [the brotherhood of visionaries who likewise predicted the building of [ships]2631-ships that would cross [the Atlantic]56-the atlantic]2630-the brotherhood of visionaries who likewise predicted the building of ships that would cross the atlantic in five days , the invention of a flying machine , lighting by electricity , telephonic communication without wires , and other Arabian Night marvels . " [I]430-archer do n't care which of [their]2629-they visions comes true , "[430-archer] [Archer]430-archer mused , " as long as [the tunnel]4838-the tunnel is n't built yet . "[430-archer] In [his]430-archer senseless school - boy happiness [he]430-archer pictured [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's descent from [the train]4171-the train , [his]430-archer discovery of [her]240-madame olenska a long way off , among [the throngs of meaningless faces]2633-the throngs of meaningless faces , [her]240-madame olenska clinging to [his]430-archer arm as [he]430-archer guided [her]240-madame olenska to [the carriage]878-the carriage , [their]2635-their slow approach to [the wharf]2273-the wharf among slipping horses , [laden carts]2637-laden carts , [vociferating teamsters]2638-vociferating teamsters , and then the startling quiet of [the ferry - boat]2639-the ferry - boat , where [they]2635-their would sit side by side under the snow , in [the motionless carriage]2640-the motionless carriage , while [the earth]2641-the earth seemed to glide away under [them]2635-their , rolling to the other side of the sun . It was incredible , the number of things [he]430-archer had to say to [her]240-madame olenska , and in what eloquent order they were forming themselves on [his]430-archer lips ... The clanging and groaning of [the train]4171-the train came nearer , and it staggered slowly into [the station]3828-the station like a prey - laden monster into its lair . [Archer]430-archer pushed forward , elbowing through [the crowd]2644-the crowd , and staring blindly into window after window of [the high - hung carriages]2645-the high - hung carriages . And then , suddenly , [he]430-archer saw [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's pale and surprised face close at hand , and had again the mortified sensation of having forgotten what [she]240-madame olenska looked like . [They]2635-their reached [each other]695-each other , [their]2635-their hands met , and [he]430-archer drew [her]240-madame olenska arm through [his]430-archer . " This way -- [I]430-archer have [the carriage]878-the carriage , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said . After that it all happened as [he]430-archer had dreamed . [He]430-archer helped [her]240-madame olenska into the brougham with [her]240-madame olenska bags , and had afterward the vague recollection of having properly reassured [her]240-madame olenska about [[her]240-madame olenska grandmother]853-her grandmother and given [her]240-madame olenska a summary of the [Beaufort]230-beaufort situation ( [he]430-archer was struck by the softness of [her]240-madame olenska : " [Poor Regina]467-poor regina ! "[240-madame olenska] ) . Meanwhile [the carriage]878-the carriage had worked its way out of the coil about [the station]3828-the station , and [they]2650-they were crawling down the slippery incline to [the wharf]2273-the wharf , menaced by [swaying coal - carts]2652-swaying coal - carts , [bewildered horses]2653-bewildered horses , [dishevelled express - wagons]2654-dishevelled express - wagons , and [an empty hearse]2655-an empty hearse -- ah , [that hearse]2656-that hearse ! [She]240-madame olenska shut [her]240-madame olenska eyes as it passed , and clutched at [Archer]430-archer 's hand . " If only it does n't mean -- poor [Granny]243-granny ! "[240-madame olenska] " Oh , no , no -- [she]243-granny 's much better -- [she]243-granny 's all right , really . There -- [we've]4840-we've passed it ! "[430-archer] [he]430-archer exclaimed , as if that made all the difference . [Her]240-madame olenska hand remained in [his]430-archer , and as [the carriage]878-the carriage lurched across the gang - plank onto [the ferry]2604-the ferry [he]430-archer bent over , unbuttoned [her]240-madame olenska tight brown glove , and kissed [her]240-madame olenska palm as if [he]430-archer had kissed a relic . [She]240-madame olenska disengaged [herself]240-madame olenska with a faint smile , and [he]430-archer said : " [You]240-madame olenska did n't expect [me]240-madame olenska today ? "[240-madame olenska] " Oh , no . "[430-archer] " [I]430-archer meant to go to [Washington]111-washington to see [you]240-madame olenska . "[430-archer] " Oh-- "[240-madame olenska] [she]240-madame olenska exclaimed , as if terrified by the narrowness of [their]2659-their escape . " Do [you]430-archer know -- [I]240-madame olenska hardly remembered [you]430-archer ? "[240-madame olenska] " Hardly remembered [me]430-archer ? "[430-archer] " Oh , yes : [I]240-madame olenska know ! [I]240-madame olenska know ! "[240-madame olenska] " Does it -- do [I]2660-he too : to [you]240-madame olenska ? "[2660-he] [he]2660-he insisted . [She]240-madame olenska nodded , looking out of the window . " [Ellen]232-ellen -- [Ellen]232-ellen -- [Ellen]232-ellen ! "[240-madame olenska] [She]240-madame olenska made no answer , and [he]2660-he sat in silence , watching [her]240-madame olenska profile grow indistinct against the snow - streaked dusk beyond the window . What had [she]240-madame olenska been doing in all those four long months , [he]2660-he wondered ? How little [they]2661-their knew of [each other]695-each other , after all ! The precious moments were slipping away , but [he]2660-he had forgotten everything that [he]2660-he had meant to say to [her]240-madame olenska and could only helplessly brood on the mystery of [their]2661-their remoteness and [their]2661-their proximity , which seemed to be symbolised by the fact of [their]2661-their sitting so close to [each other]695-each other , and yet being unable to see [each other]695-each other 's faces . " What [a pretty carriage]4842-a pretty carriage ! Is it May 's ? "[240-madame olenska] [she]240-madame olenska asked , suddenly turning [her]240-madame olenska face from the window . " Yes . "[2660-he] [He]2660-he made no answer for a moment ; then [he]2660-he said explosively : " [[[Your]240-madame olenska husband]1567-your husband 's secretary]4844-your husband 's secretary came to see [me]2660-he the day after [we]2665-we met in [Boston]146-boston . "[2660-he] In [his]2660-he brief letter to [her]240-madame olenska [he]2660-he had made no allusion to [M. Riviere]436-m. riviere 's visit , and [his]2660-he intention had been to bury the incident in [his]2660-he bosom . But [her]240-madame olenska reminder that [they]2665-we were in [[his]2660-he wife]572-his wife 's carriage provoked [him]2660-he to an impulse of retaliation . "[2660-he] " [M. Riviere]436-m. riviere went to see [you]240-madame olenska ? "[2660-he] " Yes : did n't [you]240-madame olenska know ? "[2667-i] [His]2667-i heart was beating suffocatingly . Would [she]2668-her meet this question with the same composure ? " Yes : [I]2668-her owe [him]436-m. riviere a great debt , "[2668-her] [she]2668-her answered , without the least tremor in [her]2668-her quiet voice . [Her]2668-her tone was so natural , so almost indifferent , that [Archer]430-archer 's turmoil subsided . Once more [she]2668-her had managed , by [her]2668-her sheer simplicity , to make [him]2667-i feel stupidly conventional just when [he]2667-i thought [he]2667-i was flinging convention to the winds . " [I]2667-i think [you]2668-her 're [the most honest woman [I]2667-i ever met]4846-the most honest woman i ever met ! "[2667-i] [he]2667-i exclaimed . " Oh , no -- but probably one of the least fussy , "[2668-her] [she]2668-her answered , a smile in [her]2668-her voice . " Call it what [you]2667-i like : [you]2667-i look at things as they are . "[2668-her] " Ah -- [I've]2668-her had to . [I]2668-her 've had to look at [the Gorgon]481-the gorgon . "[2668-her] " Well -- it has n't blinded [you]2667-i ! [You]2667-i 've seen that [she]481-the gorgon 's just [an old bogey]4847-an old bogey like all the others . "[2668-her] " [She]481-the gorgon does n't blind [one]519-one ; but [she]481-the gorgon dries up [one]519-one 's tears . "[2668-her] The answer checked the pleading on [Archer]430-archer 's lips : it seemed to come from depths of experience beyond [his]430-archer reach . The slow advance of [the ferry - boat]2639-the ferry - boat had ceased , and [her]2668-her bows bumped against the piles of the slip with a violence that made [the brougham]2599-the brougham stagger , and flung [Archer]430-archer and [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska against [each other]695-each other . [The young man]527-the young man , trembling , felt the pressure of [her]2668-her shoulder , and passed [his]527-the young man arm about [her]2668-her . " If [you]2668-her 're not blind , then , [you]2668-her must see that this ca n't last . "[527-the young man] " What ca n't ? "[527-the young man] " [Our]4850-our being together -- and not together . "[527-the young man] " No . [You]527-the young man ought not to have come today , "[2668-her] [she]2668-her said in an altered voice ; and suddenly [she]2668-her turned , flung [her]2668-her arms about [him]527-the young man and pressed [her]2668-her lips to [his]527-the young man . At the same moment [the carriage]878-the carriage began to move , and a gas - lamp at the head of [the slip]2674-the slip flashed its light into the window . [She]2668-her drew away , and [they]2675-they sat silent and motionless while [the brougham]2599-the brougham struggled through the congestion of carriages about [the ferry - landing]2677-the ferry - landing . As [they]2675-they gained [the street]2225-the street [Archer]430-archer began to speak hurriedly . " Do n't be afraid of [me]430-archer : [you]2668-her need n't squeeze [yourself]2668-her back into [your]2668-her corner like that . A stolen kiss is n't what [I]430-archer want . Look : [I]430-archer 'm not even trying to touch the sleeve of [your]2668-her jacket . Do n't suppose that [I]430-archer do n't understand [your]2668-her reasons for not wanting to let this feeling between [us]2675-they dwindle into an ordinary hole - and - corner love - affair . [I]430-archer could n't have spoken like this yesterday , because when [we]2675-they 've been apart , and [I]430-archer 'm looking forward to seeing [you]2668-her , every thought is burnt up in a great flame . But then [you]2668-her come ; and [you]2668-her 're so much more than [I]430-archer remembered , and what [I]430-archer want of [you]2668-her is so much more than an hour or two every now and then , with wastes of thirsty waiting between , that [I]430-archer can sit perfectly still beside [you]2668-her , like this , with that other vision in [my]430-archer mind , just quietly trusting to it to come true . "[430-archer] For a moment [she]2679-she made no reply ; then [she]2679-she asked , hardly above a whisper : " What do [you]430-archer mean by trusting to it to come true ? "[2679-she] [She]2679-she met the words with a long silence , during which [the carriage]878-the carriage rolled down [an obscure side - street]2681-an obscure side - street and then turned into the searching illumination of [Fifth Avenue]15-fifth avenue . " Is it [your]430-archer idea , then , that [I]2679-she should live with [you]430-archer as [[your]430-archer mistress]4854-your mistress -- since [I]2679-she ca n't be [[your]430-archer wife]4740-your wife ? "[2679-she] [she]2679-she asked . The crudeness of the question startled [him]2682-he : the word was one that [women of [his]2682-he class]2683-women of his class fought shy of , even when [their]2683-women of his class talk flitted closest about the topic . [He]2682-he noticed that [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska pronounced it as if it had a recognised place in [her]240-madame olenska vocabulary , and [he]2682-he wondered if it had been used familiarly in [her]240-madame olenska presence in the horrible life [she]240-madame olenska had fled from . [Her]2679-she question pulled [him]2682-he up with a jerk , and [he]2682-he floundered . " [I]2679-she want -- [I]2679-she want somehow to get away with [you]430-archer into a world where words like that -- categories like that -- won't exist . Where [we]4856-we shall be simply [two human beings who love each other]4857-two human beings who love each other , who are [the whole of life to each other]4858-the whole of life to each other ; and nothing else on [earth]901-earth will matter . "[2679-she] [She]2679-she drew a deep sigh that ended in another laugh . " Oh , [[my]2679-she dear]3140-my dear -- where is [that country]4861-that country ? Have [you]2682-he ever been [there]732-there ? "[2679-she] [she]2679-she asked ; and as [he]2682-he remained sullenly dumb [she]2679-she went on : " [I]2679-she know [so many who 've tried to find it]4863-so many who 've tried to find it ; and , believe [me]2679-she , [they]4863-so many who 've tried to find it all got out by mistake at [wayside stations]4864-wayside stations : at places like [Boulogne]171-boulogne , or [Pisa]172-pisa , or [Monte Carlo]173-monte carlo -- and it was n't at all different from [the old world]4865-the old world [they]4863-so many who 've tried to find it 'd left , but only rather smaller and dingier and more promiscuous . "[2679-she] [He]2682-he had never heard [her]2679-she speak in such a tone , and [he]2682-he remembered the phrase [she]2679-she had used a little while before . " Yes , [the Gorgon]4866-the gorgon HAS dried [your]2679-she tears , "[2682-he] [he]2682-he said . " Well , [she]4866-the gorgon opened [my]2682-he eyes too ; it 's a delusion to say that [she]4866-the gorgon blinds [people]637-people . What [she]4866-the gorgon does is just the contrary -- [she]4866-the gorgon fastens [their]637-people eyelids open , so that they 're never again in the blessed darkness . Is n't there a Chinese torture like that ? There ought to be . Ah , believe [me]2682-he , it 's [a miserable little country]4868-a miserable little country ! "[2682-he] [The carriage]878-the carriage had crossed [Forty - second Street]174-forty - second street : [May]430-archer 's sturdy brougham - horse was carrying [them]878-the carriage northward as if [he]2682-he had been [a Kentucky trotter]2685-a kentucky trotter . [Archer]430-archer choked with the sense of wasted minutes and vain words . " Then what , exactly , is [your]2679-she plan for [us]878-the carriage ? "[2682-he] [he]2682-he asked . " For [US]878-the carriage ? But there 's no [US]878-the carriage in that sense ! "[2682-he] " Ah , [I]2686-he 'm beyond that , "[2686-he] [he]2686-he groaned . " No , [you]2686-he 're not ! [You]2686-he 've never been beyond . And [I]2687-she have , "[2687-she] [she]2687-she said , in a strange voice , " and [I]2687-she know what it looks like there . "[2687-she] [He]2686-he sat silent , dazed with inarticulate pain . Then [he]2686-he groped in the darkness of [the carriage]878-the carriage for the little bell that signalled orders to [the coachman]1444-the coachman . [He]2686-he remembered that [May]430-archer rang twice when [she]2687-she wished to stop . [He]2686-he pressed the bell , and [the carriage]878-the carriage drew up beside [the curbstone]2691-the curbstone . " Why are [we]4876-we stopping ? This is not [Granny]243-granny 's , "[2686-he] [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska exclaimed . " No : [I]2686-he shall get out here , "[2686-he] [he]2686-he stammered , opening the door and jumping to [the pavement]2692-the pavement . [He]2686-he closed the door , and leaned for a moment in the window . " [You]2687-she 're right : [I]2686-he ought not to have come today , "[2686-he] [he]2686-he said , lowering [his]2686-he voice so that [the coachman]1444-the coachman should not hear . [She]2687-she bent forward , and seemed about to speak ; but [he]2686-he had already called out the order to drive on , and [the carriage]878-the carriage rolled away while [he]2686-he stood on the corner . The snow was over , and a tingling wind had sprung up , that lashed [his]2686-he face as [he]2686-he stood gazing . Suddenly [he]2686-he felt something stiff and cold on [his]2686-he lashes , and perceived that [he]2686-he had been crying , and that the wind had frozen [his]2686-he tears . [He]2686-he thrust [his]2686-he hands in [his]2686-he pockets , and walked at a sharp pace down [Fifth Avenue]15-fifth avenue to [[his]2686-he own house]934-his own house . XXX . That evening when [Archer]430-archer came down before dinner [he]430-archer found [the drawing - room]983-the drawing - room empty . [He]430-archer and [May]430-archer were dining alone , [all the family]2697-all the family engagements having been postponed since [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's illness ; and as [May]430-archer was the more punctual of the two [he]430-archer was surprised that [she]216-mrs. manson mingott had not preceded [him]430-archer . [He]430-archer knew that [she]216-mrs. manson mingott was at [home]649-home , for while [he]430-archer dressed [he]430-archer had heard [her]216-mrs. manson mingott moving about in [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott room]2511-her room ; and [he]430-archer wondered what had delayed [her]216-mrs. manson mingott . [He]430-archer had fallen into the way of dwelling on such conjectures as a means of tying [his]430-archer thoughts fast to reality . Sometimes [he]430-archer felt as if [he]430-archer had found the clue to [[his]430-archer father - in - law]4546-his father - in - law 's absorption in trifles ; perhaps even [Mr. Welland]339-mr. welland , long ago , had had escapes and visions , and had conjured up all the hosts of domesticity to defend [himself]430-archer against [them]2701-them . When [May]430-archer appeared [he]430-archer thought [she]216-mrs. manson mingott looked tired . [She]216-mrs. manson mingott had put on the low - necked and tightly - laced dinner - dress which [the Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott ceremonial exacted on the most informal occasions , and had built [her]216-mrs. manson mingott fair hair into its usual accumulated coils ; and [her]216-mrs. manson mingott face , in contrast , was wan and almost faded . But [she]216-mrs. manson mingott shone on [him]430-archer with [her]216-mrs. manson mingott usual tenderness , and [her]216-mrs. manson mingott eyes had kept the blue dazzle of the day before . " What became of [you]430-archer , [dear]3127-dear ? "[216-mrs. manson mingott] [she]216-mrs. manson mingott asked . " [I]216-mrs. manson mingott was waiting at [[Granny]243-granny 's]4878-granny 's , and [Ellen]232-ellen came alone , and said [she]232-ellen had dropped [you]430-archer on the way because [you]430-archer had to rush off on business . There 's nothing wrong ? "[216-mrs. manson mingott] " Only some letters [I]216-mrs. manson mingott 'd forgotten , and wanted to get off before dinner . "[216-mrs. manson mingott] " Ah-- "[216-mrs. manson mingott] [she]216-mrs. manson mingott said ; and a moment afterward : " [I]216-mrs. manson mingott 'm sorry [you]430-archer did n't come to [Granny's]482-granny's -- unless the letters were urgent . "[216-mrs. manson mingott] " They were , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer rejoined , surprised at [her]216-mrs. manson mingott insistence . " Besides , [I]216-mrs. manson mingott do n't see why [I]216-mrs. manson mingott should have gone to [[your]430-archer grandmother]4879-your grandmother 's . [I]216-mrs. manson mingott did n't know [you]430-archer were [there]732-there . "[216-mrs. manson mingott] [She]216-mrs. manson mingott turned and moved to the looking - glass above the mantel - piece . As [she]216-mrs. manson mingott stood there , lifting [her]216-mrs. manson mingott long arm to fasten a puff that had slipped from its place in [her]216-mrs. manson mingott intricate hair , [Archer]430-archer was struck by something languid and inelastic in [her]216-mrs. manson mingott attitude , and wondered if the deadly monotony of [their]2702-their lives had laid its weight on [her]216-mrs. manson mingott also . Then [he]430-archer remembered that , as [he]430-archer had left [the house]532-the house that morning , [she]216-mrs. manson mingott had called over the stairs that [she]216-mrs. manson mingott would meet [him]430-archer at [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott grandmother]853-her grandmother 's so that [they]2702-their might drive [home]649-home together . [He]430-archer had called back a cheery " Yes ! "[430-archer] and then , absorbed in other visions , had forgotten [his]430-archer promise . Now [he]430-archer was smitten with compunction , yet irritated that so trifling an omission should be stored up against [him]430-archer after nearly two years of marriage . [He]430-archer was weary of living in [a perpetual tepid honeymoon]2706-a perpetual tepid honeymoon , without the temperature of passion yet with all its exactions . If [May]430-archer had spoken out [her]216-mrs. manson mingott grievances ( [he]430-archer suspected [her]216-mrs. manson mingott of many ) [he]430-archer might have laughed them away ; but [she]216-mrs. manson mingott was trained to conceal imaginary wounds under a Spartan smile . To disguise [his]430-archer own annoyance [he]430-archer asked how [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott grandmother]853-her grandmother was , and [she]216-mrs. manson mingott answered that [Mrs. Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott was still improving , but had been rather disturbed by the last news about [the Beauforts]246-the beauforts . " What news ? "[216-mrs. manson mingott] " It seems [they]246-the beauforts 're going to stay in [New York]2-new york . [I]216-mrs. manson mingott believe [he]430-archer 's going into [an insurance business]4881-an insurance business , or something . [They]246-the beauforts 're looking about for [a small house]4882-a small house . "[216-mrs. manson mingott] The preposterousness of the case was beyond discussion , and [they]2708-they went in to dinner . During dinner [their]2708-they talk moved in its usual limited circle ; but [Archer]430-archer noticed that [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife made no allusion to [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska , nor to old [Catherine]409-old catherine 's reception of [her]572-his wife . [He]430-archer was thankful for the fact , yet felt it to be vaguely ominous . [They]2708-they went up to [the library]769-the library for coffee , and [Archer]430-archer lit a cigar and took down a volume of Michelet . [He]430-archer had taken to history in the evenings since [May]430-archer had shown a tendency to ask [him]430-archer to read aloud whenever [she]572-his wife saw [him]430-archer with a volume of poetry : not that [he]430-archer disliked the sound of [his]430-archer own voice , but because [he]430-archer could always foresee [her]572-his wife comments on what [he]430-archer read . In the days of [their]2708-they engagement [she]572-his wife had simply ( as [he]430-archer now perceived ) echoed what [he]430-archer told [her]572-his wife ; but since [he]430-archer had ceased to provide [her]572-his wife with opinions [she]572-his wife had begun to hazard [her]572-his wife own , with results destructive to [his]430-archer enjoyment of the works commented on . Seeing that [he]430-archer had chosen history [she]572-his wife fetched [her]572-his wife workbasket , drew up an arm - chair to the green - shaded student lamp , and uncovered a cushion [she]572-his wife was embroidering for [his]430-archer sofa . [She]572-his wife was not [a clever needle - woman]2711-a clever needle - woman ; [her]572-his wife large capable hands were made for riding , rowing and open - air activities ; but since [other wives]2712-other wives embroidered cushions for [[their]2712-other wives husbands]2713-their husbands [she]572-his wife did not wish to omit this last link in [her]572-his wife devotion . [She]572-his wife was so placed that [Archer]430-archer , by merely raising [his]430-archer eyes , could see [her]572-his wife bent above [her]572-his wife work - frame , [her]572-his wife ruffled elbow - sleeves slipping back from [her]572-his wife firm round arms , the betrothal sapphire shining on [her]572-his wife left hand above [her]572-his wife broad gold wedding - ring , and the right hand slowly and laboriously stabbing the canvas . As [she]572-his wife sat thus , the lamplight full on [her]572-his wife clear brow , [he]430-archer said to [himself]430-archer with a secret dismay that [he]430-archer would always know the thoughts behind it , that never , in all the years to come , would [she]572-his wife surprise [him]430-archer by an unexpected mood , by a new idea , a weakness , a cruelty or an emotion . [She]572-his wife had spent [her]572-his wife poetry and romance on [their]2714-their short courting : the function was exhausted because the need was past . Now [she]572-his wife was simply ripening into a copy of [[her]572-his wife mother]605-her mother , and mysteriously , by the very process , trying to turn [him]430-archer into [a Mr. Welland]2716-a mr. welland . [He]430-archer laid down [his]430-archer book and stood up impatiently ; and at once [she]572-his wife raised [her]572-his wife head . " What 's the matter ? "[572-his wife] " [The room]991-the room is stifling : [I]430-archer want a little air . "[430-archer] [He]430-archer had insisted that the library curtains should draw backward and forward on a rod , so that they might be closed in the evening , instead of remaining nailed to a gilt cornice , and immovably looped up over layers of lace , as in [the drawing - room]983-the drawing - room ; and [he]430-archer pulled them back and pushed up the sash , leaning out into the icy night . The mere fact of not looking at [May]430-archer , seated beside [his]430-archer table , under [his]430-archer lamp , the fact of seeing [other houses]2718-other houses , [roofs]2719-roofs , [chimneys]2720-chimneys , of getting the sense of other lives outside [his]430-archer own , [other cities beyond [New York]2-new york]2721-other cities beyond new york , and [a whole world beyond [his]430-archer world]2722-a whole world beyond his world , cleared [his]430-archer brain and made it easier to breathe . After [he]430-archer had leaned out into the darkness for a few minutes [he]430-archer heard [her]572-his wife say : " [Newland]214-archer ! Do shut the window . [You]430-archer 'll catch [your]430-archer death . "[572-his wife] [He]430-archer pulled the sash down and turned back . " Catch [my]430-archer death ! "[430-archer] [he]430-archer echoed ; and [he]430-archer felt like adding : " But [I]430-archer 've caught it already . [I]430-archer AM dead -- [I've]430-archer been dead for months and months . "[430-archer] And suddenly the play of the word flashed up a wild suggestion . What if it were [SHE]572-his wife who was dead ! If [she]572-his wife were going to die -- to die soon -- and leave [him]430-archer free ! The sensation of standing there , in [that warm familiar room]2723-that warm familiar room , and looking at [her]572-his wife , and wishing [her]572-his wife dead , was so strange , so fascinating and overmastering , that its enormity did not immediately strike [him]430-archer . [He]430-archer simply felt that chance had given [him]430-archer a new possibility to which [his]430-archer sick soul might cling . Yes , [May]430-archer might die -- [people]637-people did : [young people]2070-young people , [[healthy people]2726-healthy people like [herself]430-archer]2727-healthy people like herself : [she]572-his wife might die , and set [him]430-archer suddenly free . [She]572-his wife glanced up , and [he]430-archer saw by [her]572-his wife widening eyes that there must be something strange in [his]430-archer own . " [Newland]214-archer ! Are [you]572-his wife ill ? "[572-his wife] [He]430-archer shook [his]430-archer head and turned toward [his]430-archer arm - chair . [She]572-his wife bent over [her]572-his wife work - frame , and as [he]430-archer passed [he]430-archer laid [his]430-archer hand on [her]572-his wife hair . " [Poor May]483-poor may ! "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said . " [Poor]4884-poor ? Why poor ? "[572-his wife] [she]572-his wife echoed with a strained laugh . " Because [I]430-archer shall never be able to open a window without worrying [you]572-his wife , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer rejoined , laughing also . For a moment [she]572-his wife was silent ; then [she]572-his wife said very low , [her]572-his wife head bowed over [her]572-his wife work : " [I]572-his wife shall never worry if [you]430-archer 're happy . "[572-his wife] " Ah , [[my]572-his wife dear]3140-my dear ; and [I]572-his wife shall never be happy unless [I]572-his wife can open the windows ! "[572-his wife] " In THIS weather ? "[572-his wife] [she]572-his wife remonstrated ; and with a sigh [he]430-archer buried [his]430-archer head in [his]430-archer book . Six or seven days passed . [Archer]430-archer heard nothing from [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska , and became aware that [her]240-madame olenska name would not be mentioned in [his]430-archer presence by [any member of [the family]551-the family]2728-any member of the family . [He]430-archer did not try to see [her]240-madame olenska ; to do so while [she]240-madame olenska was at [old Catherine]236-old catherine 's guarded bedside would have been almost impossible . In the uncertainty of the situation [he]430-archer let [himself]430-archer drift , conscious , somewhere below the surface of [his]430-archer thoughts , of a resolve which had come to [him]430-archer when [he]430-archer had leaned out from [his]430-archer library window into the icy night . The strength of that resolve made it easy to wait and make no sign . Then one day [May]430-archer told [him]430-archer that [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott had asked to see [him]430-archer . There was nothing surprising in the request , for [the old lady]3109-the old lady was steadily recovering , and [she]3109-the old lady had always openly declared that [she]3109-the old lady preferred [Archer]430-archer to [any of [[her]3109-the old lady other grandsons - in - law]2732-her other grandsons - in - law]2731-any of her other grandsons - in - law . [May]430-archer gave the message with evident pleasure : [she]3109-the old lady was proud of old [Catherine]409-old catherine 's appreciation of [[her]3109-the old lady husband]663-her husband . There was a moment 's pause , and then [Archer]430-archer felt it incumbent on [him]430-archer to say : " All right . Shall [we]4886-we go together this afternoon ? "[430-archer] [[His]430-archer wife]572-his wife 's face brightened , but [she]572-his wife instantly answered : " Oh , [you]430-archer 'd much better go alone . It bores [Granny]243-granny to see [the same people]1550-the same people too often . "[572-his wife] [Archer]430-archer 's heart was beating violently when [he]430-archer rang [old Mrs. Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's bell . [He]430-archer had wanted above all things to go alone , for [he]430-archer felt sure the visit would give [him]430-archer the chance of saying a word in private to [the Countess Olenska]234-the countess olenska . [He]430-archer had determined to wait till the chance presented itself naturally ; and here it was , and here [he]430-archer was on the doorstep . Behind the door , behind the curtains of [the yellow damask room next to [the hall]755-the hall]2735-the yellow damask room next to the hall , [she]572-his wife was surely awaiting [him]430-archer ; in another moment [he]430-archer should see [her]572-his wife , and be able to speak to [her]572-his wife before [she]572-his wife led [him]430-archer to [the sick - room]2737-the sick - room . [He]430-archer wanted only to put one question : after that [his]430-archer course would be clear . What [he]430-archer wished to ask was simply the date of [her]572-his wife return to [Washington]111-washington ; and that question [she]572-his wife could hardly refuse to answer . But in [the yellow sitting - room]2738-the yellow sitting - room it was [the mulatto maid]2512-the mulatto maid who waited . [Her]2512-the mulatto maid white teeth shining like a keyboard , [she]2512-the mulatto maid pushed back the sliding doors and ushered [him]430-archer into [old Catherine]409-old catherine 's presence . [The old woman]2520-the old woman sat in a vast throne - like arm - chair near [her]2520-the old woman bed . Beside [her]2520-the old woman was a mahogany stand bearing a cast bronze lamp with an engraved globe , over which a green paper shade had been balanced . There was not a book or a newspaper in reach , nor any evidence of feminine employment : conversation had always been [[Mrs. Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's sole pursuit]2741-mrs. mingott 's sole pursuit , and [she]2520-the old woman would have scorned to feign an interest in fancywork . [Archer]430-archer saw no trace of the slight distortion left by [her]2520-the old woman stroke . [She]2520-the old woman merely looked paler , with darker shadows in the folds and recesses of [her]2520-the old woman obesity ; and , in the fluted mob - cap tied by a starched bow between [her]2520-the old woman first two chins , and the muslin kerchief crossed over [her]2520-the old woman billowing purple dressing - gown , [she]2520-the old woman seemed like [some shrewd and kindly ancestress of [her]2520-the old woman own who might have yielded too freely to the pleasures of the table]2742-some shrewd and kindly ancestress of her own who might have yielded too freely to the pleasures of the table . [She]2520-the old woman held out one of the little hands that nestled in a hollow of [her]2520-the old woman huge lap like pet animals , and called to [the maid]3996-the maid : " Do n't let in [any one else]584-any one else . If [[my]3996-the maid daughters]4889-my daughters call , say [I]3996-the maid 'm asleep . "[3996-the maid] [The maid]3996-the maid disappeared , and [the old lady]3109-the old lady turned to [[her]3109-the old lady grandson]2746-her grandson . " [[My]3109-the old lady dear]3140-my dear , am [I]3109-the old lady perfectly hideous ? " [[My]3109-the old lady daughters]4889-my daughters tell [me]3109-the old lady it does n't matter at [my]3109-the old lady age -- as if hideousness did n't matter all the more the harder it gets to conceal ! "[3109-the old lady] " [[My]430-archer dear]3140-my dear , [you]3109-the old lady 're handsomer than ever ! "[3109-the old lady] [He]430-archer laughed , and [she]3109-the old lady continued : " Was it because [you]430-archer told [her]232-ellen so that [she]232-ellen had to put [you]430-archer out on the way ? "[3109-the old lady] [She]3109-the old lady gave another chuckle , and interrupted it to say almost querulously : " It 's a pity [she]232-ellen did n't marry [you]430-archer ; [I]3109-the old lady always told [her]232-ellen so . "[3109-the old lady] [Archer]430-archer wondered if [her]3109-the old lady illness had blurred [her]3109-the old lady faculties ; but suddenly [she]3109-the old lady broke out : " Well , it 's settled , anyhow : [she]232-ellen 's going to stay with [me]3109-the old lady , whatever [the rest of [the family]551-the family]4677-the rest of the family say ! "[2747-i] [The young man]527-the young man heard [her]2747-i with veins aglow ; but in [his]527-the young man confusion of mind [he]527-the young man hardly knew whether [her]2747-i news brought joy or pain . [He]527-the young man had so definitely decided on the course [he]527-the young man meant to pursue that for the moment [he]527-the young man could not readjust [his]527-the young man thoughts . But gradually there stole over [him]527-the young man the delicious sense of difficulties deferred and opportunities miraculously provided . If [Ellen]232-ellen had consented to come and live with [[her]232-ellen grandmother]853-her grandmother it must surely be because [she]853-her grandmother had recognised the impossibility of giving [him]527-the young man up . This was [her]853-her grandmother answer to [his]527-the young man final appeal of the other day : if [she]853-her grandmother would not take the extreme step [he]527-the young man had urged , [she]853-her grandmother had at last yielded to half - measures . [He]527-the young man sank back into the thought with the involuntary relief of [a man who has been ready to risk everything]2750-a man who has been ready to risk everything , and suddenly tastes the dangerous sweetness of security . " [She]853-her grandmother could n't have gone back -- it was impossible ! "[527-the young man] [he]527-the young man exclaimed .
