' Well , that floored [me]430-archer , and [I]430-archer let [her]3109-the old lady go ; and finally one day [she]3109-the old lady said it was raining too hard to go out on foot , and [she]3109-the old lady wanted [me]430-archer to lend [her]3109-the old lady [[my]430-archer carriage]4921-my carriage . ' What for ? ' [I]430-archer asked [her]3109-the old lady ; and [she]3109-the old lady said : ' To go and see [cousin Regina'--COUSIN]484-cousin regina'--cousin ! Now , [[my]430-archer dear]3140-my dear , [I]430-archer looked out of the window , and saw it was n't raining a drop ; but [I]430-archer understood [her]3109-the old lady , and [I]430-archer let [her]3109-the old lady have [the carriage]878-the carriage .... After all , [Regina]475-beaufort 's [a brave woman]4932-a brave woman , and so is [she]475-beaufort ; and [I]430-archer 've always liked courage above everything . "[430-archer] [Archer]430-archer bent down and pressed [his]430-archer lips on the little hand that still lay on [his]430-archer . " Eh -- eh -- eh ! Whose hand did [you]3109-the old lady think [you]3109-the old lady were kissing , [young man]1796-young man -- [[your]3109-the old lady wife]4740-your wife 's , [I]3109-the old lady hope ? "[3109-the old lady] [the old lady]3109-the old lady snapped out with [her]3109-the old lady mocking cackle ; and as [he]430-archer rose to go [she]3109-the old lady called out after [him]430-archer : " Give [her]4740-your wife [her]4740-your wife [Granny]243-granny 's love ; but [you]430-archer 'd better not say anything about [our]4935-our talk . "[3109-the old lady] XXXI . [Archer]430-archer had been stunned by [old Catherine]409-old catherine 's news . It was only natural that [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska should have hastened from [Washington]111-washington in response to [[her]240-madame olenska grandmother]853-her grandmother 's summons ; but that [she]240-madame olenska should have decided to remain under [her]240-madame olenska roof -- especially now that [Mrs. Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott had almost regained [her]216-mrs. manson mingott health -- was less easy to explain . [Archer]430-archer was sure that [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's decision had not been influenced by the change in [her]240-madame olenska financial situation . [He]430-archer knew the exact figure of the small income which [[her]240-madame olenska husband]663-her husband had allowed [her]240-madame olenska at [their]2758-their separation . Without the addition of [[her]240-madame olenska grandmother]853-her grandmother 's allowance it was hardly enough to live on , in any sense known to [the Mingott vocabulary]2760-the mingott vocabulary ; and now that [Medora Manson]229-medora manson , who shared [her]229-medora manson life , had been ruined , such a pittance would barely keep [the two women]913-the two women clothed and fed . Yet [Archer]430-archer was convinced that [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska had not accepted [[her]240-madame olenska grandmother]853-her grandmother 's offer from interested motives . [She]240-madame olenska had the heedless generosity and the spasmodic extravagance of persons used to large fortunes , and indifferent to money ; but [she]240-madame olenska could go without many things which [her]240-madame olenska relations considered indispensable , and [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]217-mrs. lovell mingott and [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland had often been heard to deplore that [any one who had enjoyed the cosmopolitan luxuries of [[Count Olenski]278-count olenski 's establishments]2764-count olenski 's establishments]2763-any one who had enjoyed the cosmopolitan luxuries of count olenski 's establishments should care so little about " how things were done . "[218-mrs. welland] Moreover , as [Archer]430-archer knew , several months had passed since [her]240-madame olenska allowance had been cut off ; yet in the interval [she]240-madame olenska had made no effort to regain [[her]240-madame olenska grandmother]853-her grandmother 's favour . Therefore if [she]240-madame olenska had changed [her]240-madame olenska course it must be for a different reason . [He]430-archer did not have far to seek for that reason . On the way from [the ferry]2604-the ferry [she]240-madame olenska had told [him]430-archer that [he]430-archer and [she]240-madame olenska must remain apart ; but [she]240-madame olenska had said it with [her]240-madame olenska head on [his]430-archer breast . [He]430-archer knew that there was no calculated coquetry in [her]240-madame olenska words ; [she]240-madame olenska was fighting [her]240-madame olenska fate as [he]430-archer had fought [his]430-archer , and clinging desperately to [her]240-madame olenska resolve that [they]2767-they should not break faith with [the people who trusted [them]2767-they]2768-the people who trusted them . But during the ten days which had elapsed since [her]240-madame olenska return to [New York]2-new york [she]240-madame olenska had perhaps guessed from [his]430-archer silence , and from the fact of [his]430-archer making no attempt to see [her]240-madame olenska , that [he]430-archer was meditating a decisive step , a step from which there was no turning back . At the thought , a sudden fear of [her]240-madame olenska own weakness might have seized [her]240-madame olenska , and [she]240-madame olenska might have felt that , after all , it was better to accept the compromise usual in such cases , and follow the line of least resistance . An hour earlier , when [he]430-archer had rung [Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. lovell mingott 's bell , [Archer]430-archer had fancied that [his]430-archer path was clear before [him]430-archer . [He]430-archer had meant to have a word alone with [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska , and failing that , to learn from [[her]240-madame olenska grandmother]853-her grandmother on what day , and by [which train]2770-which train , [she]240-madame olenska was returning to [Washington]111-washington . In [that train]2771-that train [he]430-archer intended to join [her]240-madame olenska , and travel with [her]240-madame olenska to [Washington]111-washington , or as much farther as [she]240-madame olenska was willing to go . [His]430-archer own fancy inclined to [Japan]485-japan . At any rate [she]240-madame olenska would understand at once that , wherever [she]240-madame olenska went , [he]430-archer was going . [He]430-archer meant to leave a note for [May]430-archer that should cut off any other alternative . [He]430-archer had fancied [himself]430-archer not only nerved for this plunge but eager to take it ; yet [his]430-archer first feeling on hearing that the course of events was changed had been one of relief . Now , however , as [he]430-archer walked [home]649-home from [[Mrs. Mingott]217-mrs. lovell mingott 's]2773-mrs. mingott 's , [he]430-archer was conscious of a growing distaste for what lay before [him]430-archer . There was nothing unknown or unfamiliar in the path [he]430-archer was presumably to tread ; but when [he]430-archer had trodden it before it was as [a free man]1328-a free man , who was accountable to [no one]619-no one for [his]430-archer actions , and could lend [himself]430-archer with an amused detachment to the game of precautions and prevarications , concealments and compliances , that the part required . This procedure was called " protecting [a woman]4639-a woman 's honour "[1328-a free man] ; and the best fiction , combined with the after - dinner talk of [[his]430-archer elders]2776-his elders , had long since initiated [him]430-archer into every detail of its code . Now [he]430-archer saw the matter in a new light , and [his]430-archer part in it seemed singularly diminished . It was , in fact , that which , with a secret fatuity , [he]430-archer had watched [Mrs. Thorley Rushworth]242-mrs. thorley rushworth play toward [a fond and unperceiving husband]2777-a fond and unperceiving husband : a smiling , bantering , humouring , watchful and incessant lie . A lie by day , a lie by night , a lie in every touch and every look ; a lie in every caress and every quarrel ; a lie in every word and in every silence . It was easier , and less dastardly on the whole , for [a wife]1015-a wife to play such a part toward [[her]1015-a wife husband]663-her husband . [A woman]4639-a woman 's standard of truthfulness was tacitly held to be lower : [she]4639-a woman was [the subject creature]2781-the subject creature , and versed in the arts of [the enslaved]2782-the enslaved . Then [she]4639-a woman could always plead moods and nerves , and the right not to be held too strictly to account ; and even in the most strait - laced societies the laugh was always against [the husband]2783-the husband . But in [[Archer]430-archer 's little world]2784-archer 's little world [no one]619-no one laughed at [a wife]1015-a wife deceived , and a certain measure of contempt was attached to [men who continued [their]2787-men who continued their philandering after marriage philandering after marriage]2787-men who continued their philandering after marriage . In the rotation of crops there was a recognised season for wild oats ; but [they]2788-they were not to be sown more than once . [Archer]430-archer had always shared this view : in [his]430-archer heart [he]430-archer thought [Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts despicable . But to love [Ellen Olenska]232-ellen was not to become [a man like [Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts]2789-a man like lefferts : for the first time [Archer]430-archer found [himself]430-archer face to face with the dread argument of the individual case . [Ellen Olenska]232-ellen was like [no other woman]1887-no other woman , [he]430-archer was like [no other man]2791-no other man : [their]2792-their situation , therefore , resembled [no one else]2793-no one else 's , and [they]2792-their were answerable to no tribunal but that of [their]2792-their own judgment . Yes , but in ten minutes more [he]430-archer would be mounting [[his]430-archer own doorstep]2794-his own doorstep ; and there were May , and habit , and honour , and all the old decencies that [he]430-archer and [[his]430-archer people]2795-his people had always believed in ... At [his]430-archer corner [he]430-archer hesitated , and then walked on down [Fifth Avenue]15-fifth avenue . Ahead of [him]430-archer , in the winter night , loomed [a big unlit house]2796-a big unlit house . As [he]430-archer drew near [he]430-archer thought how often [he]430-archer had seen [it]2796-a big unlit house blazing with lights , [its]2796-a big unlit house steps awninged and carpeted , and carriages waiting in double line to draw up at [the curbstone]2691-the curbstone . [It]2798-it was in [the conservatory that stretched [its]2796-a big unlit house dead - black bulk down [the side street]2800-the side street that [he]430-archer had taken [his]430-archer first kiss from [May]430-archer]2799-the conservatory that stretched its dead - black bulk down the side street that he had taken his first kiss from may ; it was under the myriad candles of the ball - room that [he]430-archer had seen [her]2801-her appear , tall and silver - shining as [a young Diana]2802-a young diana . Now [the house]532-the house was as dark as [the grave]2804-the grave , except for a faint flare of gas in [the basement]3767-the basement , and a light in one [upstairs room where the blind had not been lowered]2806-upstairs room where the blind had not been lowered . As [Archer]430-archer reached the corner [he]430-archer saw that [the carriage]878-the carriage standing at the door was [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's . What an opportunity for [Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson , if [he]224-mr. jackson should chance to pass ! [Archer]430-archer had been greatly moved by old [Catherine]409-old catherine 's account of [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's attitude toward [Mrs. Beaufort]230-beaufort ; it made the righteous reprobation of [New York]2-new york seem like a passing by on the other side . But [he]430-archer knew well enough what construction [the clubs and drawing - rooms]2808-the clubs and drawing - rooms would put on [Ellen Olenska]232-ellen 's visits to [[her]232-ellen cousin]690-her cousin . [He]430-archer paused and looked up at the lighted window . No doubt [the two women]913-the two women were sitting together in [that room]2811-that room : [Beaufort]230-beaufort had probably sought consolation elsewhere . There were even rumours that [he]430-archer had left [New York]2-new york with [Fanny Ring]349-miss fanny ring ; but [Mrs. Beaufort]230-beaufort 's attitude made the report seem improbable . [Archer]430-archer had the nocturnal perspective of [Fifth Avenue]15-fifth avenue almost to [himself]430-archer . At that hour [most people]1086-most people were indoors , dressing for dinner ; and [he]430-archer was secretly glad that [Ellen]232-ellen 's exit was likely to be unobserved . As the thought passed through [his]430-archer mind the door opened , and [she]232-ellen came out . Behind [her]232-ellen was a faint light , such as might have been carried down the stairs to show [her]232-ellen the way . [She]232-ellen turned to say a word to [some one]687-some one ; then the door closed , and [she]232-ellen came down the steps . " [Ellen]232-ellen , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said in a low voice , as [she]232-ellen reached [the pavement]2692-the pavement . [She]232-ellen stopped with a slight start , and just then [he]430-archer saw [two young men of fashionable cut]2815-two young men of fashionable cut approaching . There was a familiar air about [their]2815-two young men of fashionable cut overcoats and the way [their]2815-two young men of fashionable cut smart silk mufflers were folded over [their]2815-two young men of fashionable cut white ties ; and [he]430-archer wondered how youths of [their]2815-two young men of fashionable cut quality happened to be dining out so early . Then [he]430-archer remembered that [the Reggie Chiverses]286-the reggie chiverses , whose [house was a few doors above]2816-house was a few doors above , were taking a large party that evening to see [Adelaide Neilson]486-adelaide neilson in Romeo and Juliet , and guessed that [the two]797-the two were of the number . [They]2815-two young men of fashionable cut passed under a lamp , and [he]430-archer recognised [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts and [a young Chivers]2818-a young chivers . " [I]430-archer shall see [you]232-ellen now -- [we]2815-two young men of fashionable cut shall be together , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer broke out , hardly knowing what [he]430-archer said . " Ah , "[232-ellen] [she]232-ellen answered , " [Granny]243-granny has told [you]430-archer ? "[232-ellen] While [he]430-archer watched [her]232-ellen [he]430-archer was aware that [Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts and [Chivers]396-reggie chivers , on reaching the farther side of [the street corner]2820-the street corner , had discreetly struck away across [Fifth Avenue]15-fifth avenue . It was the kind of masculine solidarity that [he]430-archer [himself]430-archer often practised ; now [he]430-archer sickened at [their]2821-we connivance . Did [she]232-ellen really imagine that [he]430-archer and [she]232-ellen could live like this ? And if not , what else did [she]232-ellen imagine ? " Tomorrow [I]430-archer must see [you]232-ellen -- somewhere where [we]2821-we can be alone , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said , in a voice that sounded almost angry to [his]430-archer own ears . " [She]2825-a woman he was indebted to for pleasures already wearied of 'll come ! "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said to [himself]430-archer , almost contemptuously . Avoiding the popular " Wolfe collection , "[430-archer] whose anecdotic canvases filled one of [the main galleries of the queer wilderness of cast - iron and encaustic tiles known as [the Metropolitan Museum]179-the metropolitan museum]2827-the main galleries of the queer wilderness of cast - iron and encaustic tiles known as the metropolitan museum , [they]2828-they had wandered down [a passage]2829-a passage to [the room where the " Cesnola antiquities "[430-archer] mouldered in unvisited loneliness]2830-the room where the " cesnola antiquities " mouldered in unvisited loneliness . [They]2828-they had this melancholy retreat to [themselves]2828-they , and seated on the divan enclosing the central steam - radiator , [they]2828-they were staring silently at the glass cabinets mounted in ebonised wood which contained the recovered fragments of Ilium . " It 's odd , "[240-madame olenska] [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska said , " [I]240-madame olenska never came [here]3155-here before . "[240-madame olenska] " Ah , well-- . [His]430-archer mind , as always when [they]2828-they first met , was wholly absorbed in the delicious details that made [her]240-madame olenska [herself]240-madame olenska and no other . Presently [he]430-archer rose and approached the case before which [she]240-madame olenska stood . [Its]2832-its glass shelves were crowded with small broken objects -- hardly recognisable domestic utensils , ornaments and personal trifles -- made of glass , of clay , of discoloured bronze and other time - blurred substances . " It seems cruel , "[240-madame olenska] [she]240-madame olenska said , " that after a while nothing matters ... any more than these little things , that used to be necessary and important to [forgotten people]4942-forgotten people , and now have to be guessed at under a magnifying glass and labelled : ' Use unknown . ' "[240-madame olenska] " Yes ; but meanwhile-- "[240-madame olenska] " Ah , meanwhile-- "[240-madame olenska] As [she]240-madame olenska stood there , in [her]240-madame olenska long sealskin coat , [her]240-madame olenska hands thrust in a small round muff , [her]240-madame olenska veil drawn down like a transparent mask to the tip of [her]240-madame olenska nose , and the bunch of violets [he]430-archer had brought [her]240-madame olenska stirring with [her]240-madame olenska quickly - taken breath , it seemed incredible that this pure harmony of line and colour should ever suffer the stupid law of change . " Meanwhile everything matters -- that concerns [you]240-madame olenska , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said . "[240-madame olenska] " And [you]527-the young man expect [me]240-madame olenska to say yes to that ? "[240-madame olenska] [She]240-madame olenska raised [her]240-madame olenska troubled eyes to [his]527-the young man . " What else is there ? [I]240-madame olenska ca n't stay here and lie to [the people who 've been good to [me]240-madame olenska]4957-the people who 've been good to me . "[240-madame olenska] " But that 's the very reason why [I]240-madame olenska ask [you]527-the young man to come away ! "[240-madame olenska] " And destroy [their]4957-the people who 've been good to me lives , when [they]4957-the people who 've been good to me 've helped [me]240-madame olenska to remake [mine]240-madame olenska ? "[240-madame olenska] [Archer]430-archer sprang to [his]430-archer feet and stood looking down on [her]240-madame olenska in inarticulate despair . It would have been easy to say : " Yes , come ; come once . "[430-archer] [He]430-archer knew the power [she]240-madame olenska would put in [his]430-archer hands if [she]240-madame olenska consented ; there would be no difficulty then in persuading [her]240-madame olenska not to go back to [[her]240-madame olenska husband]663-her husband . But something silenced the word on [his]430-archer lips . A sort of passionate honesty in [her]240-madame olenska made it inconceivable that [he]430-archer should try to draw [her]240-madame olenska into that familiar trap . " If [I]430-archer were to let [her]240-madame olenska come , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said to [himself]430-archer , " [I]430-archer should have to let [her]240-madame olenska go again . "[430-archer] And that was not to be imagined . But [he]430-archer saw the shadow of the lashes on [her]240-madame olenska wet cheek , and wavered . " After all , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer began again , " [we]4958-our have lives of [our]4958-our own .... There 's no use attempting the impossible . [You]240-madame olenska 're so unprejudiced about some things , so used , as [you]240-madame olenska say , to looking at [the Gorgon]481-the gorgon , that [I]430-archer do n't know why [you]240-madame olenska 're afraid to face [our]4958-our case , and see it as it really is -- unless [you]240-madame olenska think the sacrifice is not worth making . "[430-archer] [She]240-madame olenska stood up also , [her]240-madame olenska lips tightening under a rapid frown . " Call it that , then -- [I]240-madame olenska must go , "[240-madame olenska] [she]240-madame olenska said , drawing [her]240-madame olenska little watch from [her]240-madame olenska bosom . [She]240-madame olenska turned away , and [he]430-archer followed and caught [her]240-madame olenska by the wrist . " Well , then : come to [me]430-archer once , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said , [his]430-archer head turning suddenly at the thought of losing [her]240-madame olenska ; and for a second or two [they]2841-they looked at [each other]695-each other almost like [enemies]2843-enemies . " When ? "[430-archer] [he]430-archer insisted . " Tomorrow ? "[240-madame olenska] [She]240-madame olenska hesitated . " The day after . "[240-madame olenska] " [Dearest--]487-dearest-- ! "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said again . [She]240-madame olenska had disengaged [her]240-madame olenska wrist ; but for a moment [they]2841-they continued to hold [each other]695-each other 's eyes , and [he]430-archer saw that [her]240-madame olenska face , which had grown very pale , was flooded with a deep inner radiance . [His]430-archer heart beat with awe : [he]430-archer felt that [he]430-archer had never before beheld love visible . " Oh , [I]240-madame olenska shall be late -- good - bye . No , do n't come any farther than this , "[240-madame olenska] [she]240-madame olenska cried , walking hurriedly away down [the long room]2845-the long room , as if the reflected radiance in [his]430-archer eyes had frightened [her]240-madame olenska . When [she]240-madame olenska reached the door [she]240-madame olenska turned for a moment to wave a quick farewell . [Archer]430-archer walked [home]649-home alone . Darkness was falling when [he]430-archer let [himself]430-archer into [[his]430-archer house]1312-his house , and [he]430-archer looked about at the familiar objects in [the hall]755-the hall as if [he]430-archer viewed them from the other side of [the grave]2804-the grave . [The parlour - maid]2850-the parlour - maid , hearing [his]430-archer step , ran up the stairs to light the gas on the upper landing . " Is [Mrs. Archer]214-archer in ? "[2850-the parlour - maid] " No , [sir]3197-sir ; [Mrs. Archer]214-archer went out in [the carriage]878-the carriage after luncheon , and has n't come back . "[2850-the parlour - maid] With a sense of relief [he]430-archer entered [the library]769-the library and flung [himself]430-archer down in [his]430-archer armchair . [The parlour - maid]2850-the parlour - maid followed , bringing the student lamp and shaking some coals onto the dying fire . When [she]2850-the parlour - maid left [he]430-archer continued to sit motionless , [his]430-archer elbows on [his]430-archer knees , [his]430-archer chin on [his]430-archer clasped hands , [his]430-archer eyes fixed on the red grate . [He]430-archer sat there without conscious thoughts , without sense of the lapse of time , in a deep and grave amazement that seemed to suspend life rather than quicken it . " This was what had to be , then ... this was what had to be , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer kept repeating to [himself]430-archer , as if [he]430-archer hung in the clutch of doom . What [he]430-archer had dreamed of had been so different that there was a mortal chill in [his]430-archer rapture . The door opened and [May]430-archer came in . " [I]2850-the parlour - maid 'm dreadfully late -- [you]430-archer were n't worried , were [you]430-archer ? "[2850-the parlour - maid] [she]2850-the parlour - maid asked , laying [her]2850-the parlour - maid hand on [his]430-archer shoulder with one of [her]2850-the parlour - maid rare caresses . [He]430-archer looked up astonished . " Is it late ? "[430-archer] " After seven . [I]2850-the parlour - maid believe [you]430-archer 've been asleep ! "[2850-the parlour - maid] [She]2850-the parlour - maid laughed , and drawing out [her]2850-the parlour - maid hat pins tossed [her]2850-the parlour - maid velvet hat on the sofa . [She]2850-the parlour - maid looked paler than usual , but sparkling with an unwonted animation . " [I]2850-the parlour - maid went to see [Granny]243-granny , and just as [I]2850-the parlour - maid was going away [Ellen]232-ellen came in from a walk ; so [I]2850-the parlour - maid stayed and had a long talk with [her]232-ellen . It was ages since [we]4961-we 'd had a real talk .... "[2850-the parlour - maid] [She]2850-the parlour - maid had dropped into [her]2850-the parlour - maid usual armchair , facing [his]430-archer , and was running [her]2850-the parlour - maid fingers through [her]2850-the parlour - maid rumpled hair . [He]430-archer fancied [she]2850-the parlour - maid expected [him]430-archer to speak . " A really good talk , "[2850-the parlour - maid] [she]2850-the parlour - maid went on , smiling with what seemed to [Archer]430-archer an unnatural vividness . " [She]232-ellen was so dear -- just like [the old Ellen]232-ellen . [I]2850-the parlour - maid 'm afraid [I]2850-the parlour - maid have n't been fair to [her]232-ellen lately . [I]2850-the parlour - maid 've sometimes thought-- "[2850-the parlour - maid] [Archer]430-archer stood up and leaned against the mantelpiece , out of the radius of the lamp . " Yes , [you]2850-the parlour - maid 've thought-- ? "[430-archer] [he]430-archer echoed as [she]2850-the parlour - maid paused . " Well , perhaps [I]430-archer have n't judged [her]232-ellen fairly . [She]232-ellen 's so different -- at least on the surface . [She]232-ellen takes up [such odd people]4962-such odd people -- [she]232-ellen seems to like to make [herself]232-ellen conspicuous . [I]430-archer suppose it 's the life [she]232-ellen 's led in that fast European society ; no doubt [we]4963-we seem dreadfully dull to [her]232-ellen . But [I]430-archer do n't want to judge [her]232-ellen unfairly . "[430-archer] [She]2850-the parlour - maid paused again , a little breathless with the unwonted length of [her]2850-the parlour - maid speech , and sat with [her]2850-the parlour - maid lips slightly parted and a deep blush on [her]2850-the parlour - maid cheeks . [Archer]430-archer , as [he]430-archer looked at [her]2850-the parlour - maid , was reminded of the glow which had suffused [her]2850-the parlour - maid face in [the Mission Garden]2853-the mission garden at [St. Augustine]91-st. augustine . [He]430-archer became aware of the same obscure effort in [her]2850-the parlour - maid , the same reaching out toward something beyond the usual range of [her]2850-the parlour - maid vision . " [She]232-ellen hates [Ellen]232-ellen , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer thought , " and [she]232-ellen 's trying to overcome the feeling , and to get [me]430-archer to help [her]232-ellen to overcome it . "[430-archer] The thought moved [him]430-archer , and for a moment [he]430-archer was on the point of breaking the silence between [them]2854-them , and throwing [himself]430-archer on [her]2850-the parlour - maid mercy . " [You]430-archer understand , do n't [you]430-archer , "[2850-the parlour - maid] [she]2850-the parlour - maid went on , " why [the family]551-the family have sometimes been annoyed ? "[2850-the parlour - maid] " Ah , "[430-archer] said [Archer]430-archer with an impatient laugh . The open door had closed between [them]2854-them again . XXXII . " At [the court of [the Tuileries]26-the tuileries]4967-the court of the tuileries , "[224-mr. jackson] said [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson with [his]224-mr. jackson reminiscent smile , " such things were pretty openly tolerated . "[224-mr. jackson] The scene was [the van der [Luydens]275-the van der luydens ' black walnut dining - room in [Madison Avenue]60-madison avenue]2855-the van der luydens ' black walnut dining - room in madison avenue , and the time the evening after [Newland Archer]214-archer 's visit to [the Museum of Art]2856-the museum of art . [Mr.]2857-mr. and [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden had come to [town]1128-town for a few days from [Skuytercliff]57-skuytercliff , whither [they]2859-they had precipitately fled at the announcement of [Beaufort]230-beaufort 's failure . It had been represented to [them]2859-they that the disarray into which society had been thrown by this deplorable affair made [their]2859-they presence in [town]1128-town more necessary than ever . It was one of the occasions when , as [Mrs. Archer]214-archer put it , [they]2859-they " owed it to [society]1441-society "[214-archer] to show [themselves]2859-they at [the Opera]517-the opera , and even to open [their]2859-they own doors . " It will never do , [[my]2862-mr. dear]3140-my dear [Louisa]298-louisa , to let [people like [Mrs. Lemuel Struthers]259-mrs. struthers]4970-people like mrs. lemuel struthers think [they]4970-people like mrs. lemuel struthers can step into [Regina]475-beaufort 's shoes . It is just at such times that [new people]4971-new people push in and get a footing . It was owing to the epidemic of chicken - pox in [New York]2-new york the winter [Mrs. Struthers]259-mrs. struthers first appeared that [the married men]4972-the married men slipped away to [[her]259-mrs. struthers house]819-her house while [[their]4972-the married men wives]4262-their wives were in [the nursery]4975-the nursery . [You]4976-you and [dear Henry]4977-dear henry , [Louisa]298-louisa , must stand in the breach as [you]4976-you always have . "[2862-mr.] [Mr.]2862-mr. and [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden could not remain deaf to such a call , and reluctantly but heroically [they]2863-they had come to [town]1128-town , unmuffled [the house]532-the house , and sent out invitations for two dinners and an evening reception . On this particular evening [they]2863-they had invited [Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson , [Mrs. Archer]214-archer and [Newland]214-archer and [[his]2862-mr. wife]572-his wife to go with [them]2863-they to [the Opera]517-the opera , where [Faust]215-faust was being sung for the first time that winter . Nothing was done without ceremony under [the van der Luyden roof]2868-the van der luyden roof , and though there were but [four guests the repast]2869-four guests the repast had begun at seven punctually , so that the proper sequence of courses might be served without haste before [the gentlemen]984-the gentlemen settled down to [their]984-the gentlemen cigars . [Archer]214-archer had not seen [[his]2862-mr. wife]572-his wife since the evening before . [He]2862-mr. had left early for [the office]3721-the office , where [he]2862-mr. had plunged into an accumulation of unimportant business . In the afternoon [one of [the senior partners]2874-the senior partners]2873-one of the senior partners had made an unexpected call on [his]2873-one of the senior partners time ; and [he]2873-one of the senior partners had reached [home]649-home so late that [May]430-archer had preceded [him]2873-one of the senior partners to [the van der Luydens ']3295-the van der luydens ' , and sent back [the carriage]878-the carriage . Now , across the Skuytercliff carnations and the massive plate , [she]572-his wife struck [him]2873-one of the senior partners as pale and languid ; but [her]572-his wife eyes shone , and [she]572-his wife talked with exaggerated animation . The subject which had called forth [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson 's favourite allusion had been brought up ( [Archer]430-archer fancied not without intention ) by [[their]2878-their hostess]4296-their hostess . The Beaufort failure , or rather the [Beaufort]475-beaufort attitude since the failure , was still a fruitful theme for [the drawing - room moralist]2880-the drawing - room moralist ; and after it had been thoroughly examined and condemned [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden had turned [her]297-mrs. van der luyden scrupulous eyes on [May Archer]430-archer . " Is it possible , [dear]3127-dear , that what [I]297-mrs. van der luyden hear is true ? "[297-mrs. van der luyden] It was noticeable that [she]297-mrs. van der luyden no longer called [the offending lady]2881-the offending lady by [her]297-mrs. van der luyden Christian name . " Of course [I]214-archer 've always said that [she]240-madame olenska looks at things quite differently , "[214-archer] [Mrs. Archer]214-archer summed up . "[214-archer] [Mrs. Archer]214-archer rejoined . At this point [Mr. van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden glanced at [[his]304-mr. van der luyden wife]572-his wife , who bent [her]572-his wife head slightly in the direction of [Mrs. Archer]214-archer ; and the glimmering trains of [the three ladies]2889-the three ladies swept out of the door while [the gentlemen]984-the gentlemen settled down to [their]984-the gentlemen cigars . [Mr. van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden supplied [short ones]2891-short ones on Opera nights ; but they were so good that they made [[his]304-mr. van der luyden guests]2892-his guests deplore [his]304-mr. van der luyden inexorable punctuality . [Archer]214-archer , after the first act , had detached [himself]214-archer from the party and made [his]304-mr. van der luyden way to the back of [the club box]546-the club box . From there [he]304-mr. van der luyden watched , over [various Chivers]396-reggie chivers , [Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott and [Rushworth]242-mrs. thorley rushworth shoulders , the same scene that [he]304-mr. van der luyden had looked at , two years previously , on the night of [his]304-mr. van der luyden first meeting with [Ellen Olenska]232-ellen . [He]304-mr. van der luyden had half - expected [her]2894-her to appear again in [old [Mrs. Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott 's box]589-old mrs. mingott 's box , but [it]589-old mrs. mingott 's box remained empty ; and [he]304-mr. van der luyden sat motionless , [his]304-mr. van der luyden eyes fastened on it , till suddenly [Madame Nilsson]212-madame nilsson 's pure soprano broke out into " M'ama , non m'ama ... "[212-madame nilsson] [Archer]214-archer turned to the stage , where , in the familiar setting of giant roses and pen - wiper pansies , [the same large blonde victim]2896-the same large blonde victim was succumbing to [the same small brown seducer]2897-the same small brown seducer . From [the stage]547-the stage [his]304-mr. van der luyden eyes wandered to the point of the horseshoe where [May]430-archer sat between [two older ladies]2899-two older ladies , just as , on that former evening , [she]2894-her had sat between [Mrs. Lovell Mingott]217-mrs. lovell mingott and [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott newly - arrived " foreign "[2894-her] cousin]2900-her newly - arrived " foreign " cousin . As on that evening , [she]2894-her was all in white ; and [Archer]430-archer , who had not noticed what [she]2894-her wore , recognised the blue - white satin and old lace of [her]2894-her wedding dress . It was the custom , in old [New York]2-new york , for [brides]2901-brides to appear in this costly garment during the first year or two of marriage : [[his]304-mr. van der luyden mother]528-his mother , [he]304-mr. van der luyden knew , kept [hers]528-his mother in tissue paper in the hope that [Janey]263-janey might some day wear it , though poor [Janey]263-janey was reaching the age when [pearl grey poplin]490-pearl grey poplin and [no bridesmaids]2903-no bridesmaids would be thought more " appropriate . "[263-janey] It struck [Archer]263-janey that [May]430-archer , since [their]2904-their return from [Europe]14-europe , had seldom worn [her]2894-her bridal satin , and the surprise of seeing [her]2894-her in it made [him]263-janey compare [her]2894-her appearance with that of [the young girl [he]263-janey had watched with such blissful anticipations two years earlier]2905-the young girl he had watched with such blissful anticipations two years earlier . Though [May]430-archer 's outline was slightly heavier , as [her]2894-her goddesslike build had foretold , [her]2894-her athletic erectness of carriage , and the girlish transparency of [her]2894-her expression , remained unchanged : but for the slight languor that [Archer]430-archer had lately noticed in [her]2894-her [she]2894-her would have been the exact image of [the girl]557-the girl playing with the bouquet of lilies - of - [the - valley]558-the - valley on [her]2894-her betrothal evening . The fact seemed an additional appeal to [his]430-archer pity : such innocence was as moving as the trustful clasp of [a child]1393-a child . Then [he]430-archer remembered the passionate generosity latent under that incurious calm . [He]430-archer recalled [her]2894-her glance of understanding when [he]430-archer had urged that [their]2909-their engagement should be announced at the Beaufort ball ; [he]430-archer heard the voice in which [she]2894-her had said , in [the Mission garden]2853-the mission garden : " [I]2894-her could n't have [my]2894-her happiness made out of a wrong -- a wrong to [some one else]4988-some one else ; "[2894-her] and an uncontrollable longing seized [him]430-archer to tell [her]2894-her the truth , to throw [himself]430-archer on [her]2894-her generosity , and ask for the freedom [he]430-archer had once refused . [Newland Archer]214-archer was [a quiet and self - controlled young man]2911-a quiet and self - controlled young man . Conformity to the discipline of a small society had become almost [his]430-archer second nature . It was deeply distasteful to [him]430-archer to do anything melodramatic and conspicuous , anything [Mr. van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden would have deprecated and the club box condemned as bad form . But [he]430-archer had become suddenly unconscious of the club box , of [Mr. van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden , of all that had so long enclosed [him]430-archer in the warm shelter of habit . [He]430-archer walked along [the semi - circular passage at the back of [the house]532-the house]2912-the semi - circular passage at the back of the house , and opened the door of [[Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden 's box]2914-mrs. van der luyden 's box as if it had been a gate into the unknown . " M'ama ! "[430-archer] thrilled out [the triumphant Marguerite]430-archer ; and [the occupants of the box]2915-the occupants of the box looked up in surprise at [Archer]430-archer 's entrance . [He]430-archer had already broken one of the rules of [[his]430-archer world]3556-his world , which forbade the entering of a box during a solo . Slipping between [Mr. van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden and [Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson , [he]430-archer leaned over [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife . " [I]430-archer 've got a beastly headache ; do n't tell [any one]1150-any one , but come [home]649-home , wo n't [you]430-archer ? "[430-archer] [he]430-archer whispered . [May]430-archer gave [him]430-archer a glance of comprehension , and [he]430-archer saw [her]572-his wife whisper to [[his]430-archer mother]528-his mother , who nodded sympathetically ; then [she]572-his wife murmured an excuse to [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden , and rose from [her]572-his wife seat just as [Marguerite]430-archer fell into [Faust]215-faust 's arms . [Archer]430-archer , while [he]430-archer helped [her]572-his wife on with [her]572-his wife Opera cloak , noticed the exchange of a significant smile between [the older ladies]2919-the older ladies . As [they]2920-they drove away [May]430-archer laid [her]572-his wife hand shyly on [his]430-archer . " [I]430-archer 'm so sorry [you]430-archer do n't feel well . [I]430-archer 'm afraid [they]2920-they 've been overworking [you]430-archer again at [the office]3721-the office . "[430-archer] " No -- it 's not that : do [you]430-archer mind if [I]430-archer open the window ? "[430-archer] [he]430-archer returned confusedly , letting down the pane on [his]430-archer side . [He]430-archer sat staring out into [the street]2225-the street , feeling [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife beside [him]430-archer as a silent watchful interrogation , and keeping [his]430-archer eyes steadily fixed on [the passing houses]2923-the passing houses . At [their]2924-their door [she]572-his wife caught [her]572-his wife skirt in the step of [the carriage]878-the carriage , and fell against [him]430-archer . " Did [you]572-his wife hurt [yourself]572-his wife ? "[430-archer] [he]430-archer asked , steadying [her]572-his wife with [his]430-archer arm . " No ; but [my]572-his wife poor dress -- see how [I]572-his wife 've torn it ! "[572-his wife] [she]572-his wife exclaimed . [She]572-his wife bent to gather up a mud - stained breadth , and followed [him]430-archer up [the steps]2926-the steps into [the hall]755-the hall . [The servants]734-the servants had not expected [them]734-the servants so early , and there was only a glimmer of gas on [the upper landing]2929-the upper landing . [Archer]430-archer mounted the stairs , turned up the light , and put a match to the brackets on each side of [the library mantelpiece]2930-the library mantelpiece . The curtains were drawn , and the warm friendly aspect of [the room]991-the room smote [him]430-archer like that of [a familiar face met during an unavowable errand]2932-a familiar face met during an unavowable errand . [He]430-archer noticed that [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife was very pale , and asked if [he]430-archer should get [her]572-his wife some brandy . " Oh , no , "[572-his wife] [she]572-his wife exclaimed with a momentary flush , as [she]572-his wife took off [her]572-his wife cloak . " But had n't [you]430-archer better go to bed at once ? "[572-his wife] [she]572-his wife added , as [he]430-archer opened a silver box on the table and took out a cigarette . [Archer]430-archer threw down the cigarette and walked to [his]430-archer usual place by the fire . " No ; [my]430-archer head is not as bad as that . "[430-archer] [He]430-archer paused . " And there 's something [I]430-archer want to say ; something important -- that [I]430-archer must tell [you]572-his wife at once . "[430-archer] [She]572-his wife had dropped into an armchair , and raised [her]572-his wife head as [he]430-archer spoke . " Yes , [dear]3127-dear ? "[572-his wife] [she]572-his wife rejoined , so gently that [he]430-archer wondered at the lack of wonder with which [she]572-his wife received this preamble . " May-- "[430-archer] [he]430-archer began , standing a few feet from [her]572-his wife chair , and looking over at [her]572-his wife as if the slight distance between [them]2934-them were an unbridgeable abyss . The sound of [his]430-archer voice echoed uncannily through the homelike hush , and [he]430-archer repeated : " There is something [I]430-archer 've got to tell [you]572-his wife ... about [myself]430-archer ... "[430-archer] [She]572-his wife sat silent , without a movement or a tremor of [her]572-his wife lashes . [She]572-his wife was still extremely pale , but [her]572-his wife face had a curious tranquillity of expression that seemed drawn from some secret inner source . [Archer]430-archer checked the conventional phrases of self - accusal that were crowding to [his]430-archer lips . [He]430-archer was determined to put the case baldly , without vain recrimination or excuse . " [Madame Olenska--]491-madame olenska-- "[430-archer] [he]430-archer said ; but at the name [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife raised [her]572-his wife hand as if to silence [him]430-archer . As [she]572-his wife did so the gaslight struck on the gold of [her]572-his wife wedding - ring . " Oh , why should [we]4993-we talk about [Ellen]232-ellen tonight ? "[572-his wife] [she]572-his wife asked , with a slight pout of impatience . " Because [I]572-his wife ought to have spoken before . "[572-his wife] [Her]572-his wife face remained calm . " Is it really worth while , [dear]3127-dear ? [I]430-archer know [I]430-archer 've been unfair to [her]232-ellen at times -- perhaps [we]4993-we all have . [You]3127-dear 've understood [her]232-ellen , no doubt , better than [we]4993-we did : [you]3127-dear 've always been kind to [her]232-ellen . But what does it matter , now it 's all over ? "[430-archer] [Archer]430-archer looked at [her]572-his wife blankly . Could it be possible that the sense of unreality in which [he]430-archer felt [himself]430-archer imprisoned had communicated itself to [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife ? " All over -- what do [you]572-his wife mean ? "[430-archer] [he]430-archer asked in an indistinct stammer . [May]430-archer still looked at [him]430-archer with transparent eyes . " Why -- since [she]232-ellen 's going back to [Europe]14-europe so soon ; since [Granny]243-granny approves and understands , and has arranged to make [her]232-ellen independent of [[her]232-ellen husband--]4995-her husband-- "[572-his wife] [She]572-his wife broke off , and [Archer]430-archer , grasping the corner of the mantelpiece in one convulsed hand , and steadying [himself]430-archer against it , made a vain effort to extend the same control to [his]430-archer reeling thoughts . " [I]572-his wife supposed , "[572-his wife] [he]430-archer heard [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife 's even voice go on , " that [you]572-his wife had been kept at [the office]3721-the office this evening about the business arrangements . It was settled this morning , [I]572-his wife believe . "[572-his wife] [She]572-his wife lowered [her]572-his wife eyes under [his]430-archer unseeing stare , and another fugitive flush passed over [her]572-his wife face . [He]430-archer understood that [his]430-archer own eyes must be unbearable , and turning away , rested [his]430-archer elbows on the mantel - shelf and covered [his]430-archer face . Something drummed and clanged furiously in [his]430-archer ears ; [he]430-archer could not tell if it were the blood in [his]430-archer veins , or the tick of the clock on the mantel . [May]430-archer sat without moving or speaking while the clock slowly measured out five minutes . A lump of coal fell forward in the grate , and hearing [her]572-his wife rise to push it back , [Archer]430-archer at length turned and faced [her]572-his wife . " It 's impossible , "[430-archer] [he]430-archer exclaimed . " Impossible-- ? "[430-archer] " How do [you]572-his wife know -- what [you]572-his wife 've just told [me]430-archer ? "[430-archer] " [I]430-archer saw [Ellen]232-ellen yesterday -- [I]430-archer told [you]430-archer [I]430-archer 'd seen [her]232-ellen at [Granny]243-granny 's . "[430-archer] " It was n't then that [she]232-ellen told [you]430-archer ? "[430-archer] " No ; [I]430-archer had a note from [her]232-ellen this afternoon.--Do [you]430-archer want to see it ? "[430-archer] [He]430-archer could not find [his]430-archer voice , and [she]572-his wife went out of [the room]991-the room , and came back almost immediately . " [I]572-his wife thought [you]430-archer knew , "[572-his wife] [she]572-his wife said simply . [She]572-his wife laid a sheet of paper on the table , and [Archer]430-archer put out [his]430-archer hand and took it up . The letter contained only a few lines . " May dear , [I]430-archer have at last made [Granny]243-granny understand that [my]430-archer visit to [her]243-granny could be no more than a visit ; and [she]243-granny has been as kind and generous as ever . [She]243-granny sees now that if [I]430-archer return to [Europe]14-europe [I]430-archer must live by [myself]430-archer , or rather with [poor [Aunt Medora]492-poor aunt medora , who is coming with me , who is coming with [me]430-archer]492-poor aunt medora , who is coming with me . [I]430-archer am hurrying back to [Washington]111-washington to pack up , and [we]4997-we sail next week . [You]4998-you must be very good to [Granny]243-granny when [I]430-archer 'm gone -- as good as [you]4998-you 've always been to [me]430-archer . [Ellen]232-ellen . "[430-archer] If any of [[my]0-i friends]3301-my friends wish to urge [me]0-i to change [my]0-i mind , please tell [them]3301-my friends it would be utterly useless . " [Archer]430-archer read the letter over two or three times ; then [he]430-archer flung it down and burst out laughing . The sound of [his]430-archer laugh startled [him]430-archer . [It]4999-it recalled [Janey]263-janey 's midnight fright when [she]2940-she had caught [him]430-archer rocking with incomprehensible mirth over [May]430-archer 's telegram announcing that the date of [their]2941-their marriage had been advanced . "[2940-she] Why did [she]2940-she write this ? " [he]430-archer asked , checking [his]430-archer laugh with a supreme effort . [May]430-archer met the question with [her]0-i unshaken candour . "[2940-she] [I]0-i suppose because [we]2941-their talked things over yesterday-- " "[2941-their] What things ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i told [her]2940-she [I]0-i was afraid [I]0-i had n't been fair to [her]2940-she -- hadn't always understood how hard it must have been for [her]2940-she here , alone among [so many people who were relations and yet strangers]2942-so many people who were relations and yet strangers ; who felt the right to criticise , and yet did n't always know the circumstances . " [She]0-i paused . "[0-i] [I]0-i knew [you]0-i 'd been [the one friend [she]2940-she could always count on]2943-the one friend she could always count on ; and [I]0-i wanted [her]2940-she to know that [you]0-i and [I]0-i were the same -- in all [our]2941-their feelings . " [She]0-i hesitated , as if waiting for [him]5000-him to speak , and then added slowly : "[2940-she] [She]2940-she understood [my]0-i wishing to tell [her]2940-she this . [I]0-i think [she]2940-she understands everything . " [She]0-i went up to [Archer]430-archer , and taking one of [his]5000-him cold hands pressed it quickly against [her]0-i cheek . "[0-i] [My]0-i head aches too ; good - night , [dear]3127-dear , " [she]0-i said , and turned to the door , [her]0-i torn and muddy wedding - dress dragging after [her]0-i across [the room]991-the room . XXXIII . It was , as [Mrs. Archer]214-archer smilingly said to [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland , a great event for [a young couple]5002-a young couple to give [their]5002-a young couple first big dinner . [The Newland Archers]261-the newland archers , since [they]261-the newland archers had set up [[their]261-the newland archers household]5003-their household , had received a good deal of company in an informal way . [Archer]214-archer was fond of having [three or four friends]5004-three or four friends to dine , and [May]430-archer welcomed [them]261-the newland archers with the beaming readiness of which [[her]0-i mother]605-her mother had set [her]0-i the example in conjugal affairs . [[Her]0-i husband]663-her husband questioned whether , if left to [herself]0-i , [she]0-i would ever have asked [any one]1150-any one to [the house]532-the house ; but [he]663-her husband had long given up trying to disengage [[her]0-i real self]5009-her real self from the shape into which tradition and training had moulded [her]0-i . It was expected that [well - off young couples in [New York]2-new york]5010-well - off young couples in new york should do a good deal of informal entertaining , and [a Welland married to [an Archer]5012-an archer]5011-a welland married to an archer was doubly pledged to the tradition . But a big dinner , with [a hired chef]5013-a hired chef and [two borrowed footmen]5014-two borrowed footmen , with Roman punch , roses from [Henderson]493-henderson 's , and menus on gilt - edged cards , was a different affair , and not to be lightly undertaken . As [Mrs. Archer]214-archer remarked , the Roman punch made all the difference ; not in itself but by its manifold implications -- since it signified either canvas - backs or terrapin , two soups , a hot and a cold sweet , full decolletage with short sleeves , and [guests of a proportionate importance]5015-guests of a proportionate importance . It was always an interesting occasion when [a young pair]5016-a young pair launched [their]5016-a young pair first invitations in [the third person]5017-the third person , and [their]5016-a young pair summons was seldom refused even by [the seasoned and sought - after]5018-the seasoned and sought - after . Still , it was admittedly a triumph that [the van der Luydens]275-the van der luydens , at [May]430-archer 's request , should have stayed over in order to be present at [her]0-i farewell dinner for [the Countess Olenska]234-the countess olenska . [The two mothers - in - law]5019-the two mothers - in - law sat in [[May]430-archer 's drawing - room]1353-may 's drawing - room on the afternoon of the great day , [Mrs. Archer]214-archer writing out the menus on [Tiffany]494-tiffany 's thickest gilt - edged bristol , while [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland superintended the placing of the palms and standard lamps . [Archer]430-archer , arriving late from [[his]430-archer office]2354-his office , found them still there . [Mrs. Archer]214-archer had turned [her]214-archer attention to the name - cards for the table , and [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland was considering the effect of bringing forward the large gilt sofa , so that another "[0-i] corner " might be created between the piano and the window . [May]430-archer , [they]5019-the two mothers - in - law told [him]430-archer , was in [the dining - room]5022-the dining - room inspecting the mound of Jacqueminot roses and maidenhair in the centre of the long table , and the placing of the Maillard bonbons in openwork silver baskets between the candelabra . On the piano stood a large basket of orchids which [Mr. van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden had had sent from [Skuytercliff]57-skuytercliff . Everything was , in short , as it should be on the approach of so considerable an event . [Mrs. Archer]214-archer ran thoughtfully over the list , checking off each name with [her]214-archer sharp gold pen . "[304-mr. van der luyden] [Henry van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden -- [Louisa]298-louisa -- [the Lovell Mingotts]226-the mingotts -- [the Reggie Chiverses]1062-the reggie chiverses -- [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts and [Gertrude--(yes]2946-gertrude--(yes , [I]0-i suppose [May]430-archer was right to have [them)--the Selfridge Merrys]283-the selfridge merrys , [Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson , [Van Newland]495-van newland and [[his]495-van newland wife]572-his wife . ( How time passes ! It seems only yesterday that [he]495-van newland was [[your]0-i best man]2948-your best man , [Newland)--and Countess Olenska]496-the countess olenska -- yes , [I]0-i think that 's all .... " [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland surveyed [[her]218-mrs. welland son - in - law]2117-her son - in - law affectionately . "[495-van newland] [No one]619-no one can say , [Newland]495-van newland , that [you]0-i and [May]430-archer are not giving [Ellen]232-ellen a handsome send - off . " "[619-no one] Ah , well , " said [Mrs. Archer]214-archer , "[619-no one] [I]0-i understand [May]430-archer 's wanting [[her]232-ellen cousin]690-her cousin to tell [people abroad]2951-people abroad that [we]2952-we 're not quite barbarians . " "[430-archer] [I]0-i 'm sure [Ellen]232-ellen will appreciate it . [She]232-ellen was to arrive this morning , [I]0-i believe . It will make a most charming last impression . The evening before sailing is usually so dreary , " [Mrs. Welland]218-mrs. welland cheerfully continued . [Archer]430-archer turned toward the door , and [[his]430-archer mother - in - law]2560-his mother - in - law called to [him]430-archer : "[232-ellen] Do go in and have a peep at the table . And do n't let May tire [herself]232-ellen too much . " But [he]430-archer affected not to hear , and sprang up the stairs to [[his]430-archer library]1368-his library . [The room]991-the room looked at [him]430-archer like an alien countenance composed into a polite grimace ; and [he]430-archer perceived that it had been ruthlessly "[0-i] tidied , " and prepared , by a judicious distribution of ash - trays and cedar - wood boxes , for [the gentlemen]984-the gentlemen to smoke in . "[0-i] Ah , well , " [he]430-archer thought , "[0-i] it 's not for long-- " and [he]430-archer went on to [[his]430-archer dressing - room]5028-his dressing - room . Ten days had passed since [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's departure from [New York]2-new york . During those ten days [Archer]430-archer had had no sign from [her]240-madame olenska but that conveyed by the return of a key wrapped in tissue paper , and sent to [[his]430-archer office]2354-his office in a sealed envelope addressed in [her]240-madame olenska hand . This retort to [his]430-archer last appeal might have been interpreted as a classic move in a familiar game ; but [the young man]527-the young man chose to give it a different meaning . [She]240-madame olenska was still fighting against [her]240-madame olenska fate ; but [she]240-madame olenska was going to [Europe]14-europe , and [she]240-madame olenska was not returning to [[her]240-madame olenska husband]663-her husband . Nothing , therefore , was to prevent [his]430-archer following [her]240-madame olenska ; and once [he]430-archer had taken the irrevocable step , and had proved to [her]240-madame olenska that it was irrevocable , [he]430-archer believed [she]240-madame olenska would not send [him]430-archer away . This confidence in the future had steadied [him]430-archer to play [his]430-archer part in the present . It had kept [him]430-archer from writing to [her]240-madame olenska , or betraying , by any sign or act , [his]430-archer misery and mortification . It seemed to [him]430-archer that in the deadly silent game between [them]5032-them the trumps were still in [his]430-archer hands ; and [he]430-archer waited . There had been , nevertheless , moments sufficiently difficult to pass ; as when [Mr. Letterblair]357-mr. letterblair , the day after [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's departure , had sent for [him]430-archer to go over the details of the trust which [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott wished to create for [[her]216-mrs. manson mingott granddaughter]5033-her granddaughter . For a couple of hours [Archer]430-archer had examined the terms of the deed with [[his]430-archer senior]3500-his senior , all the while obscurely feeling that if [he]430-archer had been consulted it was for some reason other than the obvious one of [[his]430-archer cousinship]5035-his cousinship ; and that the close of the conference would reveal it . "[0-i] Well , [the lady]681-the lady ca n't deny that it 's a handsome arrangement , " [Mr. Letterblair]357-mr. letterblair had summed up , after mumbling over a summary of the settlement . "[681-the lady] In fact [I]0-i 'm bound to say [she]681-the lady 's been treated pretty handsomely all round . " "[681-the lady] All round ? " [Archer]430-archer echoed with a touch of derision . "[681-the lady] Do [you]0-i refer to [[her]681-the lady husband]663-her husband 's proposal to give [her]681-the lady back [her]681-the lady own money ? " [Mr. Letterblair]357-mr. letterblair 's bushy eyebrows went up a fraction of an inch . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear sir]2955-my dear sir , the law 's the law ; and [[your]0-i wife 's cousin]2956-your wife 's cousin was married under the French law . It 's to be presumed [she]681-the lady knew what that meant . " "[681-the lady] Even if [she]681-the lady did , what happened subsequently-- . " But [Archer]430-archer paused . [Mr. Letterblair]357-mr. letterblair had laid [his]357-mr. letterblair pen - handle against [his]357-mr. letterblair big corrugated nose , and was looking down it with the expression assumed by [virtuous elderly gentlemen]5036-virtuous elderly gentlemen when [they]5036-virtuous elderly gentlemen wish [[their]5036-virtuous elderly gentlemen youngers]5037-their youngers to understand that virtue is not synonymous with ignorance . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear sir]2955-my dear sir , [I]0-i 've no wish to extenuate [the Count]3461-the count 's transgressions ; but -- but on the other side ... [I]0-i would n't put [my]0-i hand in the fire ... well , that there had n't been tit for tat ... with [the young champion]683-the young champion .... " [Mr. Letterblair]357-mr. letterblair unlocked a drawer and pushed a folded paper toward [Archer]430-archer . "[0-i] This report , the result of discreet enquiries ... " And then , as [Archer]430-archer made no effort to glance at the paper or to repudiate the suggestion , [the lawyer]3616-the lawyer somewhat flatly continued : "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't say it 's conclusive , [you]2955-my dear sir observe ; far from it . But straws show ... and on the whole it 's eminently satisfactory for all parties that this dignified solution has been reached . " "[683-the young champion] Oh , eminently , " [Archer]430-archer assented , pushing back the paper . A day or two later , on responding to a summons from [Mrs. Manson Mingott]216-mrs. manson mingott , [his]430-archer soul had been more deeply tried . [He]430-archer had found [the old lady]3109-the old lady depressed and querulous . "[683-the young champion] [You]2955-my dear sir know [she]683-the young champion 's deserted [me]0-i ? " [she]0-i began at once ; and without waiting for [his]430-archer reply : "[683-the young champion] Oh , do n't ask [me]0-i why ! [She]683-the young champion gave so many reasons that [I]0-i 've forgotten them all . [My]0-i private belief is that [she]683-the young champion could n't face the boredom . At any rate that 's what [Augusta]274-augusta and [[my]0-i daughters - in - law]2960-my daughters - in - law think . And [I]0-i do n't know that [I]0-i altogether blame [her]683-the young champion . [Olenski]278-count olenski 's [a finished scoundrel]2961-a finished scoundrel ; but life with [him]278-count olenski must have been a good deal gayer than it is in [Fifth Avenue]15-fifth avenue . Not that [the family]551-the family would admit that : [they]551-the family think [Fifth Avenue]15-fifth avenue is [Heaven]181-heaven with [the rue de la Paix]3361-the rue de la paix thrown in . And poor [Ellen]232-ellen , of course , has no idea of going back to [[her]232-ellen husband]663-her husband . [She]232-ellen held out as firmly as ever against that . So [she]232-ellen 's to settle down in [Paris]3-paris with [that fool Medora]2965-that fool medora .... Well , [Paris]3-paris is [Paris]3-paris ; and [you]2966-you can keep [a carriage]2967-a carriage [there]732-there on next to nothing . But [she]232-ellen was as gay as a bird , and [I]0-i shall miss [her]232-ellen . " Two tears , the parched tears of the old , rolled down [her]0-i puffy cheeks and vanished in the abysses of [her]0-i bosom . "[0-i] All [I]0-i ask is , " [she]0-i concluded , "[0-i] that [they]2969-they should n't bother [me]0-i any more . [I]0-i must really be allowed to digest [my]0-i gruel .... " And [she]0-i twinkled a little wistfully at [Archer]430-archer . It was that evening , on [his]430-archer return [home]649-home , that [May]430-archer announced [her]0-i intention of giving a farewell dinner to [[her]0-i cousin]690-her cousin . [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's name had not been pronounced between [them]5042-them since the night of [her]0-i flight to [Washington]111-washington ; and [Archer]430-archer looked at [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife with surprise . "[0-i] A dinner -- why ? " [he]430-archer interrogated . [Her]0-i colour rose . "[0-i] But [you]0-i like [Ellen]232-ellen -- [I]0-i thought [you]0-i 'd be pleased . " "[0-i] It 's awfully nice -- [your]0-i putting it in that way . But [I]0-i really do n't see-- " "[0-i] [I]0-i mean to do it , [Newland]214-archer , " [she]0-i said , quietly rising and going to [her]0-i desk . "[0-i] Here are the invitations all written . [Mother]352-mother helped [me]0-i -- [she]352-mother agrees that [we]2970-we ought to . " [She]0-i paused , embarrassed and yet smiling , and [Archer]430-archer suddenly saw before [him]430-archer the embodied image of [the Family]551-the family . "[352-mother] Oh , all right , " [he]430-archer said , staring with unseeing eyes at the list of guests that [she]0-i had put in [his]430-archer hand . When [he]430-archer entered [the drawing - room]983-the drawing - room before dinner [May]430-archer was stooping over the fire and trying to coax the logs to burn in their unaccustomed setting of immaculate tiles . The tall lamps were all lit , and [Mr. van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden 's orchids had been conspicuously disposed in various receptacles of modern porcelain and knobby silver . [[Mrs. Newland Archer]214-archer 's drawing - room]5046-mrs. newland archer 's drawing - room was generally thought a great success . [A gilt bamboo jardiniere]5047-a gilt bamboo jardiniere , in which the primulas and cinerarias were punctually renewed , blocked the access to the bay window ( where the old - fashioned would have preferred a bronze reduction of the Venus of Milo ) ; the sofas and arm - chairs of pale brocade were cleverly grouped about little plush tables densely covered with silver toys , porcelain animals and efflorescent photograph frames ; and tall rosy - shaded lamps shot up like tropical flowers among the palms . "[352-mother] [I]0-i do n't think [Ellen]232-ellen has ever seen [this room]2971-this room lighted up , " said [May]430-archer , rising flushed from [her]0-i struggle , and sending about [her]0-i a glance of pardonable pride . The brass tongs which [she]0-i had propped against the side of the chimney fell with a crash that drowned [[her]0-i husband]663-her husband 's answer ; and before [he]430-archer could restore them [Mr.]5049-mr. and [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden were announced . [The other guests]5050-the other guests quickly followed , for it was known that [the van der Luydens]275-the van der luydens liked to dine punctually . [The room]991-the room was nearly full , and [Archer]430-archer was engaged in showing to [Mrs. Selfridge]423-mrs. selfridge merry Merry a small highly - varnished Verbeckhoven "[232-ellen] Study of Sheep , " which [Mr. Welland]339-mr. welland had given [May]430-archer for Christmas , when [he]430-archer found [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska at [his]430-archer side . [She]240-madame olenska was excessively pale , and [her]240-madame olenska pallor made [her]240-madame olenska dark hair seem denser and heavier than ever . Perhaps that , or the fact that [she]240-madame olenska had wound several rows of amber beads about [her]240-madame olenska neck , reminded [him]430-archer suddenly of the little [Ellen Mingott]260-ellen [he]430-archer had danced with at [children]3115-children 's parties , when [Medora Manson]229-medora manson had first brought [her]240-madame olenska to [New York]2-new york . The amber beads were trying to [her]240-madame olenska complexion , or [her]240-madame olenska dress was perhaps unbecoming : [her]240-madame olenska face looked lustreless and almost ugly , and [he]430-archer had never loved it as [he]430-archer did at that minute . [Their]2972-their hands met , and [he]430-archer thought [he]430-archer heard [her]240-madame olenska say : "[232-ellen] Yes , [we]2972-their 're sailing tomorrow in the [Russia--]182-russia-- " ; then there was an unmeaning noise of opening doors , and after an interval [May]430-archer 's voice : "[232-ellen] [Newland]214-archer ! Dinner 's been announced . Wo n't [you]2973-you please take [Ellen]260-ellen in ? " [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska put [her]240-madame olenska hand on [his]430-archer arm , and [he]430-archer noticed that the hand was ungloved , and remembered how [he]430-archer had kept [his]430-archer eyes fixed on it the evening that [he]430-archer had sat with [her]240-madame olenska in [the little Twenty - third Street drawing - room]5053-the little twenty - third street drawing - room . All the beauty that had forsaken [her]240-madame olenska face seemed to have taken refuge in the long pale fingers and faintly dimpled knuckles on [his]430-archer sleeve , and [he]430-archer said to [himself]430-archer : "[2973-you] If it were only to see [her]260-ellen hand again [I]0-i should have to follow [her--]2974-her-- . " It was only at an entertainment ostensibly offered to [a "[2974-her--] foreign visitor]5054-a " foreign visitor " that [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden could suffer the diminution of being placed on [[her]297-mrs. van der luyden host]5055-her host 's left . The fact of [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's "[232-ellen] foreignness " could hardly have been more adroitly emphasised than by this farewell tribute ; and [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden accepted [her]240-madame olenska displacement with an affability which left no doubt as to [her]240-madame olenska approval . There were certain things that had to be done , and if done at all , done handsomely and thoroughly ; and one of these , in the old [New York]2-new york code , was the tribal rally around [a kinswoman]5056-a kinswoman about to be eliminated from [the tribe]5057-the tribe . There was nothing on [earth that]5058-earth that [the Wellands]324-the wellands and [Mingotts]226-the mingotts would not have done to proclaim [their]324-the wellands unalterable affection for [the Countess Olenska]496-the countess olenska now that [her]260-ellen passage for [Europe]14-europe was engaged ; and [Archer]430-archer , at the head of [his]430-archer table , sat marvelling at the silent untiring activity with which [her]260-ellen popularity had been retrieved , grievances against [her]260-ellen silenced , [her]260-ellen past countenanced , and [her]260-ellen present irradiated by the family approval . [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden shone on [her]260-ellen with the dim benevolence which was [her]260-ellen nearest approach to cordiality , and [Mr. van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden , from [his]304-mr. van der luyden seat at [May]430-archer 's right , cast down the table glances plainly intended to justify all the carnations [he]304-mr. van der luyden had sent from [Skuytercliff]57-skuytercliff . [Archer]430-archer , who seemed to be assisting at the scene in a state of odd imponderability , as if [he]430-archer floated somewhere between chandelier and ceiling , wondered at nothing so much as [his]430-archer own share in the proceedings . As [his]430-archer glance travelled from one placid well - fed face to another [he]430-archer saw [all the harmless - looking people]5059-all the harmless - looking people engaged upon [May]430-archer 's canvas - backs as a band of [dumb conspirators]5060-dumb conspirators , and [himself]430-archer and [the pale woman on [his]430-archer right]5061-the pale woman on his right as the centre of [their]5059-all the harmless - looking people conspiracy . And then it came over [him]430-archer , in a vast flash made up of many broken gleams , that to all of [them]5059-all the harmless - looking people [he]430-archer and [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska were [lovers]845-lovers , [lovers in the extreme sense peculiar to "[2974-her--] foreign " vocabularies]5063-lovers in the extreme sense peculiar to " foreign " vocabularies . [He]430-archer guessed [himself]430-archer to have been , for months , the centre of [countless silently observing eyes and patiently listening ears]5064-countless silently observing eyes and patiently listening ears ; [he]430-archer understood that , by means as yet unknown to [him]430-archer , the separation between [himself]430-archer and [the partner]5065-the partner of [his]430-archer guilt had been achieved , and that now [the whole tribe]5066-the whole tribe had rallied about [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife on the tacit assumption that [nobody]3102-nobody knew anything , or had ever imagined anything , and that the occasion of the entertainment was simply [May Archer]430-archer 's natural desire to take an affectionate leave of [[her]572-his wife friend]5069-her friend and [cousin]5070-cousin . It was the old [New York]2-new york way of taking life "[232-ellen] without effusion of blood " : the way of [people who dreaded scandal more than disease , who placed decency above courage , and who considered that nothing was more ill - bred than "[2974-her--] scenes , "]5071-people who dreaded scandal more than disease , who placed decency above courage , and who considered that nothing was more ill - bred than " scenes , " except the behaviour of [those who gave rise to them]5072-those who gave rise to them . As these thoughts succeeded each other in [his]430-archer mind [Archer]430-archer felt like [a prisoner in the centre of [an armed camp]5074-an armed camp]5073-a prisoner in the centre of an armed camp . [He]430-archer looked about the table , and guessed at the inexorableness of [[his]430-archer captors]5075-his captors from the tone in which , over the asparagus from [Florida]92-florida , [they]5075-his captors were dealing with [Beaufort]230-beaufort and [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife . "[2974-her--] It 's to show [me]0-i , " [he]430-archer thought , "[2974-her--] what would happen to [ME--]2975-me-- " and a deathly sense of the superiority of implication and analogy over direct action , and of silence over rash words , closed in on [him]430-archer like the doors of [the family vault]1421-the family vault . [He]430-archer laughed , and met [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden 's startled eyes . "[0-i] [You]0-i think it laughable ? " [she]297-mrs. van der luyden said with a pinched smile . "[0-i] Of course poor [Regina]475-beaufort 's idea of remaining in [New York]2-new york has its ridiculous side , [I]0-i suppose ; " and [Archer]430-archer muttered : "[0-i] Of course . " At this point , [he]430-archer became conscious that [[Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's other neighbour]5078-madame olenska 's other neighbour had been engaged for some time with [the lady on [his]430-archer right]5079-the lady on his right . At the same moment [he]430-archer saw that [May]430-archer , serenely enthroned between [Mr. van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden and [Mr. Selfridge Merry]497-mr. selfridge merry , had cast a quick glance down the table . It was evident that [the host]5080-the host and [the lady on]5081-the lady on [his]430-archer right could not sit through the whole meal in silence . [He]430-archer turned to [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska , and [her]240-madame olenska pale smile met [him]430-archer . "[0-i] Oh , do let 's see it through , " it seemed to say . "[0-i] Did [you]475-beaufort find the journey tiring ? " [he]430-archer asked in a voice that surprised [him]430-archer by its naturalness ; and [she]475-beaufort answered that , on the contrary , [she]475-beaufort had seldom travelled with fewer discomforts . "[475-beaufort] Except , [you]2976-you know , the dreadful heat in [the train]4171-the train , " [she]475-beaufort added ; and [he]430-archer remarked that [she]475-beaufort would not suffer from that particular hardship in [the country [she]475-beaufort was going to]5082-the country she was going to . "[0-i] [I]0-i never , " [he]430-archer declared with intensity , "[0-i] was more nearly frozen than once , in April , in the train between [Calais]183-calais and [Paris]3-paris . " [She]475-beaufort said [she]475-beaufort did not wonder , but remarked that , after all , [one]519-one could always carry an extra rug , and that every form of travel had its hardships ; to which [he]430-archer abruptly returned that [he]430-archer thought them all of no account compared with the blessedness of getting away . [She]475-beaufort changed colour , and [he]430-archer added , [his]430-archer voice suddenly rising in pitch : "[0-i] [I]0-i mean to do a lot of travelling [myself]0-i before long . [I]0-i 'm game if [you]396-reggie chivers are-- " at which [Mrs. Reggie]396-reggie chivers piped up that [she]396-reggie chivers could not think of letting [Reggie]396-reggie chivers go till after the Martha Washington Ball [she]396-reggie chivers was getting up for [the Blind Asylum]5084-the blind asylum in Easter week ; and [[her]396-reggie chivers husband]663-her husband placidly observed that by that time [he]663-her husband would have to be practising for the International Polo match . But [Mr. Selfridge Merry]497-mr. selfridge merry had caught the phrase "[396-reggie chivers] round [the world]580-the world , " and having once circled the globe in [[his]497-mr. selfridge merry steam - yacht]5086-his steam - yacht , [he]497-mr. selfridge merry seized the opportunity to send down the table several striking items concerning the shallowness of [the Mediterranean ports]5087-the mediterranean ports . And [Mrs. Merry]423-mrs. selfridge merry said [she]423-mrs. selfridge merry could never be too grateful to [Dr. Bencomb]454-dr. bencomb for having made [them]5088-them promise not to go to [Naples]187-naples on account of the fever . "[0-i] But [you]2980-you must have three weeks to do [India]188-india properly , " [[her]423-mrs. selfridge merry husband]663-her husband conceded , anxious to have it understood that [he]497-mr. selfridge merry was [no frivolous globe - trotter]5090-no frivolous globe - trotter . And at this point [the ladies]754-the ladies went up to [the drawing - room]983-the drawing - room . In [the library]769-the library , in spite of weightier presences , [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts predominated . The talk , as usual , had veered around to [the Beauforts]246-the beauforts , and even [Mr. van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden and [Mr. Selfridge Merry]497-mr. selfridge merry , installed in the honorary arm - chairs tacitly reserved for [them]5088-them , paused to listen to [the younger man]5094-the younger man 's philippic . Never had [Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts so abounded in the sentiments that adorn Christian manhood and exalt the sanctity of [the home]5095-the home . Indignation lent [him]223-lawrence lefferts a scathing eloquence , and it was clear that if [others]3523-others had followed [his]223-lawrence lefferts example , and acted as [he]223-lawrence lefferts talked , society would never have been weak enough to receive [a foreign upstart like [Beaufort]475-beaufort]5097-a foreign upstart like beaufort -- no , [sir]3197-sir , not even if [he]223-lawrence lefferts 'd married [a van der [Luyden]498-dallas or [a Lanning]5099-a lanning instead of [a Dallas]5100-a dallas]498-dallas .
