If [society]1441-society chose to open [its]1441-society doors to [vulgar women]5105-vulgar women the harm was not great , though the gain was doubtful ; but once it got in the way of tolerating [men of obscure origin and tainted wealth]5106-men of obscure origin and tainted wealth the end was total disintegration -- and at no distant date . "[2980-you] If things go on at this pace , " [Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts thundered , looking like [a young prophet dressed by Poole]5107-a young prophet dressed by poole , and who had not yet been stoned , "[2981-we] [we]2981-we shall see [[our]2981-we children]2982-our children fighting for invitations to [[swindlers]2983-swindlers ' houses]2984-swindlers ' houses , and marrying [[Beaufort]475-beaufort 's bastards]2985-beaufort 's bastards . " "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i say -- draw it mild ! "[0-i] Has [he]2986-he got any ? " cried [Mr. Sillerton Jackson]224-mr. jackson , pricking up [his]224-mr. jackson ears ; and while [Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts tried to turn the question with a laugh , [the old gentleman]2453-the old gentleman twittered into [Archer]214-archer 's ear : "[2987-queer] [Queer]2987-queer , [those fellows who are always wanting to set things right]2988-those fellows who are always wanting to set things right . But [I]0-i hear there are pressing reasons for [[our]2991-our friend]2992-our friend [Lawrence]223-lawrence lefferts 's diatribe:--typewriter this time , [I]0-i understand .... " The talk swept past [Archer]214-archer like some senseless river running and running because it did not know enough to stop . [He]2990-he saw , on the faces about [him]2990-he , expressions of interest , amusement and even mirth . [He]2990-he listened to [the younger men]677-the younger men 's laughter , and to the praise of the Archer Madeira , which [Mr. van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden and [Mr. Merry]497-mr. selfridge merry were thoughtfully celebrating . Through it all [he]2990-he was dimly aware of a general attitude of friendliness toward [himself]2990-he , as if [the guard of [the prisoner [he]2990-he felt [himself]2990-he to be]5111-the prisoner he felt himself to be]5110-the guard of the prisoner he felt himself to be were trying to soften [his]2990-he captivity ; and the perception increased [his]2990-he passionate determination to be free . In [the drawing - room]983-the drawing - room , where [they]677-the younger men presently joined [the ladies]754-the ladies , [he]2990-he met [May]430-archer 's triumphant eyes , and read in [them]677-the younger men the conviction that everything had "[0-i] gone off " beautifully . [She]754-the ladies rose from [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's side , and immediately [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden beckoned [the latter]592-the latter to a seat on the gilt sofa where [she]754-the ladies throned . [Mrs. Selfridge Merry]423-mrs. selfridge merry bore across [the room]991-the room to join [them]677-the younger men , and it became clear to [Archer]430-archer that here also a conspiracy of rehabilitation and obliteration was going on . The silent organisation which held [[his]430-archer little world]5116-his little world together was determined to put itself on record as never for a moment having questioned the propriety of [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's conduct , or the completeness of [Archer]430-archer 's domestic felicity . [All these amiable and inexorable persons]5117-all these amiable and inexorable persons were resolutely engaged in pretending to each other that [they]5117-all these amiable and inexorable persons had never heard of , suspected , or even conceived possible , the least hint to the contrary ; and from this tissue of elaborate mutual dissimulation [Archer]430-archer once more disengaged the fact that [New York]471-old new york believed [him]2990-he to be [[Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's lover]5118-madame olenska 's lover . [He]430-archer caught the glitter of victory in [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife 's eyes , and for the first time understood that [she]572-his wife shared the belief . The discovery roused a laughter of inner devils that reverberated through all [his]430-archer efforts to discuss the [Martha Washington]241-martha ball with [Mrs. Reggie Chivers]396-reggie chivers and [little Mrs. Newland]214-archer ; and so the evening swept on , running and running like [a senseless river]5120-a senseless river that did not know how to stop . At length [he]430-archer saw that [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska had risen and was saying good - bye . [He]430-archer understood that in a moment [she]240-madame olenska would be gone , and tried to remember what [he]430-archer had said to [her]240-madame olenska at dinner ; but [he]430-archer could not recall a single word [they]5121-they had exchanged . [She]240-madame olenska went up to [May]430-archer , [the rest of [the company]4445-the company]4444-the rest of the company making a circle about [her]240-madame olenska as [she]240-madame olenska advanced . [The two young women]5124-the two young women clasped hands ; then [May]430-archer bent forward and kissed [[her]240-madame olenska cousin]690-her cousin . "[0-i] Certainly [[our]2993-our hostess]2994-our hostess is much [the handsomer of [the two]797-the two]2995-the handsomer of the two , " [Archer]430-archer heard [Reggie Chivers]396-reggie chivers say in an undertone to [young Mrs. Newland]214-archer ; and [he]430-archer remembered [Beaufort]475-beaufort 's coarse sneer at [May]430-archer 's ineffectual beauty . A moment later [he]430-archer was in [the hall]755-the hall , putting [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's cloak about [her]240-madame olenska shoulders . Through all [his]430-archer confusion of mind [he]430-archer had held fast to the resolve to say nothing that might startle or disturb [her]240-madame olenska . Convinced that no power could now turn [him]430-archer from [his]430-archer purpose [he]430-archer had found strength to let events shape themselves as they would . But as [he]430-archer followed [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska into [the hall]755-the hall [he]430-archer thought with a sudden hunger of being for a moment alone with [her]240-madame olenska at the door of [[her]240-madame olenska carriage]1442-her carriage . "[2994-our hostess] Is [[your]2997-your carriage]1889-your carriage here ? " [he]430-archer asked ; and at that moment [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden , who was being majestically inserted into [her]240-madame olenska sables , said gently : "[2999-we] [We]2999-we are driving [dear Ellen]499-dear ellen [home]649-home . " [Archer]430-archer 's heart gave a jerk , and [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska , clasping [her]240-madame olenska cloak and fan with one hand , held out the other to [him]430-archer . "[499-dear ellen] Good - bye -- but [I]0-i shall see [you]2997-your soon in [Paris]3-paris , " [he]430-archer answered aloud -- it seemed to [him]430-archer that [he]430-archer had shouted it . "[0-i] Oh , " [she]240-madame olenska murmured , "[0-i] if [you]0-i and [May]430-archer could come-- ! " [Mr. van der Luyden]304-mr. van der luyden advanced to give [her]240-madame olenska [his]430-archer arm , and [Archer]430-archer turned to [Mrs. van der Luyden]297-mrs. van der luyden . For a moment , in the billowy darkness inside [the big landau]5129-the big landau , [he]430-archer caught the dim oval of a face , eyes shining steadily -- and [she]240-madame olenska was gone . As [he]430-archer went up [the steps]2926-the steps [he]430-archer crossed [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts coming down with [[his]223-lawrence lefferts wife]572-his wife . "[0-i] [I]0-i say , [old chap]3001-old chap : do [you]3001-old chap mind just letting it be understood that [I]0-i 'm dining with [you]3001-old chap at [the club]1433-the club tomorrow night ? Thanks so much , [[you]3001-old chap old brick]3003-you old brick ! Good - night . " "[3001-old chap] It DID go off beautifully , did n't it ? " [May]430-archer questioned from the threshold of [the library]769-the library . [Archer]430-archer roused [himself]430-archer with a start . As soon as [the last carriage]5134-the last carriage had driven away , [he]430-archer had come up to [the library]769-the library and shut [himself]430-archer in , with the hope that [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife , who still lingered below , would go straight to [[her]572-his wife room]2511-her room . But there [she]572-his wife stood , pale and drawn , yet radiating the factitious energy of [one who has passed beyond fatigue]5138-one who has passed beyond fatigue . "[3001-old chap] May [I]0-i come and talk it over ? " [she]572-his wife asked . "[0-i] Of course , if [you]3001-old chap like . But [you]3001-old chap must be awfully sleepy-- " "[0-i] No , [I]0-i 'm not sleepy . [I]0-i should like to sit with [you]0-i a little . " "[0-i] Very well , " [he]430-archer said , pushing [her]572-his wife chair near the fire . [She]572-his wife sat down and [he]430-archer resumed [his]430-archer seat ; but [neither]1147-neither spoke for a long time . At length [Archer]430-archer began abruptly : "[0-i] Since [you]0-i 're not tired , and want to talk , there 's something [I]0-i must tell [you]0-i . [I]0-i tried to the other night-- . " [She]572-his wife looked at [him]430-archer quickly . "[0-i] Yes , [dear]3127-dear . Something about [yourself]3001-old chap ? " "[0-i] About [myself]0-i . [You]3001-old chap say [you]3001-old chap 're not tired : well , [I]0-i am . Horribly tired ... " In an instant [she]572-his wife was all tender anxiety . "[3001-old chap] Oh , [I]0-i 've seen it coming on , [Newland]214-archer ! [You]214-archer 've been so wickedly overworked-- " "[214-archer] Perhaps it 's that . Anyhow , [I]0-i want to make a break-- " "[3001-old chap] A break ? To give up the law ? " "[3001-old chap] To go away , at any rate -- at once . On a long trip , ever so far off -- away from everything-- " [He]430-archer paused , conscious that [he]430-archer had failed in [his]430-archer attempt to speak with the indifference of [a man who longs for a change , and is yet too weary to welcome it]5140-a man who longs for a change , and is yet too weary to welcome it . Do what [he]430-archer would , the chord of eagerness vibrated . "[3001-old chap] Away from everything-- " [he]430-archer repeated . "[3001-old chap] Ever so far ? Where , for instance ? " [she]572-his wife asked . "[3001-old chap] Oh , [I]0-i do n't know . [India]188-india -- or [Japan]485-japan . " [She]572-his wife stood up , and as [he]430-archer sat with bent head , [his]430-archer chin propped on [his]430-archer hands , [he]430-archer felt [her]572-his wife warmly and fragrantly hovering over [him]430-archer . "[3001-old chap] As far as that ? But [I]0-i 'm afraid [you]214-archer ca n't , [dear]3127-dear ... " [she]0-i said in an unsteady voice . "[214-archer] Not unless [you]214-archer 'll take [me]0-i with [you]214-archer . " And then , as [he]430-archer was silent , [she]0-i went on , in tones so clear and evenly - pitched that each separate syllable tapped like a little hammer on [his]430-archer brain : "[214-archer] That is , if [the doctors]1683-the doctors will let [me]0-i go ... but [I]0-i 'm afraid [they]1683-the doctors wo n't . For [you]214-archer see , [Newland]214-archer , [I]0-i 've been sure since this morning of something [I]0-i 've been so longing and hoping for-- " [He]430-archer looked up at [her]0-i with a sick stare , and [she]0-i sank down , all dew and roses , and hid [her]0-i face against [his]430-archer knee . "[0-i] Oh , [[my]0-i dear]3140-my dear , " [he]430-archer said , holding [her]0-i to [him]430-archer while [his]430-archer cold hand stroked [her]0-i hair . " "[214-archer] Only [Mamma]244-mamma and [[your]0-i mother]1787-your mother . " [Her]572-his wife colour burned deeper , but [she]572-his wife held [his]430-archer gaze . "[0-i] No ; [I]0-i was n't sure then -- but [I]0-i told [her]499-dear ellen [I]0-i was . And [you]0-i see [I]0-i was right ! " [she]572-his wife exclaimed , [her]572-his wife blue eyes wet with victory . XXXIV . [Newland]214-archer [Archer]430-archer sat at the writing - table in [[his]430-archer library in [East Thirty - ninth Street]75-east thirty - ninth street]5145-his library in east thirty - ninth street . [He]430-archer had just got back from a big official reception for the inauguration of [the new galleries at [the Metropolitan Museum]179-the metropolitan museum]5146-the new galleries at the metropolitan museum , and the spectacle of [those great spaces]5147-those great spaces crowded with the spoils of the ages , where the throng of fashion circulated through a series of scientifically catalogued treasures , had suddenly pressed on a rusted spring of memory . "[0-i] Why , this used to be [one of [the old Cesnola rooms]3012-the old cesnola rooms]3011-one of the old cesnola rooms , " [he]430-archer heard [some one]687-some one say ; and instantly everything about [him]430-archer vanished , and [he]430-archer was sitting alone on a hard leather divan against a radiator , while [a slight figure in a long sealskin cloak]5149-a slight figure in a long sealskin cloak moved away down the meagrely - fitted vista of [the old Museum]5150-the old museum . The vision had roused a host of other associations , and [he]430-archer sat looking with new eyes at [the library]769-the library which , for over thirty years , had been the scene of [his]430-archer solitary musings and of all the family confabulations . It was [the room in which most of the real things of [his]430-archer life had happened]5152-the room in which most of the real things of his life had happened . There [[his]430-archer wife]572-his wife , nearly twenty - six years ago , had broken to [him]430-archer , with a blushing circumlocution that would have caused [the young women of the new generation]5154-the young women of the new generation to smile , the news that [she]572-his wife was to have [a child]1393-a child ; and there [[their]5156-their eldest boy]5157-their eldest boy , [Dallas]498-dallas , too delicate to be taken to [church]1413-church in midwinter , had been christened by [[their]5156-their old friend [the Bishop of [New York]2-new york]5160-the bishop of new york , [the ample magnificent irreplaceable Bishop]5161-the ample magnificent irreplaceable bishop , so long the pride and ornament of [[his]430-archer diocese]5162-his diocese]5159-their old friend the bishop of new york , the ample magnificent irreplaceable bishop , so long the pride and ornament of his diocese . There [Dallas]498-dallas had first staggered across the floor shouting "[3013-dad] [Dad]3013-dad , " while [May]430-archer and [the nurse]5163-the nurse laughed behind the door ; there [[their]5156-their second child]5164-their second child , [Mary]309-mary ( who was so like [[her]309-mary mother]605-her mother ) , had announced [her]309-mary engagement to [the dullest and most reliable of [[Reggie Chivers]396-reggie chivers 's many sons]5167-reggie chivers 's many sons]5166-the dullest and most reliable of reggie chivers 's many sons ; and there [Archer]430-archer had kissed [her]309-mary through [her]309-mary wedding veil before [they]5156-their went down to the motor which was to carry [them]5156-their to [Grace Church]97-grace church -- for in a world where all else had reeled on [its]97-grace church foundations the "[3013-dad] Grace Church wedding " remained an unchanged institution . It was in [the library]769-the library that [he]430-archer and [May]430-archer had always discussed the future of [the children]1586-the children : the studies of [Dallas]498-dallas and [[his]498-dallas young brother]5170-his young brother [Bill]500-bill , [Mary]309-mary 's incurable indifference to "[3013-dad] accomplishments , " and passion for sport and philanthropy , and the vague leanings toward "[3013-dad] art " which had finally landed the restless and curious [Dallas]498-dallas in the office of [a rising New York architect]5171-a rising new york architect . [The young men]5172-the young men nowadays were emancipating [themselves]5172-the young men from the law and business and taking up all sorts of new things . If [they]5172-the young men were not absorbed in state politics or municipal reform , the chances were that [they]5172-the young men were going in for Central American archaeology , for architecture or landscape - engineering ; taking a keen and learned interest in [the prerevolutionary buildings of [[their]5172-the young men own country]5174-their own country]5173-the prerevolutionary buildings of their own country , studying and adapting Georgian types , and protesting at the meaningless use of the word "[3013-dad] Colonial . " [Nobody]3102-nobody nowadays had "[3013-dad] [Colonial " houses]5176-colonial " houses except [the millionaire grocers of [the suburbs]5178-the suburbs]5177-the millionaire grocers of the suburbs . But above all -- sometimes [Archer]430-archer put it above all -- it was in [that library]5179-that library that [the Governor of [New York]2-new york]5180-the governor of new york , coming down from [Albany]8-albany one evening to dine and spend the night , had turned to [[his]5180-the governor of new york host]1295-his host , and said , banging [his]5180-the governor of new york clenched fist on the table and gnashing [his]5180-the governor of new york eye - glasses : "[3014-the professional politician] Hang [the professional politician]3014-the professional politician ! [You]3014-the professional politician 're [the kind of man [the country]3706-the country]3015-the kind of man the country wants , [Archer]430-archer . If [the stable]3017-the stable 's ever to be cleaned out , [[men]867-men like [you]3014-the professional politician]3019-men like you have got to lend a hand in the cleaning . " "[867-men] Men like [you--]3020-you-- " how [Archer]430-archer had glowed at the phrase ! How eagerly [he]430-archer had risen up at the call ! It was an echo of [Ned Winsett]326-winsett 's old appeal to roll [his]326-winsett sleeves up and get down into the muck ; but spoken by [a man who set the example of the gesture]5182-a man who set the example of the gesture , and whose summons to follow [him]326-winsett was irresistible . [Archer]430-archer , as [he]430-archer looked back , was not sure that [men like [himself]430-archer]5183-men like himself WERE what [[his]430-archer country]5184-his country needed , at least in the active service to which [Theodore Roosevelt]501-theodore roosevelt had pointed ; in fact , there was reason to think it did not , for after a year in [the State Assembly]190-the state assembly [he]430-archer had not been re - elected , and had dropped back thankfully into obscure if useful municipal work , and from that again to the writing of occasional articles in one of the reforming weeklies that were trying to shake [the country]3706-the country out of its apathy . It was little enough to look back on ; but when [he]430-archer remembered to what [the young men of [his]430-archer generation]5186-the young men of his generation and [his]430-archer set had looked forward -- the narrow groove of money - making , sport and society to which [their]5186-the young men of his generation vision had been limited -- even [his]430-archer small contribution to the new state of things seemed to count , as each brick counts in a well - built wall . [He]430-archer had done little in public life ; [he]430-archer would always be by nature [a contemplative and a dilettante]5187-a contemplative and a dilettante ; but [he]430-archer had had high things to contemplate , great things to delight in ; and [one great man]5188-one great man 's friendship to be [his]430-archer strength and pride . [He]430-archer had been , in short , what [people]637-people were beginning to call "[867-men] [a good citizen]3021-a good citizen . " In [New York]2-new york , for many years past , every new movement , philanthropic , municipal or artistic , had taken account of [his]430-archer opinion and wanted [his]430-archer name . [People]637-people said : "[430-archer] Ask [Archer]430-archer " when there was a question of starting [the first school for [crippled children]5192-crippled children]5191-the first school for crippled children , reorganising [the Museum of Art]2856-the museum of art , founding [the Grolier Club]5194-the grolier club , inaugurating [the new Library]5195-the new library , or getting up [a new society of chamber music]5196-a new society of chamber music . [His]430-archer days were full , and they were filled decently . [He]430-archer supposed it was all [a man]933-a man ought to ask . Something [he]430-archer knew [he]430-archer had missed : the flower of life . But [he]430-archer thought of it now as a thing so unattainable and improbable that to have repined would have been like despairing because [one]519-one had not drawn the first prize in a lottery . There were a hundred million tickets in [HIS]430-archer lottery , and there was only one prize ; the chances had been too decidedly against [him]430-archer . When [he]430-archer thought of [Ellen Olenska]232-ellen it was abstractly , serenely , as [one]519-one might think of some imaginary beloved in a book or a picture : [she]232-ellen had become the composite vision of all that [he]430-archer had missed . That vision , faint and tenuous as it was , had kept [him]430-archer from thinking of [other women]5200-other women . [He]430-archer had been what was called [a faithful husband]5201-a faithful husband ; and when [May]430-archer had suddenly died -- carried off by the infectious pneumonia through which [she]232-ellen had nursed [[their]5202-their youngest child]5203-their youngest child -- [he]430-archer had honestly mourned [her]232-ellen . [Their]5202-their long years together had shown [him]430-archer that it did not so much matter if marriage was a dull duty , as long as it kept the dignity of a duty : lapsing from that , it became a mere battle of ugly appetites . Looking about [him]430-archer , [he]430-archer honoured [his]430-archer own past , and mourned for it . After all , there was good in the old ways . [His]430-archer eyes , making the round of [the room]991-the room -- done over by [Dallas]498-dallas with English mezzotints , Chippendale cabinets , bits of chosen blue - and - white and pleasantly shaded electric lamps -- came back to the old [Eastlake]191-eastlake writing - table that [he]430-archer had never been willing to banish , and to [his]430-archer first photograph of [May]430-archer , which still kept its place beside [his]430-archer inkstand . There [she]232-ellen was , tall , round - bosomed and willowy , in [her]232-ellen starched muslin and flapping Leghorn , as [he]430-archer had seen [her]232-ellen under the orange - trees in [the Mission garden]2853-the mission garden . And as [he]430-archer had seen [her]232-ellen that day , so [she]232-ellen had remained ; never quite at the same height , yet never far below it : generous , faithful , unwearied ; but so lacking in imagination , so incapable of growth , that [the world]580-the world of [her]232-ellen youth had fallen into pieces and rebuilt itself without [her]232-ellen ever being conscious of the change . This hard bright blindness had kept [her]232-ellen immediate horizon apparently unaltered . [Her]232-ellen incapacity to recognise change made [[her]232-ellen children]726-her children conceal [their]726-her children views from [her]232-ellen as [Archer]430-archer concealed [his]430-archer ; there had been , from the first , a joint pretence of sameness , a kind of innocent family hypocrisy , in which [father]5208-father and [children]3115-children had unconsciously collaborated . And [she]232-ellen had died thinking [the world]580-the world a good place , full of [loving and harmonious households like [her]232-ellen own]5211-loving and harmonious households like her own , and resigned to leave [it]580-the world because [she]232-ellen was convinced that , whatever happened , [Newland]214-archer would continue to inculcate in [Dallas]498-dallas the same principles and prejudices which had shaped [[his]430-archer parents]5212-his parents ' lives , and that [Dallas]498-dallas in turn ( when [Newland]214-archer followed [her]232-ellen ) would transmit the sacred trust to [little Bill]500-bill . And of [Mary]309-mary [she]309-mary was sure as of [her]309-mary own self . So , having snatched [little Bill]500-bill from the grave , and given [her]309-mary life in the effort , [she]309-mary went contentedly to [her]309-mary place in [the Archer vault in [St. Mark 's]192-st. mark 's]5213-the archer vault in st. mark 's , where [Mrs. Archer]214-archer already lay safe from the terrifying "[430-archer] trend " which [[her]214-archer daughter - in - law]552-her daughter - in - law had never even become aware of . [Opposite May]430-archer 's portrait stood one of [[her]214-archer daughter]553-her daughter . [Mary Chivers]502-mary chivers was as tall and fair as [[her]502-mary chivers mother]605-her mother , but large - waisted , flat - chested and slightly slouching , as the altered fashion required . [Mary Chivers]502-mary chivers 's mighty feats of athleticism could not have been performed with the twenty - inch waist that [May Archer]430-archer 's azure sash so easily spanned . And the difference seemed symbolic ; [the mother]960-the mother 's life had been as closely girt as [her]960-the mother figure . [Mary]502-mary chivers , who was no less conventional , and no more intelligent , yet led a larger life and held more tolerant views . There was good in the new order too . The telephone clicked , and [Archer]430-archer , turning from the photographs , unhooked the transmitter at [his]430-archer elbow . How far [they]5218-they were from the days when the legs of [the brass - buttoned messenger boy]5219-the brass - buttoned messenger boy had been [New York]2-new york 's only means of quick communication ! "[0-i] [Chicago]193-chicago wants [you]3022-you . " Ah -- it must be a long - distance from [Dallas]498-dallas , who had been sent to [Chicago]193-chicago by [[his]498-dallas firm]5220-his firm to talk over the plan of [the Lakeside palace [they]3024-we were to build for [a young millionaire with ideas]5222-a young millionaire with ideas]5221-the lakeside palace they were to build for a young millionaire with ideas . [The firm]1482-the firm always sent [Dallas]498-dallas on such errands . "[0-i] [Hallo]480-hallo , [Dad]3013-dad -- Yes : [Dallas]498-dallas . [I]0-i say -- how do [you]498-dallas feel about sailing on Wednesday ? [Mauretania]194-mauretania : Yes , next Wednesday as ever is . [[Our]3024-we client]1507-our client wants [me]0-i to look at [some Italian gardens]3026-some italian gardens before [we]3024-we settle anything , and has asked [me]0-i to nip over on [the next boat]3027-the next boat . [I]0-i 've got to be back on the first of June-- " the voice broke into a joyful conscious laugh--"so[3024-we] [we]3024-we must look alive . [I]0-i say , [Dad]3013-dad , [I]0-i want [your]3013-dad help : do come . " [Dallas]498-dallas seemed to be speaking in [the room]991-the room : the voice was as near by and natural as if [he]498-dallas had been lounging in [his]498-dallas favourite arm - chair by the fire . The fact would not ordinarily have surprised [Archer]430-archer , for long - distance telephoning had become as much a matter of course as electric lighting and five - day Atlantic voyages . But the laugh did startle [him]430-archer ; it still seemed wonderful that across all those miles and miles of country -- forest , [river]5225-river , [mountain , prairie]5226-mountain , prairie , [roaring cities]5227-roaring cities and [busy indifferent millions]5228-busy indifferent millions -- [Dallas]498-dallas 's laugh should be able to say : "[0-i] Of course , whatever happens , [I]0-i must get back on the first , because [Fanny Beaufort]503-fanny and [I]0-i are to be married on the fifth . " The voice began again : "[3013-dad] Think it over ? No , [sir]3197-sir : not a minute . [You]3197-sir 've got to say yes now . Why not , [I]0-i 'd like to know ? If [you]3197-sir can allege a single reason -- No ; [I]0-i knew it . Then it 's a go , eh ? Because [I]0-i count on [you]3197-sir to ring up [the Cunard office]3030-the cunard office first thing tomorrow ; and [you]3197-sir 'd better book a return on [a boat]3031-a boat from [Marseilles]195-marseilles . [I]0-i say , [Dad]504-dad ; it 'll be [our]3032-their last time together , in this kind of way-- . Oh , good ! [I]0-i knew [you]3197-sir would . " Chicago rang off , and [Archer]430-archer rose and began to pace up and down [the room]991-the room . It would be [their]3032-their last time together in this kind of way : [the boy]3676-the boy was right . [They]3032-their would have lots of other "[3197-sir] times " after [Dallas]498-dallas 's marriage , [[his]3676-the boy father]4324-his father was sure ; for [the two]797-the two were born [comrades]5233-comrades , and [Fanny Beaufort]503-fanny , whatever one might think of [her]503-fanny , did not seem likely to interfere with [their]3032-their intimacy . On the contrary , from what [he]4324-his father had seen of [her]503-fanny , [he]4324-his father thought [she]503-fanny would be naturally included in it . Still , change was change , and differences were differences , and much as [he]4324-his father felt [himself]4324-his father drawn toward [[his]4324-his father future daughter - in - law]5234-his future daughter - in - law , it was tempting to seize this last chance of being alone with [[his]4324-his father boy]5235-his boy . There was no reason why [he]4324-his father should not seize it , except the profound one that [he]4324-his father had lost the habit of travel . [May]430-archer had disliked to move except for valid reasons , such as taking [the children]1586-the children to [the sea]4358-the sea or in [the mountains]4253-the mountains : [she]503-fanny could imagine no other motive for leaving [the house]532-the house in [Thirty - ninth Street]20-thirty - fourth street or [[their]3032-their comfortable quarters at the Wellands ' in [Newport]104-newport]5240-their comfortable quarters at the wellands ' in newport . After [Dallas]498-dallas had taken [his]498-dallas degree [she]503-fanny had thought it [her]503-fanny duty to travel for six months ; and [the whole family]1511-the whole family had made the old - fashioned tour through [England]28-england , [Switzerland]124-switzerland and [Italy]63-italy . [Their]3032-their time being limited ( [no one]619-no one knew why ) [they]3032-their had omitted [France]197-france . [Archer]430-archer remembered [Dallas]498-dallas 's wrath at being asked to contemplate [Mont Blanc]198-mont blanc instead of [Rheims]199-rheims and [Chartres]200-chartres . But [Mary]502-mary chivers and [Bill]500-bill wanted mountain - climbing , and had already yawned [their]3032-their way in [[Dallas]498-dallas 's wake]5243-dallas 's wake through [the English cathedrals]5244-the english cathedrals ; and [May]430-archer , always fair to [[her]502-mary chivers children]726-her children , had insisted on holding the balance evenly between [their]726-her children athletic and artistic proclivities . [She]502-mary chivers had indeed proposed that [[her]502-mary chivers husband]663-her husband should go to [Paris]3-paris for a fortnight , and join [them]726-her children on [the Italian lakes]3091-the italian lakes after [they]726-her children had "[0-i] done " [Switzerland]124-switzerland ; but [Archer]430-archer had declined . "[3197-sir] [We]3033-we 'll stick together , " [he]430-archer said ; and [May]430-archer 's face had brightened at [his]430-archer setting such a good example to [Dallas]498-dallas . Since [her]502-mary chivers death , nearly two years before , there had been no reason for [his]430-archer continuing in the same routine . [[His]430-archer children]5248-his children had urged [him]430-archer to travel : [Mary Chivers]502-mary chivers had felt sure it would do [him]430-archer good to go abroad and "[3197-sir] see [the galleries]3602-the galleries . " The very mysteriousness of such a cure made [her]502-mary chivers the more confident of its efficacy . But [Archer]430-archer had found [himself]430-archer held fast by habit , by memories , by a sudden startled shrinking from new things . Now , as [he]430-archer reviewed [his]430-archer past , [he]430-archer saw into what a deep rut [he]430-archer had sunk . The worst of doing one 's duty was that it apparently unfitted [one]519-one for doing anything else . At least that was the view that [the men of [[his]430-archer generation]5251-his generation had taken]5250-the men of his generation had taken . The trenchant divisions between right and wrong , honest and dishonest , respectable and the reverse , had left so little scope for the unforeseen . There are moments when [a man]933-a man 's imagination , so easily subdued to what it lives in , suddenly rises above its daily level , and surveys the long windings of destiny . [Archer]430-archer hung there and wondered .... What was left of [the little world [he]430-archer had grown up in]5253-the little world he had grown up in , and whose standards had bent and bound [him]430-archer ? [He]430-archer remembered a sneering prophecy of poor [Lawrence Lefferts]223-lawrence lefferts 's , uttered years ago in [that very room]5254-that very room : "[3197-sir] If things go on at this rate , [[our]3035-our children]2982-our children will be marrying [[Beaufort]503-fanny 's bastards]2985-beaufort 's bastards . " It was just what [[Archer]430-archer 's eldest son]5255-archer 's eldest son , the pride of [his]430-archer life , was doing ; and [nobody]3102-nobody wondered or reproved . Even [[the boy]3676-the boy 's Aunt Janey , who still looked so exactly as [she]5258-the boy 's aunt janey , who still looked so exactly as she used to in her elderly youth used to in [her]5258-the boy 's aunt janey , who still looked so exactly as she used to in her elderly youth elderly youth]5258-the boy 's aunt janey , who still looked so exactly as she used to in her elderly youth , had taken [[her]5258-the boy 's aunt janey , who still looked so exactly as she used to in her elderly youth mother]605-her mother 's emeralds and seed - pearls out of their pink cotton - wool , and carried them with [her]5258-the boy 's aunt janey , who still looked so exactly as she used to in her elderly youth own twitching hands to [the future bride]5260-the future bride ; and [Fanny Beaufort]503-fanny , instead of looking disappointed at not receiving a "[3197-sir] set " from [a Paris jeweller]5261-a paris jeweller , had exclaimed at [their]5262-their old - fashioned beauty , and declared that when [she]5258-the boy 's aunt janey , who still looked so exactly as she used to in her elderly youth wore them [she]5258-the boy 's aunt janey , who still looked so exactly as she used to in her elderly youth should feel like [an Isabey miniature]1255-an isabey miniature . [Fanny Beaufort]503-fanny , who had appeared in [New York]2-new york at eighteen , after the death of [[her]503-fanny parents]1025-her parents , had won its heart much as [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska had won it thirty years earlier ; only instead of being distrustful and afraid of [her]503-fanny , society took [her]503-fanny joyfully for granted . [She]503-fanny was pretty , amusing and accomplished : what more did [any one]1150-any one want ? [Nobody]3102-nobody was narrow - minded enough to rake up against [her]503-fanny the half - forgotten facts of [[her]503-fanny father]3653-her father 's past and [her]503-fanny own origin . Only [the older people]5268-the older people remembered so obscure an incident in the business life of [New York]2-new york as [Beaufort]503-fanny 's failure , or the fact that after [[his]3653-her father wife]572-his wife 's death [he]3653-her father had been quietly married to the notorious [Fanny Ring]349-miss fanny ring , and had left [the country]3706-the country with [[his]3653-her father new wife]5271-his new wife , and [a little girl who inherited [her]349-miss fanny ring beauty]5272-a little girl who inherited her beauty . [He]3653-her father was subsequently heard of in [Constantinople]186-constantinople , then in [Russia]61-russia ; and a dozen years later [American travellers]5273-american travellers were handsomely entertained by [him]3653-her father in [Buenos Ayres]201-buenos ayres , where [he]3653-her father represented [a large insurance agency]5274-a large insurance agency . [He]3653-her father and [[his]3653-her father wife]572-his wife died [there]732-there in the odour of prosperity ; and one day [[their]5277-their orphaned daughter]5278-their orphaned daughter had appeared in [New York]2-new york in charge of [[May Archer]430-archer 's sister - in - law]5279-may archer 's sister - in - law , [[Mrs. Jack Welland]218-mrs. welland , whose husband had been appointed [[the girl]557-the girl 's guardian]5282-the girl 's guardian]5280-mrs. jack welland , whose husband had been appointed the girl 's guardian . The fact threw [her]557-the girl into almost cousinly relationship with [[Newland Archer]214-archer 's children]5283-newland archer 's children , and [nobody]3102-nobody was surprised when [Dallas]498-dallas 's engagement was announced . Nothing could more dearly give the measure of the distance that [the world]580-the world had travelled . [People nowadays]5286-people nowadays were too busy -- busy with reforms and "[3197-sir] movements , " with fads and fetishes and frivolities -- to bother much about [[their]5286-people nowadays neighbours]5287-their neighbours . And of what account was [anybody]3094-anybody 's past , in the huge kaleidoscope where [all the social atoms spun around on the same plane]5289-all the social atoms spun around on the same plane ? [Newland Archer]214-archer , looking out of [his]430-archer hotel window at the stately gaiety of [the Paris streets]5290-the paris streets , felt [his]430-archer heart beating with the confusion and eagerness of youth . It was long since it had thus plunged and reared under [his]430-archer widening waistcoat , leaving [him]430-archer , the next minute , with an empty breast and hot temples . [He]430-archer wondered if it was thus that [[his]430-archer son]5291-his son 's conducted itself in the presence of [Miss Fanny Beaufort]503-fanny -- and decided that it was not . "[3197-sir] It functions as actively , no doubt , but the rhythm is different , " [he]430-archer reflected , recalling the cool composure with which [the young man]527-the young man had announced [his]527-the young man engagement , and taken for granted that [[his]527-the young man family]1142-his family would approve . "[3197-sir] The difference is that [these young people]3038-these young people take it for granted that [they]3038-these young people 're going to get whatever [they]3038-these young people want , and that [we]3039-we almost always took it for granted that [we]3039-we should n't . Only , [I]0-i wonder -- the thing one 's so certain of in advance : can it ever make [one]519-one 's heart beat as wildly ? " It was the day after [their]3039-we arrival in [Paris]3-paris , and the spring sunshine held [Archer]214-archer in [his]430-archer open window , above the wide silvery prospect of [the Place Vendome]5294-the place vendome . " "[3043-the bristol] Oh , all right -- of course , " [Dallas]498-dallas good - naturedly agreed . "[3043-the bristol] [I]0-i 'll take [you]3041-you to [some jolly old - fashioned place]3042-some jolly old - fashioned place -- [the Bristol]3043-the bristol say-- " leaving [[his]3041-you father]4324-his father speechless at hearing that [the century - long home of [kings]5299-kings and [emperors]5300-emperors]5298-the century - long home of kings and emperors was now spoken of as [an old - fashioned inn]5301-an old - fashioned inn , where one went for [its]5301-an old - fashioned inn quaint inconveniences and lingering local colour . [Archer]214-archer had pictured often enough , in the first impatient years , the scene of [his]430-archer return to [Paris]3-paris ; then the personal vision had faded , and [he]430-archer had simply tried to see [the city]2226-the city as the setting of [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska 's life . " [Archer]430-archer did not accompany [[his]430-archer son]5291-his son to [Versailles]202-versailles . [He]430-archer preferred to spend the afternoon in solitary roamings through [Paris]3-paris . [He]430-archer had to deal all at once with the packed regrets and stifled memories of an inarticulate lifetime . To [the boy]3676-the boy , no doubt , the episode was only a pathetic instance of vain frustration , of wasted forces . But was it really no more ? For a long time [Archer]430-archer sat on a bench in [the Champs Elysees]5326-the champs elysees and wondered , while the stream of life rolled by .... [A few streets away]5327-a few streets away , a few hours away , [Ellen Olenska]232-ellen waited . [She]232-ellen had never gone back to [[her]232-ellen husband]663-her husband , and when [he]663-her husband had died , some years before , [she]232-ellen had made no change in [her]232-ellen way of living . After all , [his]430-archer life had been too starved .... [Archer]430-archer knew that [Madame Olenska]240-madame olenska lived in [a square near [one of the avenues radiating from [the Invalides]206-the invalides]5353-one of the avenues radiating from the invalides]5352-a square near one of the avenues radiating from the invalides ; and [he]430-archer had pictured [the quarter]5354-the quarter as quiet and almost obscure , forgetting the central splendour that lit [it]5354-the quarter up . For nearly thirty years , [her]240-madame olenska life -- of which [he]430-archer knew so strangely little -- had been spent in this rich atmosphere that [he]430-archer already felt to be too dense and yet too stimulating for [his]430-archer lungs . " "[3077-she] Go , [[my]0-i boy]3078-my boy ; perhaps [I]0-i shall follow [you]3078-my boy . " [Dallas]498-dallas gave [him]3078-my boy a long look through the twilight . "[0-i] But what on earth shall [I]0-i say ? " "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear fellow]3209-my dear fellow , do n't [you]3209-my dear fellow always know what to say ? " [[his]3078-my boy father]4324-his father rejoined with a smile . "[3209-my dear fellow] Very well . [I]0-i shall say [you]3209-my dear fellow 're old - fashioned , and prefer walking up [the five flights]3080-the five flights because [you]3209-my dear fellow do n't like lifts . " [[His]3078-my boy father]4324-his father smiled again . "[0-i] Say [I]0-i 'm old - fashioned : that 's enough . " [Dallas]498-dallas looked at [him]3078-my boy again , and then , with an incredulous gesture , passed out of sight under the vaulted doorway . [Archer]430-archer sat down on the bench and continued to gaze at [the awninged balcony]5388-the awninged balcony . [He]4324-his father calculated the time it would take [[his]4324-his father son]5291-his son to be carried up in [the lift]5390-the lift to [the fifth floor]5391-the fifth floor , to ring the bell , and be admitted to [the hall]755-the hall , and then ushered into [the drawing - room]983-the drawing - room . [He]4324-his father pictured [Dallas]498-dallas entering [that room]2811-that room with [his]498-dallas quick assured step and [his]498-dallas delightful smile , and wondered if [the people]3892-the people were right who said that [[his]4324-his father boy]5235-his boy "[3081-him] took after [him]3081-him . " Then [he]4324-his father tried to see [the persons already in [the room]991-the room]5397-the persons already in the room -- for probably at that sociable hour there would be more than one -- and among [them]5397-the persons already in the room [a dark lady , pale and dark , who would look up quickly , half rise , and hold out a long thin hand with three rings on it]5399-a dark lady , pale and dark , who would look up quickly , half rise , and hold out a long thin hand with three rings on it .... [He]3082-he thought [she]5399-a dark lady , pale and dark , who would look up quickly , half rise , and hold out a long thin hand with three rings on it would be sitting in a sofa - corner near the fire , with azaleas banked behind [her]5399-a dark lady , pale and dark , who would look up quickly , half rise , and hold out a long thin hand with three rings on it on a table . "[3081-him] It 's more real to [me]0-i here than if [I]0-i went up , " [he]3082-he suddenly heard [himself]3082-he say ; and the fear lest that last shadow of reality should lose its edge kept [him]3082-he rooted to [his]3082-he seat as the minutes succeeded each other . [He]3082-he sat for a long time on the bench in the thickening dusk , [his]3082-he eyes never turning from [the balcony]3083-the balcony . At length a light shone through the windows , and a moment later [a man - servant]3084-a man - servant came out on [the balcony]3083-the balcony , drew up the awnings , and closed the shutters . At that , as if it had been the signal [he]3082-he waited for , [Newland Archer]214-archer got up slowly and walked back alone to [[his]3082-he hotel]3086-his hotel . A Note on the Text The Age of Innocence first appeared in four large installments in The Pictorial Review , from July to October 1920 . It was published that same year in book form by [D. Appleton]209-d. appleton and Company in [New York]2-new york and in [London]79-london . [Wharton]508-wharton made extensive stylistic , punctuation , and spelling changes and revisions between the serial and book publication , and more than thirty subsequent changes were made after the second impression of the book edition had been run off . This authoritative text is reprinted from the Library of America edition of Novels by [Edith Wharton]508-wharton , and is based on the sixth impression of the first edition , which incorporates the last set of extensive revisions that are obviously authorial . * * *
